text: Would never come back to this Quiznos again. We showed up at 10:50am on Sunday and sign says doesn't open till 11am, which i can respect so I waited in my car till 11am and then I go to the door and the lights are still out and it appears that an employee had just arrived and she is giving my wife and I the one minute signal through the window. We stand outside and wait, mind you it's winter and cold. We wait a couple minutes outside and then a second employee arrived and says to us "it's not open yet"? The  employee inside lets the other one in and proceeds to tell us to wait longer in which it is 11:05 at this time and none of the veggies and sandwich meat had been out so we decided to go somewhere else. They could have at least allowed us to wait inside. Clearly punctuality is not important to the employees of this store.
name: Quiznos

text:
The girl who did my sandwich didn't ask me much before she started putting condiments and stuff on my bread. I asked for a turkey sandwich with avocado and she starts putting on mayo on it... 
She also took her gloves off and ran outside to look at a plane in the middle of making my sandwich. I was the only customer in there. 
The other woman who was in charge of my veggies seemed bothered by my presence. She didn't give me choices or anything. 
I give it 2 stars instead of one because alas, it did not kill me... but, I will not be returning anytime soon.
name: Quiznos

text:
This remodel of an old favorite on California popped up on my Yelp when I was searching for a place that had good gluten free options. 

We came in on a Tuesday night to check it out. The bar and finding space is very nice and was kept super clean and we were greeted right away by the staff. Our waitress was super attentive and very friendly. 

Their menu is clearly labeled with what options are gluten free and you can make additions or substitutions to most of the menu items easily. 

We got the wings which were fried up super crispy and the sauce was really flavorful and sticky. They use a heavily herbed house made ranch that really pulled the dish together too. Some of the best wings I've had in Reno for sure. 

I also got the grilled fish tacos, which were good, but they were missing a little something. The coleslaw was very sweet and the salsa wasn't spicy enough I think. But the 4 small tacos really filled me up. 

They also offer a full bar with an array of local offerings as well. Definitely a good spot for lunch or dinner.
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
2021 Reno Food & Drink Week last business for this years event....  Empienada had a chosen special.  But we didn't get it, because my wife just wanted what she wanted!  Instead of the Mediterranean pot pie special we loaded up for a few meals.  
2 pork and sweet potato empanadas. 
1 Cheeseburger empanada 
1 Chicken Pot Pie 
1 order of Risotto Balls 
1 frozen Cajun pie 
1 side salad. 

All of it was really good.  My favorite was probably the Risotto Balls.  They were excellent even when we reheated the leftovers the next day.  The Chicken Pot Pie was ready to eat so I at it right out front on the picnic tables in front of the restaurant.  I wonder if the pies are allowed at the bars nearby because that would be a match made in heaven.  The website was a little wonky for ordering but calling in did the trick.   I look forward to a cheat day and getting these in the future.  And hopefully they will still have that Mediterranean Pie to try then.    Reno Food & Drink Week I can't wait until next year!!
name: emPIEnada

text:
This spot is pretty rad. I have been waiting for it to open, was so sad when TRBG closed. So when we saw this was coming, we were chomping at the bit.

First, I would recommend avoiding Friday nights. It's BUSY! Which is great for them, but it's hard to get a spot. 

Saturday afternoons, and Sunday afternoons are great times to pop in. 

The atmosphere is awesome, I love the black walls, the brick, the new location of the bar. Everything flows nicely, and it's way nicer than the old spot. It's new, and feels fresh.

The employees are all amazing, so nice, and super helpful. 

The food. Oh man, the food. I haven't had anything that I haven't loved. The brussels are AMAZING! I had just that one night for dinner. The burgers are good, salads are good. The menu is HUGE too. You are sure to find something that you will like. Did I mention the truffle fries!? Yum!

Go check this place out, I promise, you won't be disappointed.
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
I had been wanting to come to this place for a while but my visit was a total let down. 

While I understand maybe they were short staffed or something, there were at least three people that day at that time so I'm not sure how many people it takes to run the show. 

There was nothing available to eat or to go. I was offered a couple of frozen pies to take home or if I wanted a pie here it would be 1hr wait for it to cook. The menu board/TV was not working so I had to look at the menu in their checkout screen but again, they only had 3-4 available pies. 

Not sure why it is called "empienada" the name implies they have pies and "empanadas" or meat patties but nope.

I didn't eat nor take anything to go with me so I don't know how their pies are.

The staff was friendly and helpful.

text:
The Quiznos of Reno are spread out so far, so it is pretty much the opposite of Subways, which are found on pretty much every street corner. Perhaps it is the low frequency at which I eat Quiznos that makes me like it so much. That toasty flavor is tantalizing.

This location in particular is special because even when corporate discontinued the honey bourbon chicken sandwich (probably the best sauce on a sandwich I have ever had), these guys would still make it for me...until they ran out of the honey bourbon sauce. But the extra effort they made to satisfy me was very significant. Now I enjoy the Baja Chicken or the Southwest chicken to satisfy my spicy sweet chicken sandwich cravings. I wish they would bring back that Honey Bourbon Chicken though!
name: Quiznos

text:
Welcome to the neighborhood, Old Southwest Social House! Pull up a chair and stay awhile, because it is SO good to have you here!

This spot was on our radar long before it opened, mostly because of location (close neighborhood bar FTW!), but also because of what appeared to be a rockstar menu, one that we knew would thwart our efforts of choosing the BEST thing on it. Too many good things! From the apps to the salads and burgers to the long list of yummy entrees, Old Southwest has curated a tasty menu that proves impossible to choose from. So we had to go a half dozen times to try as much as possible!

So far, I have to say that the bacon & Brussels sprouts app is one of my favorite things ever! It know... it's vegetables, on the app menu, but it is SO GOOD! The portion is gigantic, Brussels cooked to perfection (fried I think, yum!), and this balsamic glaze drizzled all over it that just puts everything over the top. 

Another one of the menu items that I would specifically visit this spot for is the Poutine. OMG, poutine with tater tots sounds blasphemous, I know - but it is AMAZING. Super crispy well-seasoned tots, house made steak/bacon gravy (!!!), cheesy cheese curds melting all over... it's a hungover Canadian's dream! And again, the portion is ridiculous, completely and utterly shareable. I seriously tell everyone I know about this dish because it's so epic!

More items that are worth tasting - seared ahi app, Thai chicken salad, and the fish fries (basically fish + chips.) The thing is, we keep going back expecting to find something we don't like, but everything has been, at the bare minimum, tasty! On top of that, we've always have excellent service in a nice chill atmosphere. They have machines if gaming is your thing, but it still doesn't feel like a sports bar - plenty of windows, natural light, and a small yet modern space to hang out. 

When it comes to great food, a fun environment, and awesome service with a smile, Old Southwest nails it every time. So glad to have them in the neighborhood!
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
Boy do I love a good hand pie aka empanada aka pastie aka a whole lotta names depending where you're at in the world! There's something about the flaky dough and rich, often stew like filling that's just so satisfying and soul soothing. 

When I heard about EmPienada my heart went a flutter, and I finally had the chance to try them vis the food truck at the NYEP Fall Festival at Bartley Ranch. 

My wife got one of the combo deals and since we decided to eat late, the choices were more limited than we'd have liked. We tried the French onion and the vegetable fajita empanadas, along with their fried stuffed potato balls. The meal came with three dipping sauces, curry mustard, herb sour cream and a spicy aioli.  

The French onion was creative and surprisingly delicious. It had all the hallmarks of a good French onion soup, from rich beef broth flavor, tender onions, and melty stringy cheese. The flaky pastry was the perfect sub for the crouton! The veggie fajita was good as well with vibrant fresh veggies in a southwestern flavored sauce inside the flaky pastry. A solid vegetarian option.

Now the potato balls aka croquettes (at least to me) were delicious. Well seasoned bread crumbs created a golden brown crust around soft and pillowy mashed potatoes that had a delicious filling in the middle. After a dunk in any of the sauces you were off to the next level.

It was a warm day, so maybe not the ideal conditions for this type of food, but it went down easy. We did enjoy it, but personally it's not the kind of food I can reach for repeatedly. That may not be the case for everyone though, and if this is your jam, then you will love EmPienada.

As for me, I need to try more variety from them. I could easily hit on a flavor I can't get enough of, which would propel this spot into a higher rating from me.
name: emPIEnada

text:
We could not decide what to do for dinner tonight and my wife remembered this place had recently opened. So, we decided to check it out. 

We walked in, were greeted and told to have a seat wherever we liked. We decided to have a seat at the bar so I could try my luck at a slot machine.  

The place is an open concept with the bar occupying the left side and the "Dining area" on the right which included tables and a few booths with a wide range of occupancy. We noticed about 5 large screen TV's displaying random sports across the interior. We were very surprised how much this place changed inside compared the prior establishment. It was very clean with an industrial type sports bar feel. 

After we sat down, Shay brought us food and drink menus. We checked out the menu, Shay came back and we ordered drinks but we still did not know what we wanted to try. When Shay brought the drinks, we asked a few questions and my wife decided on the Asian Chicken Salad at the recommendation of Shay. I decided to try the Poutine, knowing I would have leftovers. We discussed several other things on the menu we want to try including the burgers which Shay also recommended. 

We asked how long they have been open and were told about 3 weeks. 

Our meals arrived a short while later and looked amazing. We were both really impressed with the taste of each of them. The cheese curds and tater tots in the poutine were awesome. 

This was a really good experience and we will back. We could see this place as a regular spot for us. I also was able to triple my money on the slot machine I was playing.

We think this is a great addition to Reno.
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
This is a cute little spot in the corner of the Viewcrest Shopping Center at Kings Row. I've had empanadas before, but never in Reno so this was a must try! 

Service is really good, they're genuinely friendly and fast. I bought the cheeseburger and the beef and mushroom. The order comes with sauce, so I got the cilantro lime sour cream and the sriracha Mayo. I got my order within 10 min max. They don't have dine it options, but there are seats outside in the courtyard. 

Overall, I was underwhelmed. Maybe it's because I've only ever had empanadas a few times in my life that I don't know what it's supposed to taste like. But in general, everything was lacking in flavor, including salt. The sauces were also bland and didn't really add to anything. 

Service was so good and the staff were really nice though, so I'm willing to give it another try.

text:
I'd heard some great things about this new addition to the scene and ventured by to see what the buzz was about. So glad I did!

They're located in the former Truckee River Bar and Grill location and they've spruced the place up nicely with some new decor, etc...I found it very inviting.

It wasn't too busy when I rolled in for lunch and I planted myself at the spacious bar...always my favorite place to sit when bar seating is available.

The bartender/server, Teshina, greeted me right away and asked me if I wanted a menu and a drink...yes to both. She was very personable and cheery. I inquired as to draft beers that were available and she gave me the rundown on what they had on tap. I chose a Samuel Adams Oktoberfest...great beer when it's available in season. One note...I had a slight bit of "sticker shock" when I got my bill later...$8.50 for a pint! I consider that a little high for a bar/restaurant by a couple of dollars.

After perusing the menu, which has quite the variety of foods from standard bar fare to gastropub style selections available, I chose:

Asian Chicken Salad - ($13)
Mixed greens with coconut lime chicken, celery, orange supremes, cashews, carrots and cilantro tossed in toasted sesame dressing topped with fried wontons.

Quite the generous portion of crispy, fresh greens and the accoutrements added great flavor and texture. The chicken was seasoned nicely and was moist and juicy. I really liked the dressing. Great balance of flavors and well worth the price!

You have your choice of Fries or Tater Tots...or you can substitute Soup or Salad for $1...Onion Rings for $2.

I got the Soup of the Day, which was Loaded Baked Potato!
I added bacon to the soup. ($2)
You gotta have bacon on a loaded baked potato, even if it's soup, right?
I'm a sucker for this type of soup and it did not disappoint...absolutely delicious...

I plan to drop by to try some of the other enticing menu offerings.

Give them a try, I know you'll like it...
name: Old Southwest Social House

She gave me insight to all my questions and helped me pick out what I got.  I ordered 2 Combo meals, Chicken & Waffle, Beef & Mushroom, Pork & Sweet Potato and Cheeseburger Empanadas.  They were all good but the Cheeseburger and Chicken & Waffle was the best!!!  I also had the risotto balls and loaded mashed potato balls, both were fantastic!!!

They even had a gluten free Empanada and my sister n law said it was amazing!!!  

Price was good and you get a lot of food for the money.  I might even go back again tonight lol.

And chicken and waffles empanada was surprisingly good! The spicy Mayo with the loaded baked potato balls were 

Definitely try this place out

text:
I definitely love my regular haunts, but some nights it's just the right time to give a new place a try and see what else the world has to offer. On this night, we gave Old Southwest Social House a try and it definitely has some good points, but also some things to work on. 

The atmosphere is great, modern, clean, and with plenty of seating at the bar and in the restaurant. We were there at kind of an off-time (~3pm), so we were able to snag two seats at the bar without a problem. The service was friendly, and the bartender was willing to give honest recommendations of what she thought we would enjoy (or not, apparently the ham-and-cheese pocket is a no-go in her opinion). Unfortunately, they were out of the first beer that we wanted and our second choice kicked after our first one--leading us to our third choice beer. When we got the check, the pints were $10 each (yikes!). 

The story falls apart with the food. We started with the spinach and caramelized onion dip, which had an okay flavor but didn't really taste like onions of any kind, much less caramelized onions. It tasted a lot like spinach and artichoke dip, and came out pretty thin--we needed to wait awhile before it was dip-able and by then it wasn't hot. The chips served with it, however, were delicious! I got a burger, which was well-done instead of medium, under-seasoned, and ended up being pretty pricey once I added cheese. The fries were only sort of hot and were not crispy, but chewy instead (sad!). The boyfriend got the beef lasagne, which had some good flavor but absolutely no texture--the noodles were overcooked and the beef was so small that it didn't make up for it. 

It's a nice-looking place and I hope they work out the kinks in the coming months, but for a meal that cost more than $100, I definitely would have expected more.
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
What are Empanadas?
Empanadas are baked or fried crescent shaped pastries that can be filled with a variety of ingredients consisting of meats, veggies, and fruits.Â  Â Empanadas orginated from Spain and found their way into popular culture with their portability and delicious texture and flavor possibilities.

EmPIEnada brings this popular food to Reno with their own twists, introducing well known flavors from other cuisines, transforming the traditional empanada into something fun, tasty, and interesting.

Cheeseburger, Gumbo, Beef and Guiness, chicken and waffles, and Italian Meatball are only a few of the options you can find here and the owner is constantly storming up ideas with her team for new creations.

The empanadas have nice clean flavors that shine with freshness and simplicity.Â  The sauces on the side were complimenting and provided another level of flavor (don't forget to ask for them).Â  Whenever possible, the owner will source ingredients locally.

They also have pot pies that have a special kind of dough, a dough that is responsible in creating one of the best chicken pot pies i've had in a long time (i've had some pretty good ones in New York).Â  I was so caught up in the flavor that I didn't get a chance to take some action shots of the filling.Â  There was a generous serving of falky, buttery, and flavorful dough, chunks of meat, veggies, loads of creaminess, and a whole lot of yummy.

Visit EmPIEnada and have yourself a foodie adventure with delicious empanadas and pot pies served with a smile (thanks Kim!).

text:
Came here for dinner tonight with my son. Not a big establishment but cute and clean and modern. Black and grey colors throughout. Large windows letting in lots of natural light. 6 large Tv screens. A cute little sports bar. Our server zoey was sweet and accommodating the entire time. We didn't wait on anything for long. She was great.

My son got the fish and fries. Crispy cod, 3 large pieces. House made tartar sauce and ranch, both were good and A huge bowl of cole slaw, that was creamy and good. On the rich side. I personally prefer the vinegar coleslaw myself.

I tried the tacos, 2 shrimp and 2 cod. I appreciate the cod wasn't fried. The shrimp was small bay shrimp instead of regular sized and that bummed me out some. I wished that the mini corn tortillas they arrived  had some char to them, a little toast goes a long way for texture and flavor. They were just cold tortillas. I asked for hot sauce, the tacos were ok but pretty bland. I hoped they would have an aoli sauce of some sort. I used my sons tartar sauce and it elevated it immensely.

For dessert we both just got the vanilla ice cream plain. Can't really go wrong with that. It was big enough to share for sure. I would like to return to try some other items on the menu for sure. Overall we had a good experience.
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
If you are a lover of home made pot pies but want to skip the cooking, this is THE place.  It's taken a while to get here, as our pups' vet and groomers are located in this strip center, but this will certainly be in our regular rotation.

After checking out the reviews on Yelp! I scanned the pix for the menu, as the website doesn't list ingredients.  I placed the order online Monday for a Tuesday afternoon pickup (pups at the groomers).  Ordered the chicken and the beef/Guinness pot pie as well as a beef/mushroom and pork/yam empanada.  Super easy to do, just remember that the pies are usually made fresh and take about an hour...so keep that in mind...perfection takes time!!).  Without fail, the pups were done 2 hours early, so called to see if we could move the order up.  They said they had the chicken ready, but the beef/Guinness would take about an hour.  So they offered the Gumbo in exchange, which they had ready for inventory.  The empanadas only take about 8 minutes to make.  That worked great for us.

The place is set up for take out only, though there are picnic tables set up that are shared with another eatery.  You walk into the place and you are hit by the savory smells of fresh baking pies (they should make a candle in this scent!!).  Very helpful, friendly staff and had my order ready to go in minutes.  Had to ask how to reheat non-frozen pies (300 degrees for about 30 minutes, though a meat thermometer is highly suggested, as the pies are fully cooked and just need to be heated to serving temperature).  Smelled so good in the car they almost didn't make it home!

Unless your ravenous, the pies are easily sharable, as are the empanadas.  These are real pot pies, with flakey, buttery crust encasing the fillings.  We had the chicken pot pie along with the beef/mushroom empanada.  More than enough for the 2 of us for dinner.  After popping them in the oven for around 20 minutes, they were hot and ready.  The pot pie filling was absolutely delicious, complimented by the savory crust.  Filled with onions, carrots, celery, corn, peas and lots of chicken.  The beef/mushroom empanada is encased in a black sesame dough, filled with beef, mushrooms and peas in a dark savory gravy.  Again, perfect size for dinner...though I could have easily overeaten, it was soooo gooood!!!

We'll have the other pie and empanada for dinner tonight.  2 dinners for under $30 with the taste of homemade.  Yeah, we'll be back to try the other items.  

Highly recommend this place as a regular go-to.
name: emPIEnada

text:
I tried this place out on a recommendation and will be back!  I like the atmosphere, the people there are nice, and the food was great!
Started with the mussels.  They were tasty but the best part (for me) was the white wine sauce and toast. With roasted garlic that spread on the toast like butter and was even better dipped in that sauce!
I ordered the lasagna and it came with a salad I upgraded to a Caesar.  Salad was fantastic!  I'm odd but I wish it had a touch more anchovy taste to the dressing but for a little gastro bar and grill, it was excellent with a great balance.
The lasagna was really tasty.  I love lasagna and I won't say it was the best I've had in Reno, but I would still recommend it.
I heard the potato skins weren't took thick and had a good balance of toppings to potato and the pork ribs were really good.  And another friend told me the Thai salad was amazing, but I didn't try it...yet.

Like I said, I will definitely be back.  Next time I think I'll try the chicken pasta or the beer cheese philly!
name: Old Southwest Social House

text:
I found out about this place because of Reno Food Week. Placed an order by phone yesterday because I couldn't find the special advertised for "Food Week". It was a lamb pot pie. 
I called about 10:45 am and picked up my order at noon. Every thing was hot and ready. The staff was super nice!! 
I ordered the Italian meatball pie, lamb pie, several of their emPIEnadas and their spicy risotto balls, potato balls and mac and cheese balls! The balls were super crispy!! They also provided a couple of dipping sauces for the balls!! My husband and I had enough food for lunch and dinner!! 
Everything was absolutely delish!! I have to say the crust on their pies is spectacular!! One of the best I've ever had... if not THE best!! The meat pies were full of yumminess and loaded with meat. A great value!! 
I will for sure be going back soon!! Sorry no pictures of the food... we ate it all up too fast!!

text:
So I make a pretty tasty chicken pot pie but mine does not compare with the one they sell out of this tiny shop. Not sure what magic they use to make it but it's delicious and stuffed full of moist chicken breast meat. Did I mention it's under $10? What a deal! We also had the beef and mushroom empanada and it was just as good! They also serve various fried balls here. We had the spicy risotto-amazing! Somehow it was crispy on the outside and creamy inside-cooked perfectly! Can't wait to try the other 3-macaroni and cheese, loaded baked potato and scalloped potato. 
Service was very friendly but I don't recommend ordering online until they have some glitches worked out in the system. For now I would call your order in or order in person.
I was told they were going to be offering their menu at Food Truck Friday tomorrow, June 4th. It's worth going just to sample some of their delicious food and if you're already going I recommend buying food from their food truck-I imagine everything they make is great!

text:
I don't know what kind of sorcery occurs in the walls of this little shop. Whatever it is, there needs to be an investigation, because Empienada is serving up fried bundles of magic that have NO RIGHT to be this good!

Ok, let me back up - Empienada is in this little shopping center at the top of Kings Row, right off of McCarren. They do have a food truck that makes it rounds but your best shot at their full menu is right here at their brick n mortar location!

Their empanadas are made fresh and thoughtfully - every one has its own unique dough and generously seasoned fillings. Some come with their own special dipping sauce. Others are absolutely perfect on their own.

I have to first and foremost point you to the Chicken and Waffles empanada with syrup to dip in. It takes a classic flavor and makes it like a hundred times better! The chicken is moist and plentiful... dough is light and crispy... the syrup ties it all together. It is the thing that Brunch dreams are made of!

You can't go wrong with any of their pork items. It's just so tender and flavorful! See: Pork & Sweet Potato and their newest empanada, the Cuban (which is INSANE with their house-made Citrus Mustard! Like I said - sorcery.) There's this fun Cheeseburger one with a sauce that makes it taste EXACTLY like a cheeseburger, just with a freakin' phenomenal paprika-spiked dough. My man has a very special place in his heart for the Beef and Mushroom empanada as well. 

So I'm basically just listing off their entire menu, but the thing is that we've never had a bad empanada here. You can taste the love and passion in every ingredient. The little pies are still fresh, hot, and gorgeously crispy by the time you get them home. The staff is so wonderful and always happy to see you. And seriously, the value for what you get is outrageously good. Just one $5 would fill me up... but I choose to stuff myself silly so that's my fault. 

Empienada is hands-down one of the best new(ish) restaurants/food trucks in Reno! Go order a boatload of empanadas to bring home to your hungry crew. I apologize in advance for the inevitable moment that they beg you to go get more.
name: emPIEnada

text:
Our family loves pot pies! This place is take-out only and specializes in both pot pies and empanadas (hence, the name). The website menu states the name of the pies and empanadas but not the ingredients. I called the shop to find out more about their "Hearty Vegetable" pot pie and learned it is vegan. The website also states that they have their Classic Chicken Pot Pie available every day but everything else requires a one-hour prep time (also confirmed by my call). I placed our online order of two Classic Chicken and two Hearty Vegetable pot pies and received a text stating it would be ready in an hour. However, 20 minutes later I received another text saying that it would take another 1/2 hour before our order would be ready. No problem.

When we arrived 1 1/2 hours after we placed our order, it wasn't quite ready as they were packing it up. They do pack up each pie nicely! The pies were still very hot when we got home to eat them The boys had the chicken ones and they looked and tasted very good. My daughter and I had the vegetable pies and, while the inside ingredients were hot, the outside crust was a bit doughy and could have used a few more minutes in the oven. 

I am happy to support this new take-out business as they work out some kinks.  It would be helpful if they started listing the ingredients on their menu. Next time, I  plan to try their empanadas!
name: emPIEnada

text:
I haven't been to Quiznos in years. I was in the area and I was really hankering for a French dip. The lady in the restaurant greeted me at the door which was nice. She was pleasant. I got my sandwich to go and off I went. 

When I opened the sandwich, the "sautÃ©ed" onions looked mildly blanched, but I wasn't going to judge that on looks. They did smell pretty raw still, but only taste will be the judge.

The au jus, however, did give itself away on sight. It looked like diluted chicken broth. It smelled of nothing. This wasn't starting off well, but again - taste be thy determiner. 

Hoo boy. I'm starting to think looks don't deceive. The onions were crunchy and tasted raw. I had to take them off of my sandwich because they were way too overpowering. It tasted like they were put into boiling liquid for 2 minutes max. 

The true crime, however, was the "au jus". Imagine for a moment, dear reader, that you took beef broth and watered it down. Then you watered that down. Then you dumped that into a lake, and took a ladle and scooped up the lake water au jus. That was what it tasted like - nothing, with a sprinkling of something unpleasant. It had no salt, no spice - it tasted like if you took the idea of beef, wrapped that on a carrot, dipped it into celery water, and then hated it. 

I'm sad, because I used to love Quiznos. I hope this is an isolated incident, but I won't be finding out for myself. I won't be back.
name: Quiznos

text: We have been here twice. The newly renovated former Truckee River bar and grill is a fun neighborhood bar and eatery. Full bar and a great variety of drinks. There's also a good menu ! We had polenta fries each time because they are that good. A great serving size for an appetizer. These thick cut fried polenta bars are served with a mildly spicy aioli type sauce on the side. They are crisp on the outside while being creamy inside. Highly recommended if you like polenta. They also had a very good loaded potato soup and poutine worth trying with thin cut steak & cheese curd served over tots covered in a country style gravy.  Also worth trying , fish n fries, fish tacos ! So far we haven't found anything that doesn't taste great here!

text: Definitely need more help and to teach the server how to pick up dishes on the way back to the kitchen.  We waited for at least fifteen minutes for her to clean up our table since we took a booth because of our mom who needs a soft seat.  The steel chairs looked very uncomfortable, so we sat in a dirty booth.  You could say she was swamped because there were about twelve people ahead of us?  Second time I have eaten there and the first was better because of the service even though she was swamped also.  I had the mussels the first time and they were great.  My husband had the wings this time and loved them.  Even though mom ordered onion rings, she got fries which was fixed very fast so she got fries and onion rings.  I ordered the Philly which was good, but way too much cheese.  I wore more than I ate.  It was good though.  I know restaurants are having a hard time getting help, but the bartender could have come out and cleaned a table or two instead of bsing with the customers so much.  We will be going back though.  We do like the place a lot better then the TRBG!!

text:
My wife heard about this place and and has been mentioning it to me for while. We decided to check it out for our regular Friday lunch date about 12:45. They are open Tuesday through Saturday, 11:30am to 7pm.

We must have been later than the lunch rush, because it was not very busy and we were able to talk with the manager. They have a small entry and order area we believe because the rest is for food processing. The menu is on the wall behind the counter and they have paper menus as well. There is no inside seating but there is what appears to be shared outside seating, some under cover, with other establishments. We were told that they have been in this location for about two months and they also have a food truck. We had heard of their food truck as well.

We placed our orders avoiding pot pies which take about 1 hour to cook. The empanada's are smaller and cook in about 8 minutes.

Both of us chose the Cheeseburger empanada and we decided to try a large order of the three cheese macaroni balls which consists of 8 balls verses 4 balls for the small order. Â My wife also decided to try the banana chocolate empanada as a sweet treat.

Everything was so tasty and interesting. After we were finished, we decided to order a frozen pot pie for each of us to to-go that we can cook at home. My wife chose the Classic Chicken and I chose the Italian Meatball. Â Both were packaged very well and we are excited to try them.

We cooked the Classic Chicken pot pie a day later and we both thought it was amazing! Chicken, peas, corn, carrots, flaky crust. The directions said to cook at 400 for an hour but we added 10 more minutes. We talked about buying more to have ready in the freezer.

Overall this was a great experience and a nice addition to the Reno food scene. A big shout out to the manager, she was extremely helpful. (We wish we had got her name.)
name: emPIEnada

text:
I was so excited to try this place out purely based on the creativity of their menu! Every item sounds absolutely drool worthy and I love the innovation on classic dishes into pot pies, empanadas, and balls. 

I ordered online and scheduled a pickup for 6:15. Unfortunately, I could not find the spinach  and artichoke empanada on their menu, although all their other menu items are listed. When I arrived, the food was waiting for me and the pickup process was really smooth. The girls behind the counter were really nice and the whole process was so easy. 

Once we got home, the food was still hot and crisp. The pot pies had little symbols on top to indicate which were which, but I wish the boxes were labeled cause it was a little hard to decipher the symbols after the baking process. I think this is a cute concept, but the meatball pie filling had overflowed a bit in the cooking process and you couldn't tell what the symbol was at all.. 

Once we dug in, everything was delicious. The empanadas were large and stuffed with a good amount of filling. I wish the cheeseburger one was cheesier, but the beef and mushroom was super flavorful and the pork and sweet potato was a surprising flavor combo with curry spices. And the sauce line up adds a little extra oomph to each bite. I really enjoyed the spicy Mayo and their pickled onions. 

The risotto balls needed a little salt, but the loaded mash balls were so dang good. Definitely the best balls that we ordered. 

Overall the food was really good, but the prices are on the higher side. It does seem like they make everything from scratch though, so you have to take that into account when you consider pricing. 

I'll definitely be back when I have a craving for that rich and delicious miso chicken pot pie again.
name: emPIEnada

attributes.BusinessParking: {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}

categories: Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Empanadas, Caterers, Food, Desserts, Comfort Food, American (Traditional), Food Trucks

text:
Oh jeez, I had high hopes for dinner from emPIEnada, especially because it is minutes from my house and I love a good pot pie/any dough with filling. I might be back to pick up a frozen one (or two)...but that's about it. 
My friend and I went last week. With snow in the forecast, we thought it would be good to stock up, so we ordered 4 empanadas (one as a combo deal, with a side included - we chose the 3 cheese mac 'n cheese balls) and two pot pies - one frozen (chicken) and one hot/ready to go (gumbo). Both pot pies were delicious! And super filling - one is definitely enough for two people or at least two meals for one person. 

As far as the balls go - sadly, we didn't get them. We should have checked the order before leaving but it took 25 minutes to be ready instead of the 10-15 they said, so we were hungry! and ready to go - we waited outside because it's such a small space for customers, but it was freezing out there. Not ideal. 

Had we checked the bags, we also may have noticed that we didn't get any saucs with our empanadas...which may have changed how we felt about them. Which was underwhelmed. 
First of all, we ordered four different kinds, but our pork and sweet potato empanada (what! could have been incredible!) was mistakenly replaced with a second chicken empanada....we are guessing they were both the chicken and waffle we ordered, but detected no hint of waffle. One seemed to be coated with powdered sugar, so at first we wondered if a blueberry pie empanada had mistakenly been included - nope, just a very sweet chicken empanada. That was weird. 

We really like the Cuban empnada! But the cheeseburger empanada was disappointing as well. It was basically a bunch of ground beef, without any other ingredients (that we could taste) to make it actually resemble cheeseburger. Maybe our high hopes got in the way here. 

Our total was $55 for all of this and since we didn't get some of what we ordered and got the wrong order for others...not great. The pot pies were good - so maybe stick to those and you'll be ok. Maybe it was just an off night...it happens.
name: emPIEnada

text:
Moved feeling.... online ordering is sold out..  i waited 20 min for basically precooked food on a 45 min lunch break.  I get that you have to charge more coming out to the gigafactory, just add the Tesla Tax at checkout... pretty much everyone who works there understands.

I had a Gumbo Pot Pie.  It was really really good, however a little more shrimp and a little rice would have made it amazing.  The crust was amazing... but a little less chicken would be fine if you added a little rice and a couple more shrimp would be a significant improvement.

The fried loaded mash balls were decent.  They didn't really seen loaded though..   could have a bit more cheese and chives.... and didn't seem buttery.... it would have been nice to offer sour creme and chives to dip them in.

Will I buy more if this truck comes back?  Maybe but it'll be dependent if I can order online as I'm not willing to gamble how long the line will be when I arrive.  To be fair, there wasn't really muck of a line after I got my order, but im not going to take my chances again.
name: emPIEnada

text:
I eat at one of the many Egg Roll King restaurants in town at least 3 times a month. I come to this one the most often. Food is pretty much the same no matter which one you go to. And the food is pretty good, too. A really good value when you consider the prices.

Some of my favorites are: 
Hot and Sour soup. The large is $4.50 and I struggle to finish it. A great lunch on a cold day.
Ginger beef. I love ginger and it does not taste like Ivory soap to me.  I really start to crave this if I go more than a month without it. 
I get either the Kung Pao Chicken or Mongolian beef if i want something spicy.

The chow mein noodles and fried rice are nothing special, just average. I get individual entries with white rice, rather than combo plates. I stay away from the seafood, however. I am just not impressed by it, but then I dont eat much seafood anyway.
name: Egg Roll King

text:
I have never tried an egg roll from the Egg Roll King, but I do order the crab rangoon when I make Chinese food at home and they are good! This time I was in for a full meal... including the crab rangoon!

After ordering a combination plate with Honey Garlic Chicken and Sesame Chicken and pork fried rice, I may stick to just the crab rangoon. The sauce for both chickens was thick and gooey. Also, the sesame chicken sauce was nearly clear. Hmmmm... I think the honey garlic sauce was used on both types of chicken, and then the sesame chicken had some seeds on top. I'll admit that I ordered the Honey Garlic Chicken as a risk, but I figured the Sesame Chicken would be safe choice. Not this time! However, I did have a couple bites of my boyfriend's Cashew Chicken with steamed rice, and it was very delicious and flavorful. 

The speed is what will probably bring me back (to order a different entree) in the future. But Egg Roll King will continue to receive my crab rangoon orders!!
name: Egg Roll King

text: We've been coming here pretty frequently for almost 3 years now and thought is was time that I give a review for this location.  We have had many of the entrees here, but so far have only gotten pork or chicken egg rolls (we like the pork egg rolls best), cream cheese wontons and pot stickers for appetizers.  All are very good.  Tonight, we got the usual pork egg rolls and tried the crab rangoon, which was very good.  In the past, my son & I have tried a couple of the soups and have enjoyed them, as well.  It's been awhile since we've had egg foo yung w/vegetables & pork fried rice, so tonight, we had that, the house chow mien and asparagus beef.  The portions are quite generous, prices very reasonable and the service has always been great.

text:
This place opened a couple months ago.  As such, everything inside is new and clean unlike so many hole-in-the-wall, low-end Chinese joints.  Which made me think, when's the last time a low-end Chinese place opened in Reno or ever?  These places are like old Irish bars.  When's the last time a small Irish bar opened?  Back in the day, there was a lot of discrimination.  You didn't exactly have Irish bankers and Chinese real estate agents.  Lucrative white-collar jobs went to white people of English or German ancestry.  Yes, whites discriminated against whites.  As a result, the minorities (yes, the Irish and Italians were once minorities) found niche markets (besides crime).  Along with other minorities, they often found low-paying, high-risk jobs other white folk did not want (sports, acting, art, writing, selling drugs).  Bars and restaurants happen to be one of the least reliable, least lucrative sources of income, so hence, Chinese and Italian restaurants and Irish bars popped up everywhere.  These days, the Italian restaurants have survived by going upscale while the Chinese just keeping selling to new Chinese immigrants.  Irish bars today are often owned by people of all nationalities (Corrigan's and Foley's are the exception).  

For those of you who could care less, let's talk about this place now.  

Pros:

* I didn't get sick eating here as I usually do in most low-end Chinese, Mexican, and Indian joints.  
* It's quick, small, efficient, and clean.  
* Photos of the dishes on the wall help you out.
* Food portions are generous.  At Panda Express, you get food carton shrinkage.  These guys load up the food so that it almost bursts at the seams.  I ordered two combinations and couldn't finish them.
* It's local and independent and not corporate.  

Cons:

* This isn't PF Chang.  PF Chang is like Chili's and this is more like Del Taco.
* A bit confusing why the Chef's Special General's Chicken is $6.50 and the Regular EntrÃ©e General's Chicken is $7.95 (obviously probably portion size).
* The menu is your run-of-the-mill American-Chinese you'll find at almost every single Chinese restaurant in the world, nothing very creative/authentic unless they have a hidden Chinese menu which I've always considered discriminatory.
* The breaded chicken is this industry standard, factory made, overly breaded thing with sometimes jerky-like meat that to me borders on inedible.  
* You can always tell by the vegetables how fresh the food is, and the vegetables are not very fresh.

You ever wonder why shrimp are getting so big and plump?  They're farm-raised, and you don't even want to know what they're feeding them.  http://www.businessinsider.com/disgusting-truths-about-asian-aquaculture-2012-10 

Don't get me wrong, of all the "hole-in-the-wall" fast food type, low-end Chinese restaurants, I'd rate this one the best for value and not getting me sick.
name: Egg Roll King

text:
It is what it is, it does not pretend to be anything else. It is fast, not very costly and lots of food. 
I ordered the Chef's Special General's Chicken which comes with chicken? chow mein and pork? fried rice. My first several pieces of chicken tasted more like Orange Chicken. As I got further into it I got to where the sauce had settled. The sauce was not bad it had enough heat to know that it was General's Chicken. I put a question mark after chicken and pork because I found no meat in either of those dishes. I put some soy sauce and some chili paste on them and they were okay. They only charged $6.50 for it and I took a lot of it home.
It would be nice if the man taking the orders would smile just a little bit, he almost seemed cold.
It is what it is.
name: Egg Roll King

text:
If you don't know me by now, I Love Chinese food, whether it's by take out or dining in. I just finished work and was about to head to a good friend's place. I decided to grab myself dinner and Egg Roll King was on the way! 

This being my first time eating here I didn't really know what to expect. Egg Roll King is right off Wells and has a few parking stalls right outside. Walking inside, I noticed a couple of tables and their display menus were those classic "letter pin menu boards" attached on the wall. My first thought was, "The food here is going to be great."  

When I'm hungry, I become very indecisive. Of course it's much easier to order from the "Combination" part of the menu. I always initially go for Sweet and Sour Pork and for my second entree I ordered the Honey Garlic Chicken. 

Their Sweet and Sour Pork was okay; it was the taste of their sauce. It was different, a bit more sour than sweet. However, I loved their Honey Garlic Chicken. That sweet and garlic glaze really hit the spot. 

With such generous portions for such a great price is something that I will not complain about. If I'm every craving Chinese take out, I'll head straight for Egg Roll King!
name: Egg Roll King

text:
I remember going to this Egg Roll King years ago when I was at UNR and while living in the NW part of town.  Now that I'm back in this part of town I decided to check it out again.  I ordered online for pickup.  The order consisted of;

     * - Wor Wonton Soup which was full of the usual good stuff.  The broth had a bite too it.  Not too bad, but not what I expected.

     * - Potstickers.  I think they were deep fried instead of pan fried which I would have preferred.

     * - Mongolian Beef.  It was good, but I ordered the entree, but received the combo plate which I didn't discover until getting home.  Since it was supposed to be dinner for the entire family there was a lack of Mongo to go around.

     * - Pork Egg Foo Young.  There were 3 good sized EFY's in the container along with their sauce.  They were tasty, but a bit dry.

     * - Combination House Chow Mein.  This was good!  Full of all the usual suspects, chicken, pork, and shrimp!

I will order in person and wait as there was some confusion as to which online order I had and who I was.  We sort of worked it out, but since I received the incorrect Mongolian Beef I want to make sure I get the right thing.

ERK has good fast inexpensive takeout with many more choices than that corporate chain around town.  It is also cooked to order which is nice!
name: Egg Roll King

text:
Ahh, the Egg Roll King.

I wasn't sure what to expect when me and pops decided to go to this local haunt. But away we went. Parking was easy. No one else was in the lot. They are very close to Vassar St. on Wells which makes it easy to find.

This restaurant is the type that you walk up to the counter, place your order and it was brought out to us. 
Their selection was good.

I ordered the combo plate of sesame chicken and schezwan chicken with steamed white rice.
The combo plates are dirt cheap! Under $6.00 for a plate that was bursting with food!
The gentleman brought out our food in a styrofoam container. That actually caught me off guard, but you need to realize that this place is mainly take out. Why do you need to invest in plates. So, I'm not factoring in the take out containers. 
Let's focus on the food. In fact, let's focus on the good stuff first.
The schezwan chicken was served blistering hot. OMG was it good. I like most of my food served hot except for most sushi. The schezwan chicken had a nice spice to it and was tasty. The rice was fresh too!
Now for the sesame chicken and what my dad ordered, the sweet and sour chicken. 
I know this must be a main stay of their business as many of their chicken dishes are deep fried with various sauces on them. So, they must make a lot of their chicken and add the sauce as needed. 
It shows that it was pre-made. Comparatively speaking, the difference in food temperatures  between the schezwan and sesame chicken was huge. I enjoyed the schezwan chicken but the sesame chicken was served only warm. 
Warm deep fried anything is a no no. It doesn't make me happy nor do my taste buds sing.

For the price, this place is decent. 
Seating is ample and you get to see some WEIRD people walk up and down on Wells Ave!

---------------------------------
Bottom Line

I may go there but for "A Few Dollars More" there are a lot of other good Chinese restaurants that serve all of their food hot and fresh.
name: Egg Roll King

text:
Since moving to northern Nevada it has been so hard to want to create a Yelp review, but also be pleased with my dining experience. 

I saw this place on Instagram not too long after they opened, and couldn't wait to come and visit. My visit was everything I was hoping for and then some! 

We walked in and could tell it would be a good experience from the smell alone. We were greeted with breads, which had the most amazing refried black beans I've had in a long time. 

The verdes chilaquiles did not disappoint and it reminded me of home (Arizona). Comforting is the best way to describe the experience. Post meal- we left with a concha, which was so good and perfectly sweet that I left satisfied having met all the sweet and sour needs I wanted. 

I cannot wait to bring my mom here when she comes to visit. Between the food, the music and the overall dining experience ~ I cannot wait for another visit on a Saturday morning.
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text:
I'm a yelper who doesn't give 5 star off the bat of a new restaurant that just open up, because there is always room to improve in the food and new establishment. Food here is pricey but the portion somewhat match the price in my opinion. The food here is really good but   some of the food I ordered for my wife was really salty including sauce for the chilaquiles. Went there 2 days in a row.
First time there I ordered the los colorados with flank steak xtra charge of $4.99 and the portion was huge that came with red chilaquiles sauce on crispy tortilla chips top with Mexican sour cream and feta cheese, potatoes top with cheese, grilled purple onions, grilled poblano peppers, grilled jalapeÃ±os( spicy ) garnish with stem of cilantro and slices of sweet peppers with a side of black beans. Everything was good but the chilaquiles sauce was a little to salty for my liking but it was still good. The strawberry lemonade was really really good but didn't match the price of $4.99, Also order their mole burrito to-go for the wife and this thing was huge when my wife showed it to me lol, it was almost the size of my thigh yes I said "THIGH", filled with ALOT of strip of grilled chicken breast, black beans and cheese covered with mole sauce and sprinkle sesame seed. I was pretty bummed out that it doesn't come with any rice in it. It could easily feed four people, that's how big it was. The chicken was pretty salty and also the mole sauce.
2nd day I went there I ordered the machaca and taco to-go for the wife. I was too hungry to take a picture of the machaca but it my opinion it did not match the price of $16.99 and wish there was one or two more egg scramble into the machaca. Love the juicy and tenderness of the shredded beef in the machaca but it was pretty bland and I had to add salt and pepper. Scramble with eggs, shredded beef, diced tomatoes, sarano peppers, onions and cilantro with one small scoop of diced potatoes top with cheese then put in a salamander to broil making the cheese melt and turn crispy, which I like, but wish there was more potatoes. Taco which was $11.99 for two matched the price since there was alot of steak meat serve with house made purple tortilla but with all that meat the tortilla ripped when picking it up trying to take a bite. Basically street taco but huge like the size of my forearm huge. Top with diced raw onions, chopped cilantro and guacamole with grilled onions and a side of lime wedges. Love the house made tortilla, always a plus for me, but the steak meat was very salty and almost overpowered the taco. Love the clay plate they serve the food on. Salsa was just ok but good for breakfast. They charge xtra on things you want with your breakfast for additional charge but doesn't stated any prices on the menu including the prices for the lemonade drinks but I hope they soon put it on the menu for the customer's to see.
Wish I could eat here 3 or 4 times a week but it will definitely put a dent in my wallet. Overall I like this place and their location. Will definitely be back to try their other breakfast dish.
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

categories: Mexican, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Ordered from DoorDash:
32 oz egg drop soup
1 sesame chicken (awful)
1 ginger beef
1 Fried rice (came with pork, didn't say it did though) 

Well they are fast, but I fear that's because the food isn't made to order. And it's not ordered fast enough to stay fresh.

The egg drop soup was probably the best thing. But really nothing more than you would expect from king buffet and seemed condensed as if it had been siting warmed for a while and water had evaporated. But it hits the spot, and good price. The fried rice was actually better than my boyfriend thought it would be, because it's included and still had the eggs, carrots, peas, and red pork (I picked the pork out of mine and added tofu), but it wasn't dry and had good flavor.

The sesame chicken was awful. Just looking at it, you can tell it looks like fire wood it's so dry. My boyfriend said the breading was soggy which is surprising because it was lacking any sauce and was flavorless and portion was small.

The ginger beef was much better, it was well sauced, had some flavor, good amount of veggies, not over cooked, but it was pretty chewy due to low quality beef / fatty. But the hubby would order again and good price at 10 bucks.

So skip the fried chicken dishes and only order if you want cheap fast Chinese food delivered.
name: Egg Roll King

text:
We were looking for a new breakfast place and my friend had sent us this place....and WOW. This place was bomb and everyone should check this place out. First of all, such a cute place. The plates they used were traditional clay plates (correct me if I'm wrong) and added to our dinning experience. And the staff, they were so friendly and made us feel right at home. It's like we had been friends for years.

But let me get to the point....their food was SO FREAKING GOOD. They brought out Molletes to try as appetizers and that first bite will forever be in my memories. It has refried beans and chorizo and cheese on top of this wonderful bread. I will be getting it every time I go there.

They're called Los Chilaquiles so you know their game is on point. One of my friends got a mole styled and the other got one called Los Fundidos. Both of those were delicious!!! Seasoned so perfectly and flavorful. Although, I started out with the intentions of getting chilaquiles these tacos called my name. They come on handmade purple corn tortillas and it was the perfect consistency. You can taste the love. It comes with 3, but these are fully loaded tacos. And the scrambled eggs were seasoned to perfection.

And to end our meal, they brought us conchas and they were so soft and delicate. I just couldn't have imagined a better meal to have. This place was great! Check them out soon!
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text: As I'm reading everyone else's reviews, I'm not sure why our experience fell short of everyone else's 5 star reviews. Let's start with what was awesome! First off the Mexican coffee and horchata were on point, and we absolutely loved their green salsa. We loved the little appetizers with the soft bread and beans on it. It worked really well, and made the experience in an uphill incline motion... Until we received our sopes, I could smell that the carne Asada was on its way to becoming spoiled.... Okay that's fine... but then it was weird our entire meal we ordered didn't come out all together so we just shared what they did bring us. For whatever reason they couldn't expedite or have it all come out together- it was around 10-12 mins apart so Im thinking maybe they're just trying to work out the kinks and learning how to time food items to come out together? That's what I'm guessing? I ordered the carnitas Chilaquiles but what I received was very over cooked brown scrambled eggs and no carnitas, and over cooked what appeared as a lump of lukewarm white cheese that clumped together with peppers and like 2 potato squares. We reminded them that they forgot the carnitas... so they brought us a bowl 'on the house' which was shimmering in silver color... okay this also was spoiled... the chilaquiles red sauce tasted delicious for sure, but they were lukewarm also clumped with cheese... now onto the black beans (spoiled) I'm not sure what happened with this entire experience- We ordered 3 menu items 2 coffees and 2 horchatas $70 worth of food and drinks. I don't like to be critical, with reviews specially locally owned and just opening... But on a positive note the girl running the place was doing phenomenal, she was the hostess, the waitress and the food expediter. If they could get their food to quality to match their energy this place could be awesome!
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text:
Best and most authentic Mexican food in town! 

I'm from central California and have been here for ten years looking for something that tastes like it was made in my friends grandmas kitchen. This is it in all the best ways! 

The coffee was to die for. I am going to try and stop just for that on the way to work. It was served beautifully. 

We obviously had to try the chilaquiles. Wow. The flavor for both of our dishes was insanely good. The amount of food was over the top. It was like a squeeze in style serving but the flavor was out of this world good. 

The experience as a whole was just wonderful. We will definitely be going back as it is now my husbands goal to eat every type of chilaquiles on the menu! 

Everyone needs to check this place out!
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text:
Holy Guacamole, Batman! This place is the best!
 
I saw this new find pop up on the Yelp's "Hot and New" list. I sent it to a friend and he said - Saturday? And I had to agree. 

Four of us sat down and were so distracted by the incredibly flavorful coffee (Mexican Coffee - bring your own tequila? Tia Maria?) .. anyway - the coffee is AMAZING. It took us a while to get through the menu.. oooh, this sounds good.. mmmm, this does too. What to get.. what to get. 

We finally decided. I believe there were darts and blindfolds involved.. "pin the tail on the donkey" type decision making skills. 4 plates were selected. 

But before they arrived, a little something-something arrived - Mexican bread with beans and cheese and I don't remember what else because they were gone in the blink of an eye. 

Then little bowls of black beans, and our platters of eggs and tortillas and salsa and veggies and proteins - mine was spare ribs and eggs, DH had chorizo, I can't tell you what the other two enjoyed, because by the time I looked over at their plates, they were clean. 

The service was terrific. The place was really getting busy as we were leaving. I hope they find an incredible following and lots of people enjoy giant plates of yummy breakfast. 

PS.. you should go!
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text:
We finally have a Mexican (breakfast/brunch) restaurant down the street from our house in South-East Reno and it's AMAZING!! And as their name suggests, they specialize in Chilaquiles, but they also have traditional Mexican dishes.
We happen to come in on the 2nd morning of their opening and they already seemed to be organized and hustling. 
We were excited to try everything but we contained ourselves to Los Colorados, Divorciados, and coffee brewed Mexican-style (cafe de olla).
As expected, our coffee arrived first in a blue enameled steel carafe (something familiar in many Latino households). I love this kind of attention to detail! 
As we waited for our food the waitress brought over a little appetizer made from tiny bolillos cut in half, topped with a light spread of refried black beans, pico de gallo, queso, and crema. First bite and I'm already loving the flavors.
Next came our breakfast. My Divorciados dish came with two eggs (I chose over easy) over crispy tortillas topped with green tomatillos sauce on one egg and red ranchera sauce on the other, chorizo, black beans, and homestyle potatoes. Probably one of my best tasting breakfasts I've ever had!! And we just went to Mexico in March and I left craving the amazing breakfast I had there...this breakfast tops it.
My husband's Los Colorados included flank steak, chilaquiles in red sauce, two eggs (he chose over easy), sautÃ©ed peppers/onions, and black beans. Again, amazing! Everything we was full of flavor and love, and the servings were generous.
As we were waiting for our check we saw a young couple come in and when the waitress saw them she said, "You're back today!" which means on their 2nd day of opening they already had return customers. That says something about a brand new restaurant. I'm predicting that we'll be returning next weekend to try a couple more amazing dishes and I can't wait.
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

categories: Mexican, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Finally!!! A really really good Mexican bkfst place!!!! 

I wanted to give them 4 stars just because of the wait time but after getting our food we realized the wait was worth it and you see why below.

We went there on a Sunday around 12:30ish and it was busy.  We were promptly greeted and were told the wait would be about 30 minutes.  When we sat they promptly asked for our drink order.  We then were brought some salsa verde and salsa roja and complimentary molletes.  

For lack of better words; this molletes were fckn delicious.  They use telera bread (which is super soft bollito bread) and just the perfect ratio of black beans, crema mexicana, queso fresco and pico.  

We started with a queso fundido w/ chorizo as an appetizer.  For the size it should be a main dish (we couldn't finish it) it is serve with a side of tortilla chips, guac and pico de gallo.  (I would prefer if they serve it with warm tortillas)

For our main entree we decided on the huevos Divorciados and the Chilaquiles Bandera (added eggs & flank steak)

The salsas in the huevos divorciados were super tasty and the country potatoes were to die for! They were are mixed with onion and poblano pepper (YUM!!)   The other sides were chorizo and black beans de la olla.  

The salsa roja on the chilaquiles was just the right amount of heat and the salsa verde was tangy as expected.  The steak was a bit well-done but still very flavorful.

They also brought complimentary dessert; a small slice of chocoflan! 

Overall, the food is delicious and the prices are fair for the quality/quantity of food they serve.  

P.S. I almost forgot!! The cafe de olla is also super tasty- just like my great-aunt used to make it.
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text:
A very Merry chilaquiles to me!!! Running last minute errands on Christmas Eve had me going crazy with hunger! And who can possibly navigate crowds, long lines and crazy traffic when they're hangry? No one! So, lucky me...I was already in S. Reno and anyone who knows me knows I loooovvveee me some chilaquiles, so I headed into Los Chilaquiles!  
((BTW, the Google had me drive right by it, turn left on to McCarran, and then do a U turn, so ignore that nonsense and just look for their sign in the spot where Mountain Mike's Pizza used to be!))
The place was pretty busy inside, with several tables dining in, but to-go was all I had time for today.  Bummer, since that meant I missed the bread appetizers and conchas, since those must be for dine-in only...
I ordered the Divorciados with over medium eggs, and came back a few minutes later to find my order was already ready already!
Overall, I'd say the presentation was very nice. The dish had 2 fried tortilla disks with 2 eggs and red & green sauces.  In the middle was a little chunk of pretty overcooked chorizo.  My eggs were a touch past over-medium as well.  There was some nice home-fried potatoes and a small container of black beans and salsas included as well.  It was my choice to order it to-go, but the 2 extremely crunchy tortillas made it very difficult to eat from the take-out container with a flimsy plastic knife & fork. There was a slightly sour, almost off smell and taste to the salsas, so I decided not to risk it and didn't use them.  
Honestly, for 2 eggs on 2 tortillas, the $15 price tag seems steep to me, and being that I'm E. Sparks, I don't usually cross town for just 1 dish.  There is certainly more to the menu than I even had time to look at, and dining in seems to be the way to go for extra meal perks, so I hope the opportunity comes around for me to return and try something else.
name: Los Chilaquiles Mexican Breakfast

text: I went for dinner with my husband and granddaughter. Disappointed for several reasons. Biggest issue is I was later charged for two separate meals, apparently I paid for someone's meal besides mine. I called twice and left a message but manager never bothered to call me back. Hostess told me to contact my bank, which I have now that a week has gone by and no return call from the restaurant. In addition, they served my husband either the wrong beer or a watered down version and insisted it was correct, and his 2 tiny fish tacos had a thin, about 2" strip in each. Chips and salsa were extra charge, rice and beans were extra charge (I was served a $4 cup of beans, no rice). Cactus tacos and nachos were good. We are not complainers by nature and we love the original Chuy's in Midtown but we will never go to the taqueria again and do not recommend it.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: I'm sorry to resort to a bad review here, but at this point I'm not sure what else to do. My two coworkers and I decided to come in for our first visit to this location early November. Our bill was supposed to be split three ways. We all gave our credit cards and signed the bills appropriately. The charge should have been about $74 each. For some reason I was charged $129. I have called and spoken with the manager/owner who was going to look into this. After not hearing back I called in again and spoke to him about looking into it again. No response. Ive called twice and left massages for him with no response. Can someone please fix this for me. If you would like to throw in a gift card for my bad experience I'd be willing to remove the 1 star review. Thank you and if you would like my phone number I will provide upon request.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text:
I REALLY wish that I liked this place, but sadly I did not. 
PRO:
-lovely location, beautiful decoration inside. 
-queso was tasty and mole sauce was yummy
-employees were VERY nice

CON:
-no complimentary chips and salsa (every other restaurant has them, why not this place????)
-pineapple margarita was not really good, more spicy than flavorful 
-mole enchilada (2) : this was the largest disappointment. TWO ENCHILADAS ONLY. For the price? Not worth it. No rice and beans on my plate, just one piece of lettuce.......
-you HAD to order an appetizer (also pricey) otherwise you would be starving after just two small enchiladas...

I went to try this place out because the location is adorable, but definitely won't be coming back.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: Well unfortunately this was one of the worst restaurants experiences we have had. We ordered a pineapple margarita, it said it was made with fresh pineapple juice. When I tasted it, it tasted like straight simple syrup with a very artificial pineapple taste. I couldn't drink it. My husband ordered a mezcal drink that was just ok. When the waiter came I let him know my drink was terrible and that's when he told me they don't use fresh pineapple juice. So instead we ordered two beers and two shots. Our Queso  cheese dip was ok. I ordered Al pastor tacos and my husband ordered the TACOS DE AGUACATE which are supposed to be crispy corn tortillas with avocado and cheese inside. I received my very small tacos that were ok but my husband received the cactus tacos. The waiter apologized and took the cactus tacos back and brought another plate to my husband that had two cold tortillas with avocado and tomato on top. We asked him what it was and explained he couldn't get the kitchen to make what was on the menu. Ok WTF. He then asked if there was anything else on the menu we wanted. By then I was done eating and my husband still hadn't. So we ordered some chili Colorado. It came and was just ok but we needed to go after all this time trying to get our food so we asked for a to go box. While waiting for a to go box the waiter brought another margarita even know I ordered a beer in place of it. I tried it and again it was terrible so I didn't drink it. The waiter was really nice and apologized again. He seemed frustrated with the kitchen staff as I was too. Well we got our bill....$100. We were charged for my husband's plate that he never received and also the margarita. Wow just wow. We have never experienced such terrible food/service. We still tipped our waiter $20. $120 for an hour of trying to just get what was on the menu that the cooks in the kitchen would not make. The owner of this business really needs to address these issues. It's such a nice location but I don't see it lasting with service like this. Apparently we are not the first people to have these issues. Our waiter told use that people are complaining about the drinks not being made properly and the food not being prepared with the ingredients listed on the menu. We will never go back and will not suggest this place to anyone.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: Chuy, Javier, and Kristin are doing it right! Exquisite food, impeccable service, exceptional staff, not just an evening out, a true experience!  It started when we were greeted by Marcos, the GM, who immediately made us feel right at home!  He was attentive throughout meal.   Made us feel like we were the only ones there,  even though it was a well deserved packed house!  The decor is vibrant, authentic, and includes tequila lockers and even an an alter.  Amazing!  Check out Poncho Villa on your way to the restrooms!  Wow!  Jason may be the most fabulous server ever, so personable, and a little easy on the eyes too!  The food... no words, even the cucumber lemon water was to die for!  Yes, the water!  Javier's tequila expertise was beyond impressive!  Will definitely be back!  A MUST on you to do list!  Recommend reservations on a weekend. We were lucky Marcos made it happen for us!  Thank you and congratulations on a huge success!
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: Best restaurant experience I have had in Reno! The space itself is beautiful and artistic. The service is excellent. text:
We arrived about 5:45 on a Saturday evening and it did not seem busy, but it still took 5 minutes to be greeted by the host. None of the servers or kitchen staff were wearing masks despite the state mandate for indoor mask requirements. We did not have a reservation but half the tables and almost the whole bar were empty so it seemed like an easy bet. We had to wait another 10 minutes and the host asked us if the bar would be fine. Another 5 min go by before we were waited on. We decided just to order food and not get drinks, the wait staff and the kitchen looked overwhelmed with the few guest that were there. Our food came about 20 min later and it was ok but nothing to write home about. Same tortillas I buy at the store (I could see them in the kitchen). The chicken in my mole enchiladas was kinda bland and only saved by the sauce. The same chicken was in the tacos, which were the smallest street tacos I've ever seen. 
I hope they up their game here because it could be a really good place but the service was really lacking and the food not as good as many taquerias in town.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text:
I really wanted to give this place 4 stars because the location is nice, the place is beautiful and they have a good concept; however, the execution needs a lot of improvement.

We visited this place 3 times. The 1st time was during their soft opening and we were really satisfied with the food and drinks.  A few of the items on the menu weren't available and it was understandable since it was just the soft opening.  We order the queso fundido, chile colorado and albondigas.  We also had drinks and they were really good as well.  

The 2nd time we ordered items from the appetizers selection, the taquitos, ceviche de atun and the salsas.  The taquitos were good, ceviche lack flavor but was an easy fix with a bit salt and lime, the salsas were alright but a very small portion.

The 3rd time was very disappointing.  We order the Guacamole de la Casa (which is supposed to be topped with Bacon JalapeÃ±o).  The hostess brought us a guacamole that did not scream 'Guacamole de La Casa' and it did not had bacon jalapeÃ±o.  I asked her and she said she was fairly new and didnt know what it came it but that she would ask a server.

I heard when she asked Marcos (who I am assuming is the manager) about the bacon.  He looked at our guacamole and he asked her 'ohh you brought them that one?!' Which i am assuming is the one that they use to top taquitos and enchiladas.  So instead of exchanging it he just had her bring us some bacon on the side.  I then asked the server that I think they brought us the wrong guacamole and that i didn't wanna pay $12 for a guacamole that was made in a blender.  He told me that they usually  make the guacamole table side but that they were too busy that night and that's the guacamole they were serving.  WTF!!
(Please see pics)
Neeedless to say I don't think I would be giving them a 4th chance any time soon.  The place has potential but it needs a lot of improvement overall.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text:
I really wanted to love this place, but they've got some kinks to iron out before it can achieve fame on Reno's restaurant scene.

I have dined at the Midtown location a number of times, so I thought I knew what to expect when visiting this new, seemingly higher-end location, but was surprised that the menu here is mostly tapas, not full meals, but at rather high prices for what is served.

We arrived on time for our reservation and were seating fairly quickly. It took our server almost 15 minutes to come to the table to take our order. It took 50 minutes from the time we ordered our food until it arrived at the table. Two of our orders were the same item, and yet they were plated differently. Neither had the side of beans we had chosen when we placed our order. Once we received our food, our server didn't visit the table again until she delivered our bill.

In total, the restaurant is nicely finished and the location is great. I think the prices are too high for small plates and the service needs some work.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: Long wait after seated despite only 9 customers in the restaurant for lunch.  After fifteen minutes our order was finally taken.  Mediocre molcajete with dry chicken and beef, tiny shrimp. Peppers were undercooked.  Sauce unappealing.  Only 3 small tortillas.  Chile relleno was dried out at the tip of the pepper, little cheese stuffing it.  A folded piece of egg (like an omelet) was lain on top of the pepper, as opposed to dredged and surrounding it.  My friend ordered steak tacos but had to ask the server to box them up to go, because it took too long for them to come for him to be able to eat them.  He had 45 minutes at the restaurant.  Best dish by far was the nachos which I would order again.  Great presentation, large portion, a nice mix of flavors.  And if I had to return to this restaurant, I would not risk ordering anything else because 1 out of 4 is a terrible record.  Forgot to mention I tried to order a cocktail but was told that their signature cocktails were not available because the bartender was not present.  So I ordered a house margarita which was served in a lowball glass, and didn't have fresh lime or distinct tequila flavors.  To top it off, at the end of the meal our server didn't return to our table.  She was sitting at a table elsewhere in the restaurant, on her phone.  In front of her there was a tray with silverware, which I suppose was an effort to prepare settings, but she was preoccupied.  So I walked to her to ask for the check.
name: Mari Chuyâs Tequileria - Rancharrah

text: The ladies who run this truck are awesome! The woman who helped my husband and I was so friendly, helpful and genuinely concerned with how we felt towards their beverages. They have a good selection of drinks from coffees to shaved ice and Italian soda. I wish I could have tried more things on their menu; they all looked so delicious. My husband and I both got the Captain's Special. It was $3.50 or $3.25 (I can't remember!)  It's a scoop of vanilla ice cream with two shots of espresso poured over it. The espresso was so tasty! Whatever kind of coffee, they use, it is delicious! The vanilla ice cream made the espresso creamy; they went well together! I was surprised how good it was actually! I'll definitely be back to Java Ship, to see what other great drinks they have! I hope to catch them around town or at a food truck event soon.
name: Java Ship Coffee
