text:
I'm only guessing at the opening date. But it is relatively new, replacing another panaderia/pupusaria that wasn't very good.

This isn't the first time I've been here.  You need to go in the morning to get the Pan Dulce. I went once in the afternoon and they aren't making any more. But I understand why. The Tortas are delicious. I had the Asada without mayo (I hate mayo). They will make it for you anytime. They also make tamales, hot dogs, pupusas and hamburgers. They also sell masa if you are making your own tamales. They sell a few other mexican products. 

I haven't tried everything, but I will be going back. I hope they are around for a long time. I wonder where #1 is?
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

text:
I'm a white boy from Santa Ana (which is like 80% Latino) and I know real Mexican food. I'm glad I found this place just down the street from where I live and I love their pan dulce (conchas, cuernos, empanadas, and more). The real reason I came here though was because I heard they had tortas and tamales! The tamales were big and reasonably priced and the torta de jamon I had was very delicious. Prices are a little on the high side here since it's $7 for a torta and instead of rice and beans they just give you a small bag of chips. Also, I do wish they had tacos, I'm talking the dirty little street tacos that I miss so much. 
This place is part panaderia, part Mexican cafe, and part Mexican grocer. They also have many of the staples of a good Mexican household-beans, rice, masa, chili, etc...
Enjoy!
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

I went to JavaShip and decided on the Double Hawaiian which is basically a slush with ice cream added to it then topped with condensed milk. text:
I take my caffeine intake very seriously, coffee helps me get through the day. Luckily, we have a coffee truck in Reno.

Java Ship coffee has great quality beverages, they use organic "Blind Dog coffee," which is one of my favorite coffee brands. Mariah, the owner, actually grinds coffee beans to make her drinks! Yummm! The beverages are served hot/cold, your choice. 

My favorite drink is the "Hot Mexican Mocha," it was delicious! Just the right amount of sweet and the right kick of coffee! This drink is actually made with real Mexican chocolate (no wonder why the amazing flavor!) Also, if you are into spicy, they can add a little bit of cayenne. 

The menu has Shaved ice with a wide variety of flavors! I highly recommend the "Rainbow" shave ice, delish and super cute!!! 

They also have Italian sodas, you can have then with cream or almond milk! Delicious! I like the passion fruit one ;-) very tasty and refreshing for hot summer days!  

I also think they have an amazing hot chocolate, yummmm you guys! Dark and white chocolate together???? Mmmmm the key to my heart! 

The best part of a food truck, is that you can always invite them to your special event, to your work or just find it on a special event in town. 

Mariah is a wonderful and caring business owners, she always takes such a wonderful care of her customers and always have a big beautiful smile on her face, no matter how cold, windy or hot is outside!
name: Java Ship Coffee

text:
Still our favorite go to spot for some pan dulce or other mexican snacks/refreshments. 

I highly recommend trying their philly cheese torta. Its huge, filling, and they are never stingy on the meat as you can see in the picture! If you can't handle spicy ask for one without jalapeÃ±os.

I've also had their pupusas, jalapeÃ±o bread with cream cheese, and other pan dulce which I'm not entirely sure  what they're called. But, I somehow end up getting the same thing which is their jalapeÃ±o bread and pupusas because its bombbb. 

They have a mini dining area so you can always eat in here too. Staff r always friendly and helpful. If you live in the area, you must try it!
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

text: This place is Amazing!!!! First off when you walk inside there are tons of Fresh Pastries on the left wall that you can choose from. The vibe and atmosphere is nice and enjoyable. Lots of good stuff on the shelves. And the fruit smoothies are super good.  I got a pineapple smoothie for lunch. It was so good that I went back the same day and I ordered the Torta Streak and Cheese in the evening. WOW just WOW it was ridiculously good. Better food than anything else is here in North Valley.  They were super fast both times i went there today.  Each time they walked my food over to me where i was waiting and personally handed me my order. Tomorrow I'm going back to try their breakfast burrito i heard was super tasty and I'll get some fresh Mango for lunch. I recommend this place 100% with a 5 star.  I don't even do Yelp reviews but this place is so good I felt like I had to tell everybody about it.
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

text:
Nice little Mexican bakery serving lunch plates, baked goods, and some refreshing drinks. I grabbed a selection of baked goods including churros, a turnover, and a fluffy, airy styled cheese cake, and also a Horchata to wash it all down. 
The churros were decent but they were a little dry for my taste. The horchata was good, as was the cake. The turnover was probably my favorite, but I wouldn't say anything really stood out.
If you are out in the valley it's a good option but I wouldn't drive out of my way.
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

text:
Was dining at Prost next door and heard great things about this new taco place from the owner. 

We live semi nearby and we're craving quesabirria on a Saturday night, we tried a few other places first that were packed and finally landed on this little gem. They had a pretty steady flow of customers, but I think since they are still fairly new it hasn't gotten to the overly busy stage of business. Plus the restaurant is a fair amount larger than other taco shops. 

The service was impeccable. Our waiter made sure we had everything we needed, made helpful suggestions and substitutions, and checked on us often. 

The food was delicious. The quesabirria was very flavorful and I loved all the little touches that came with it like the grilled jalapeÃ±os and pickled red onions. They also offer authentic Mexican cocktails which make the experience more unique and fun. Definitely a great sit down place to enjoy some truly authentic and amazing Mexican food!
name: Dream Tacos & Cantina

text: My husband and I went to this restaurant for the first time last night and we fell in love. We were there with a work party and we had so much fun! The margaritas were delicious and we tried one of their specialty drinks with fresh lime juice in a beautiful ceramic cup and it was amazing! The food tasted so delicious and you could tell they use fresh ingredients. We tried their veggie burrito and we will definitely be back for more! Everything was clean and we felt so safe to be there celebrating our coworker. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful with our group. I highly recommend this place for good food, good drinks, and the friendly environment!

text:
Always on the prowl for a good taco lunch spot.

Festive decor and music..

Ordered the street tacos (5 carne

Service was friendly and attentive asada), and the chili relleno lunch plate special.

I like chips and salsa to start out with..

The small  container of chips came with only a green type of salsa and no red salsa..

Plates arrived with generous portions of beans and rice.. but the Spanish rice was too wet and soggy..

Tacos were decent with a few chewy chunks of meat... 

The chili relleno was nice, and full of flavor. 

Service was great.

text:
This place is super MUY excellante !   Where do I start?   How about with the amazing breakfast burrito we had with all the stuff you would expect in an amazing burrito that is designed to  start your day off right.   This family owned bakery is filled with pride.  From the hottest coffee in town to the most professional-looking baKed goods in Reno, save this one as your pastry paradise.  

Check out the lime bottle sprayer on the counter!  Genius!!   The kids can get their ice cream treats and the parents can have their fill of Mexico's delightful flavors.   They make birthday cakes here. Check out the clean kitchen area and order with confidence.   The whole family seems to be in on the action.  It's a hoot to watch them in motion.  $7.50 The breakfast burrito. When we sat down, we were offered coffee refills!!
name: Panaderia Jalisco Bakery & Deli

text:
Top level tacos, Tortas!

The Dream Tacos with Chicharron and Chili Verde are my favorite. The Quesabirria is excellent with the consume. Dip, bite repeat!

The Tortas are also excellent, more of a top tier with smaller bread brings out more flavor. Grilled Asada Potatoes are a killer app, add that to your list!

Staff is always 110%, we love this place.

text:
Oh geeez! The menudo is sour and lacks all the flavors. For the price you pay it should at least taste decent. I ordered 1 with pata (pig foot) and 1 without. I got a few bones with no meat in the one with pata. I had to "fix" the flavor by adding lime salt oregano more salt chilies more salt and more lime! Still isn't good, the tortillas are suppose to be fresh hand made. Not so fresh. Just old and hard.. On top of the menudo I ordered a carne asada quesadilla. In the menu it shows meat and cheese. Super simple but just as I like it. Well it was stuffed with some sort of cream and pico and "grilled" not so grilled onions. 

The pan is good. I guess you can't have it all!

I wouldn't go there again. Fix your menudo! And your menu please. Thank you.

text:
I normally never pay for coffee - I know how to make a mean 'Cup of Joe' via several different methods and I don't think that a "smoothie made with coffee" (what is popularly sold now) counts as "Coffee". 

...but the Java Ship Coffee Food Truck parked right outside of our office and has the office staff was watching people approach the food truck - laughing at a man who was clearly trying too hard to impress a group of cute women, when we all decided to be nice and buy something from the sweet looking woman behind the counter. (That was is they took payment by card - they did). 

The woman behind the counter was knowledgeable on her product, was very prompt and friendly. The Food Truck looked clean. 

I ordered a Mexican Mocha and was super pleasantly surprised when the woman asked me what type of milk I wanted "dairy milk, soy milk, almond milk" - was not expecting that from a small food truck. I got the soy milk. 

The Mexican Mocha was what I expected - a tasty frou-frou coffee drink. (Sorry what can I say) buying coffee smoothies not really my thing, I like my coffee plain and dark and warm. However, the woman behind the counter was very outgoing, friendly, and warm and they use Blind Coffee for their Coffee, so I'm going to rate them well.
name: Java Ship Coffee

text:
Put down your phone, get yourself up outta your chair, and run to Dream Tacos! Not only was this the best taco I've ever had in my life (yes, including tacos I've eaten in Mexico), but it was one of the most delicious things I've ever put in my mouth. Don't even think about ordering anything else until you've tried the Quesabirria first. When my dish came to the table, I picked up one of the super hot tacos, and almost dropped it because it was so heavy. Heavy with MEAT, people. That thing must have weighted 2 lbs. The outside was crazy crunchy fried cheese deliciousness, and don't even get me started on the slow cooked stewed meat....it's UNREAL.  The consumme on the side is a perfect compliment to the taco and definitely brings the flavor up a notch.  One word of warning:  the little cup of orange hot sauce they give you on the side is 5 Alarm.  If you like it hotttt, then use it, but don't say I didn't warn you.

I also should say that the service is great!  It's a family run joint, and they all pitch in.  It's clean and friendly, and I have nothing to else to say other than I wish I could give it 10 stars.
name: Dream Tacos & Cantina

text:
Me and my friends come here about once a month because their tacos are so fresh and delicious. When you enter the store, you see a large dessert menu. I tried their flan and for a cup was only $1.50! It filled my flan needs for a great price. They also have a variety of Mexican ice creams. I love the gum ball flavored ice cream because it has actual gum balls inside! 

As for ordering food, you go up to the counter which is right in front of the kitchen and you order. I get tacos every time I come here because they are gigantic. There's a bar of condiments with onions, radish, and some spices to put on your food. While I recommend the tacos, one time I ordered the gorditas and they were a bit too salty and greasy for my taste. 

There's a small butcher in the corner where you can buy fresh chicharrÃ³n. They also have a range of Mexican drinks, candies, and snacks. I definitely recommend this place for authentic Mexican food!
name: Carniceria Samber

text:
Dropped the older kids off at the Aces Base Ball stadium and drove here to get some meats to make tacos at home. They had ripe avocados for $1.39 and nice looking tomatoes for $1.58 a lbs. So the prices were not bad. Also, the Pastor de puerco is $3.99/lbs so again great price. We decided to try the chicken mix also for the same price. 

As we were leaving, I noticed they had a little cafÃ© inside. They serve traditional Mexican foods, and the prices are good. We ordered three tacos Carne Asada And one taco chili Verde. They were $1.59 each. When they arrive, the chili Verde was red and the lady told me in Spanish that they didn't have verde only rojo... I decided what the heck it looks really good.

The first thing you see about the tacos, if you look at the picture, tons of meat. There's So much meat, it covers the whole tortilla. We were able to split the double tortillas that were given, and make two tacos Adam it's Taco. So we actually had 8 tacos lol. Yeah, not much meat. The flavors were amazing, flavorful and fresh. There is also an option for homemade or handmade tortillas, that cost a dollar extra though so we opted for the traditional factory tortillas. There is also a salsa bar, or you can get salsa both red and green, limes, cilantro, limes and fresh cut onions. All in all very nice. This is For me, one of the best places to go now. We usually get our Carnitas and to chicharons here for taco night. However the Carnitas were sold out and the chechrons were really dark and seemed overcooked. 

Really an inexpensive place to get all you need for making the authentic tacos at home as well as the cafÃ© provide some really authentic Mexican food At a really inexpensive price.
name: Carniceria Samber

text:
Awesome find!!

My wife has a sixth sense when it comes to finding culinary jewels in odd places. We were in town for a few days and just exploring the area when she got the urge to stop into this little Hispanic store-front in a somewhat shady-looking strip mall. The store was tiny and packed with tons of stuff from batteries to liquor. However, step a few feet into the place and you move beyond the store, into the meat market and fresh grill. 

Oh man! What this place lacks in ambience, it more than makes up for in food quality/quantity! If you want authentic latin food, tacos, burritos, etc.. and you don't mind cafeteria-style tables and a fresh meat display case in your face, you are in for a treat! We ordered a couple of burritos and gorditas, just to try the place out. The prices are super cheap but the quality is through the roof! I watched, in awe, as a little lady hand-made the tortillas for the burritos and gorditas and put them on the grill. The meat was very well seasoned and there was so much in each of the things we ordered, we were both stuffed miserably!! There is a small bar with sauces and fresh seasonings to add to your food, if you want. Forget about ordering a drink unless you want to be overly full or you have a bottomless pit for a stomach! This is now my default, go-to place for incredible food, ambience-be-darned!!
name: Carniceria Samber

It's a small place in an older part of town,  but don't let that affect things.  I've been there 3 times and it's always good.  Someday I need to come in just to eat... They serve cooked food too and it's always packed. Must be good...

Last week a coworker of mine offered to pick me up some tacos from a place she said was very fresh and tasty.  I will never turn down tacos, so of course I Said yes! 
She came back with two fresh and homemade Carne Asada tacos with very fresh and made my hand tortillas. I added some of the salsa she brought back and the lime and bit right in.  Wow.  These were indeed very good.  
The Carne Asada was seasoned and flavored perfectly.  I made sure to put in a standing order for every time she decides to go there.  
I never knew this place existed as it's hidden pretty well in the shopping center area on Oddie. I am planning to go back there and try out their other salsas and meats as well.  I wouldn't say they are the best tacos I've had but they were certainly worthy of repeat business from me.

text:
Decided to take the kids up to the lake for a picnic and some driving practice. Did not have any picnic stuff, so we stopped here to get a bunch of the $1.59 carne Asada tacos and burritos to go. We bought:

12 tacos $1.59
2 burritos
2 Gorditas
1 lbs Chicharone (Carne)
16 oz Rice and beans.

Once we arrived at the lake, we pulled everything out and I was quite amazed. As I noted in my first review, there was a lot of meat in the items. Today was no exception. The items were packed with meat. But they also packaged up all of the condiments for us to enjoy a picnic. They threw in limes, radishes, onions and cilantro. Also they were a few containers that had two different types of salsas. It was a nice surprise.

If you look at the pictures, the meal packed for a carnivore lol. My son was afraid that the eight dollar burrito would have lots of rice and beans, however it was packed with meat. He opened the Burrito  up and had me take a picture. The children have decided this is their new favorite Mexican place to go. I can't blame them, it was awesome.

Can't wait to try more stuff as time goes by!
name: Carniceria Samber

text:
Recent news led me to decide that it was time to part with my go-to bar. It was a hard goodbye -- not only were the food and drinks superb, my favorite staffers, one of them being a gal named Cassie, were the highlight of my drunken stumbles around midtown. My friend was hyping this place on a night out and as soon as we walked in the door I heard the familiar voice of my favorite bartender and it felt like I was coming home.

Tl;dr: the vibe is perfect and the drinks are plentiful. I mean, they have the complete Madlibs collection as their coffee table book for goodness' sake. Most importantly though, any place that's in Cassie's hands is the place to be. 

P.s. the bartender, Evan, is also everything you're looking for in a bartender (and I mean ~everything~)
name: Wonder Aleworks

text:
I had wondered what would happen to the old Under the Rose location.  I had wondered if they would replace it with something similar or I wondered if they would dismantle the space that seemed to be so well designed.  Then I wondered if anything would happen with the Pandemic and so many places struggling to even get enough workers.

Not wondering anymore.  This Saturday we were able to go and try a few items.   I started with the Post It drink.  So perfectly tasty for an easy-going early lunch.  I ordered up the Cali-Cheese Steak and my wife ordered up the Jambalaya Balls.  We really really enjoyed the Jambalaya Balls.  The sauce that they were plated with was right on the money.  The Cali Cheese steak was a little awkward with the trip tip being too tough for a bite right through.  I probably wouldn't order it again even though the flavors were there.

I look forward to another trip there....and maybe this time I will be in the mood for flight of the beers they make on site.
name: Wonder Aleworks

text: This place recently opened in south Reno but I know the chefs from my previous favorite sushi place . After giving it a try twice in the last two weeks i have to say best sushi in Reno and my friends i went with agree! Atmosphere is pleasant, place is clean , great presentation, quality of the fish is excellent and always fresh , and the rolls are made with the smallest quantity of rice compared to any other sushi place I've been . Give this place a try , you won't regret it . My only worry is that soon they'll be so busy I'll have to wait hours to get in .
name: Umi Sushi

text:
BEST SERVICE IN ALL OF RENO. HANDS DOWN.

Now that I got that out of the way, the drinks, the food, the atmosphere, everything about this place is everything and more one could ask for.

During this time of a labor shortage, I have no clue what the owner is doing, but he has hired the best staff team in town to be the most friendly and attentive people of all time.

We have been here four times in the last week and can't wait to keep this trend going for years to come.

Aside from the phenomenal service and amazing atmosphere, the drinks (wether you like beer or cocktails) are incredible, as is the food.

Please come here, bring all your friends, and support this amazing business!
name: Wonder Aleworks

text: I was sad to see Rickshaws replaced. Rickshaws had been my favorite sushi joint in Reno! I thought maybe Umi might have been under the same ownership, but it's not. I decided to stop by after work one day and was very impressed. The staff was friendly and everything was really enjoyable. I had a few rolls, some nigiri and mussels and I think Umi might be my new go to place. It's a little more expensive than some other spots in town, but everything is so much fresher tasting. Highly recommend!

text:
I generally don't review a place after just one visit unless I'll never be back and even then I usually still skip the review because it's really not enough to go on. 

Soooo...I went for a second time and it was just as good as the first. 

Admittedly, I had the tacos again so that's all I can review, but it's a pretty good bet, based on the crowd and the menu and the tacos that everything else is just as good. 

English is not the first language here, but it's nothing to worry about as the menu has big pictures. Worst case scenario, just point to the number.

So back to the tacos...We had tongue and asada this time around and not only are they awesome, they load them double shells up with so much meat, you can barely fit the onions and cilantro on them. Which, by the way, is among the very few toppings they offer and that's ok, because that's the way I like them. 

As a bonus, it is tucked inside a store so you can get an ice cold beer or real sugar soda from the cooler or maybe a tasty Mexican desert. 

$1.59 for the tacos, BTW. One of the best deals in town.
name: Carniceria Samber

text:
All you can eat ( light rice is the NORM )... We will be back! The location is super clean! And you have multiple people helping you so you NEVER feel like you have to wait for anything. 

We walked in , no reservation and were seated right away. We wanted to sit at the bar, it's closed due to COVID for now. 

They were so happy to do custom orders and were very friendly. We even heard a few happy whistles coming from the kitchen. Happy chefs ... make happy food -
That's a FACT! :) 

Below are my notes on the food we ordered - 
Appetizers ( arrived at the table within minutes! )
Egg roll - Perfectly hot , light and crispy. NOT greasy! 
Tempura JalapeÃ±o - Tempura JalapeÃ±o perfectly crisp,with a little softness stuffed with cream cheese and crab! Blew my mind! I will be dreaming of those!! A MUST TRY FOR
SURE.

Nigiri  ( all very very fresh , rice perfectly seasoned ) 
Donald Duck ( crab avocado Salomon ) 
Yellow tail ( Hamachi ) 
Red snapper (TAI) 

Maki Rolls - again very fresh , light rice on everything, easiness properly! Great overall long roll! 
MT ( Avocado, Crystal shrimp, tuna, yellowtail, salmon, shredded crab ) 
Monday  ( JalapeÃ±o cucumber red snapper green onion Tobiko, kani ) - husbands fav for the meal) little spice and light. 
CR7- Salmon spicy crab lime tempera shrimp cream cheese cilantro jalapeÃ±o onion ( I customized this to replace the cream cheese with Mayo! On point! 

Deep-Fried Rolls 
Crystal shrimp - I like they way they do this!  Everything is individual so you taste each component :) down to the toasted sesame , they don't mix the shrimp with the mayo and put it in the roll. I've never had it this way, but prefer it, after having it like this. For sure! 

Custom Roll - ( invented myself )
Cooked salmon, special crab mix, lemon, tempura shrimp with Mayo and Sriracha . ( blew my mind! - Holy Custom deliciousness!!!  ) 

Deserts  ( off the menu item ) 
Orange with plumb wine   ( best I have EVER HAD! Ever! ) 

Drinks 
2 large Sapporo 

Total - 65.95 with tip - ( big tipper  they deserved it) 85.00

Thank you team!! We will
Be back again  and again and will continue to send as many people as possible your way! GREAT JOB!

text:
I had a pretty rough day and was surprised with Koko's for dinner! I seriously have not had Korean food this good in Reno since moving from LA! I love that they added a lot of sides to the order even though it was takeout! 

I had the katsu and the spicy pork and it reminded me of a comforting home cooked meal! I ended up taking my left over spicy pork the next day and making my own "bibimbap" with a fried egg the next egg! It reheated well! 

It definitely is a new gem to grace Reno!

text: My husband and I were visiting Reno from out of town and wanted to get away from the casinos and see the much talked about mid-town of Reno. We were directed to a highly rated Yelp pub, but were let down upon arrival. Looking around we found Wonder Aleworks. It's fantastic, fun and open setting and the staff was fun and attentive. Really good pub food and yummy drinks. This is the place that should have the high Yelp reviews!!!
name: Wonder Aleworks

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': True, u'lot': False, u'validated': False}

categories: Food, Restaurants, Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Nightlife, Wine Bars, Cocktail Bars, Brewpubs, Breweries

text:
Upon entering this place was spacious, clean,  and has plenty of wood tables throughout and a large bar in the back half. One wall is a red brick and the other is covered with colorful art. Many TVs throughout. Has a Good selection of beers. Wine is limited but the white blend was decent. Our server was attentive and very sweet. Also they have a couple games for the kiddos to play which my son enjoyed. We were able to play uno after we ate our meal and finish our drinks;)

We Started with the beet salad! It was super good. More goat cheese then I've personally ever seen on a salad before in my life! No complaints there.

Next came the tachos with steak. Which are nachos but with tater tots in place of chips. I think they were good, but they definitely needed hot sauce, just our personal preference. There was an additional up charge for the steak which is fine and expected but there just wasn't much of it?? Just the smallest sprinkling of it.

Then we tried the jambalaya balls. They were large with a thick bread coating. Mostly seemed to be filled with dirty rice. Not bad, just not for me. 

Also tried the Fish and chips. The fries were perfect. The fish was very greasy, especially on the inside. Each bite seemed filled with oil and unfortunately with the vinegar and tartar they seemed fairly bland. 

For dessert we got the churro bites. These were a miss for me. Overly tough and dry, not just on the outside but all throughout. No soft chewy center... however my son still gobbled them up. He did say they're hard lol.. but apparently the sugar coating was enough. 

There are still many other items off their menu I would like to come back and try. Was still overall a positive experience but it just didn't blow our minds. I wish I could give a 3.5 rating.
name: Wonder Aleworks

text:
I must say umi sushi easily on my top three places for AYCE sushi in Northern Nevada. Our family came in mid afternoon on a Saturday and were seated right away. Service was excellent, and to top it off all fish, rolls and appetizers we ordered for lunch was excellent. 

Kuddos to all the chef and team at umi sushi. We had cajun salmon, gravlax, smoked salmon, and sake all of which was such a delight and wonderful to try the different types of salmon. The rice was sweet and flavorful which is really key to a good sushi.

Both uzura and ikura was very good. Ikura was marinated in a sauce which added a depth to the flavor. Miso soup, seaweed salad, vegetable tempura and mussels were served and cooked well. Very delicious. 

I would highly recommend umi sushi, and our family can't wait to go back.
name: Umi Sushi

Well can we say completely racist to Latinos , we  order a appetizer for starters and we wanted to order meals and drinks .  What was shocking to me was when the waitress stereotype my wife and I  and said the cocktail are to expensive. That was a red flag because we  didn't care about the price but for someone to assume that we couldn't  afford it was astonishing. My wife and I are fortunate to have great career and have traveled to multiple states. We walked out our waitress offered to comp our meal but we PAID but later came back and to ENSURED if 15$ was okay to run my card. (REAL I GAVE YOU MY CARD WITHOUT KNOWING THE PRICE COME ON) They boxed our meal but we later gave it to a homeless man. If your COLORED we strongly recommend not coming here.
  We later chatted with a few locals who mentioned that this establishment is new to the area as well not locally owned. Be advise do not judge a book by its cover Wonder Aleworks.

Tonight, on Xmas eve, we decided to get takeout and pulled out the menu that clearly shows "to go specials". When I ordered, they said they do not have the to go specials anymore. 

When I picked up my food, I asked them for an updated to go menu and they gave me the same menu that shows the "to go specials". I asked 2 different people and was told the boss would not honor the price that is clearly printed in their menu. I will be taking my business back to Pieces Sushi that is closer and honors their printed sale prices. 

Merry Christmas.

text:
Okay y'all...I think I've found my new favorite brewery! I have been so stoked about this place since I first saw the alcohol permit posted and have been patiently waiting for them to open. I heard they were doing a soft opening this week so I knew I had to jump on the chance.

First off, the ambiance is such a vibe! They left a lot of the Under The Rose layout and added murals, neon signs, bright and modern furniture and some really nice touches. It's clear a lot of thought went into the design. 

The staff is very kind--we talked to our hostess at length and she was very helpful. The owner actually sat down with us and asked how we liked the food and his plans for the future. 

Now the beer: it was all so incredible! I got a flight so I could try multiple beers and was not disappointed by any. Im blanking on the name now, but they have a spicy pineapple one that is AMAZING! They already have a huge selection and it sounds like they have more to come. 

As for the food, we only tried two things but both were SO good. The sliders are literally perfect--great proportions on the meat and the flavor is incredible. The fries are good too. We also got the totchos and those were good, though I feel like could use more sauce and more cheese (but that's just my opinion). The owner was telling us that the chef is from the South so there's definitely a southern influence on the menu and all sound bomb.

I'm so excited Wonder is finally open--I can't wait to frequent this spot!!
name: Wonder Aleworks

text: Late night stopped for dinner when most locations were closed. I called 1st and the guy on the phone was super nice about please come in and join us tonight! I did! And I'm very glad that I did. I ate their California cheesecake which was OK especially late at night. It came with fries. More importantly I tried about 7 of their beers. I have to say this is one of the more interesting breweries I've been to and we know I've been to a few! There was nothing boring here! There was nothing truly standard or "normal".  Overall it was edgy yet very good. Obviously the service is great even before I got there. The manager, Eddie, was super cool. If they had stayed open later I would have been there later! This is a brewery that I will definitely return to every time I'm in Reno.
name: Wonder Aleworks

text:
Umi Sushi is a new restaurant that opened about 3 months ago and I've driven past this place a couple times but decided to finally try it out.

The inside is nice and cozy with lots of seating. The bar is currently closed but I do prefer to sit at a table. My family and I got here roughly around 6:20 and it wasn't busy so we were seated very quickly. 

We started off with some of our usual appetizers. Miso soup, muscles, yakiton, and some calamari rings. All of them were delicious. The muscles were slightly cold but still yummy. The miso soup was hot and satisfying.

There are a lot of rolls to choose from in their menu, which I was very impressed with. I also loved how their rolls weren't too big and had the perfect amount of rice. Some of my favorite rolls were the golden gate, Pisces, Gemini, and Umi. Their sake and hamachi were also delicious.
name: Umi Sushi

text:
Seems there's been a bit of a dry spell along Virginia Street and it is great to see breweries springing up again in Midtown. Wonder Ale Works occupies the spot of the former Under the Rose, and have totally revitalized this fantastic spot. Some things seem familiar, others are wholly new. But all told, it coalesces to form an excellent drinking and dining experience.

Having visited a few times, it is very clear that the beer selection changes quite frequently. And talking to a few of the staff, it seems that given their smaller setup their goal at present is to make smaller batches of beers and rotate one or two in and out on an almost weekly basis, which certainly keeps things interesting. So while it means you may not see any flagships for the time being, the upshot is that it gives you all the more opportunity to try a wide range of types and styles.  So far I've tried such things as an Australian Pilsner that was a real eye-opener, an Imperial White Ale that really blew me away, and the Golden Rooster, an remarkably good and coffee-rich Blonde Stout, which when you get a shot of "Rooster Booster", a shot of coffee rum, really skyrockets the flavor AND the ABV. For sure worth a try. Beyond the beer, there is a full bar, with several signature house cocktails.

As for food, I must say they likewise hit all the right notes. The emphasis on the menu seems to be lots of sharable dishes, with some items being more familiar bumped-up bar fare and other creative house specialties available. They make a very nice Caesar wedge salad, for one. Their mozzarella sticks were exceptional, as well. But what they really hit it out of the park are the Shrimp and Grits. Holy cow, these are amazing! If you try one entrÃ©e, make it this. And make sure to come hungry if you do, as this dish fills you right up.

Prices here are very decent across the board, with a few items on the menu being a tad pricier, but the quality you get is outstanding. If possible, try to swing down during happy hour, where specials on food abound. Service has been, with only a few hiccups, very good indeed, with one bartender, "Cass" I believe her name was, being exceptionally friendly, attentive to all the customers, and having lots of great beer and food suggestions! The overall atmosphere fees much more like a sit-down restaurant than a typical brewery-pub, with bright, colorful dÃ©cor, plenty of table and bar space, and a small front patio with a fire pit. Nice to see older buildings like this finding new life as Midtown continues to grow and change. Parking is found either in the lot around the corner, or street spaces in the surrounding blocks.

All in all, this is another wonderful addition to the Reno beer scene. I will definitely be stopping back again real soon, wondering what is on tap next.

Cheers, guys!
name: Wonder Aleworks

text: With all the 5 stars I was really looking forward to trying this place out. I called in a to go order and was hoping to order their 4 roll for $25 take out special. Unfortunately when I called they said they no longer offered any specials. I decided to to order anyway. I ordered 2 long rolls, Umi roll and a cotton candy baked roll. The place was empty when I came to pick up my order. The hostess was standing at the back end of the restaurant and slowly came over to ask if I was eating in or picking up. I let her know I was picking up an order. It wasn't ready so I sat and waited. A couple minutes later she came back with my order and the check. $25+ tip for two rolls, yikes. I was really hoping the rolls were worth the price and the hype. Unfortunately I didn't love it. The Umi roll was too heavy on the Mayo sauce and the cotton candy roll didn't look appetizing with the brown avocado in it. Taste was just ok. With so many sushi places in town and quite a bit of choices in the south side of town, a sushi place really needs to stand out with either their service or their food, this unfortunately missed the mark for me.
name: Umi Sushi

text: I went looking for something close to authentic. This was not it. I'm sure many people like the food and that's great. It has 5 stars on Yelp but not for authenticity. I don't expect truly authentic Japanese food but if you're going to call yourself a Japanese restaurant then at least try to mimic the Japanese emphasis on taste AND presentation. The wasabi and ginger dish looked like someone's leftovers. A Japanese chef would never serve wasabi scraped on to the edge of the dish or the ginger flayed out all over. I ordered sashimi which was thick cut and fresh. I was hopeful. Then the salmon teriyaki came and it was so over cooked (not to mention served on bell peppers with very little teriyaki sauce). My sons chicken Katsu was also dry. The bento came with gyoza and tempura. There was no sauce for either and only a drizzle of tonkatsu sauce on the Katsu. The sauce in the bento, which I assumed was for the salad, was just ok.  The miso soup had too much miso paste and was very very salty. At least there was some tofu in the soup. Sakana serves diluted miso soup with nothing in it. I didn't order sushi because I prefer traditional rolls and there weren't any. I don't care for imitation crab or cream cheese in my sushi so that's on me. The first ingredient in their 3 poke dishes was also shredded crab. No crab goes in poke. Btw, I'm half Japanese and my mom owned a Japanese restaurant in Vegas. I worked there for 7 years. My search continues.
name: Umi Sushi

text:
I'm suprised with all the 5 stars reviews.. come on people, be honest. This is why yelp sucks!

The first time here was alright. They served water bottles at first and constantly brought us food we didn't order. They're pretty unorganized. The second time was a lot worst. They served us water with no ice and no water bottle this time. Asked for plates and the lady brought 2 plates when there are 3 of us and they were extremely slowwww....we literally waited 10 minutes in between each sushi roll and nigiri. They also forgot most of the nigiri we ordered.. I don't understand why they didn't bring it all at once when we only ordered 3 rolls. It ruined our hungry appetite. Mind you, there was us and just another group of 3 so there was no reason why the orders take more than 10 minutes and why they constantly messed up orders. We got there at 11:20 ish and left at 1:30 ish only because they were slow. The sushi selection sucks! Weird rows with weird things in it. Not my type of American sushi. A lot of the rolls consist of lemon, cilantro, jalapeÃ±os, garlic and cream cheese .  The nigiri and rolls were very cold too. The lady waiter was a bit rude and seemed irritated from all the things she messed up on but the guy waiter was more attentive. We gave this place a second chance and it was worst than the first time so we won't be back.
name: Umi Sushi

text: I had both the short rib plate and the shrimp plate with the calamari and they were all fantastic! I love how they cut the short ribs into little bite sized pieces. Everything that was fried was actually fried not soggy at all and we even got it to go not greasy literally perfect! It was my first time having real Korean food so the sides were interesting but Definitely good.  I liked the vegetables better heated They were cold when I got them but I think that's how they are suppose to be served so I didn't think much of i. The egg on the side was perfect and I honestly love the orange they give you with your meal it's a nice finisher for the plate. Serving sizes great customer service great! Wait was about 20 minutes but it was the first day they opened and pretty busy overall very great visit and ill be back for a fact!
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text:
I've been to Wonder a few times since my first review and I feel like it just gets better and better! My brother and I went here the other night and we got the tachos and jambalaya balls to share. I think the owner definitely relayed the feedback on the tachos because they are somehow even better than they were before! They added more sauce and the tots were even crispier. We added steak which I was i impressed were small bite -sized pieces and very manageable. Seriously obsessed with these! 

I had never had the jambalaya balls but jeeze are they good!! A tasty jambalaya deep fried--what could be better? They are massive tho so I definitely recommend sharing! 

Finally, their beers never cease to amaze me. This place is truly 10/10!
name: Wonder Aleworks

text:
me and a group of four saw this place open and i myself work at a korean restaurant and wanted to try and see if this is legit, and it was 

Doesnt look like much right on the outside nor the inside.. ambiance was very quiet, quiet tvs, no music and barely no one inside so 2 stars for lack of music and ambiance 

  We were greeted with very warm welcoming arms and sat down very quickly, same with the quickness of the food

  Each meal we ordered was paired up with a house soup and we got this potato type one.. not my favorite thing but everything else was amazing, the spicy pork was sooo good

one thing i want to point out, some prices were a bit in my opinion a little over price range of what it should be... for desert two mochis were 4.95$ which are probably the ones that are from costco in the small packages anyways. same with how i think the bento boxes are a little bit over price

nonetheless, the banchan was amazing, the yellow lemon looking ones were so good, spicy pork amazing and so happy that there is diversity of new foods that all of reno can rave about
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text: Ok I may change my review later to more stars but the 3 stars are more service related than the sushi itself.  The sushi was probably one of the freshest I've ever had.  Absolutely delicious.  There was only one waitress, we had to ask twice for water and our rolls came out with pretty big delays for how quiet it was there.  There were 3 other tables occupied other than ours.  Dessert was not offered, not a big deal but should have been.  Refills were not offered either on water or drinks without asking.  If the service could match the sushi it would have 5 stars! Maybe just getting started and new not sure?

text: I recently went to Koko's with a friend for lunch and really enjoyed it. I had heard there was a new Korean restaurant and since I like to expand my horizons, I knew I had to try it. The atmosphere is clean, bright and inviting. My friend got there first and ordered a barley tea so I followed suit. It's very earthy but a nice way to start a meal. We then split tempura veggies that were crispy and delicious. I got the beef bulgogi plate, which comes with meat, rice, banchan and soup. The beef was some of the best beef bulgogi I've had. The banchan was all so flavorful and exciting--I think liked the pickled radishes and the potato salad best, but they were all really good. I'm excited for a healthy-ish option in the Northwest and I'll definitely be back!
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text:
Wonder Aleworks was a nice stop for a late dinner and drink on a Tuesday night for us.  The rating is based on the full package of value to quality to experience, etc.  It is still early in their opening so I am sure they have some kinks to work out.  We tried the caprese salad, tacos and the chicken and waffle along with a few of their beers on tap.

The food had some mixed results.  The taco trio was excellent.  They had great flavor, were presented well and really checked all the boxes.  That was the best part of the meal.  The chicken and waffle was good but two small pieces of chicken and a single thin waffle as a "large sharable" was a bit of a let down.  While it tasted good, there was nothing exceptional about the item and for $18, you can definitely get a much larger serving of the same item at a lot of different places in town, likely something to skip next time for me.  The caprese salad was good and had some little crunchy salt bits on it.  However, the tomatoes weren't the nicest looking and the bed of spinach under it could have used some dressing if it was meant to be eaten. 

The beers were good, the pineapple-pepper one was the best of the three tried for the night. Great flavor and creative.  The beer pricing seems pretty fair so that was a positive.  Service was good as well. Very friendly and attentive staff. 

I didn't dislike my night there but I wasn't blown away either.  The biggest drawback for the spot is the value for what you get.  While the food and beer may taste good, you are definitely spending more money for the same items you can get elsewhere.  To me, this is likely more of a location to grab a beer and a snack and then make your way off somewhere to get a dinner. The menu does look fun so I do imagine we will be back at some point to try something else.
name: Wonder Aleworks

text: First time we went here it was meh. The second time was by far the worse service we've  ever had at an AYCE sushi place. There was only 1 other group of a party of 3 when we walked in. Order some appetizers, nigiri and rolls. Some of the appetizers was missing including some of the nigiri. Sushi came out 1 by 1 and we would always had to wait 5-7min for the next roll to come out and the place wasn't busy at all. Some of the nigiri I order came out to be a different nigiri and this also happen when we first came here. Always have to ask for a small plate, straw and order sheet. Some of the fish was not fresh. The tuna tasted old and the scallop was fishy. Had to spit out the scallops as it almost made me throw up. Shrimp shells was still on the shrimp and had to pick it out of my mouth. It was pretty cold today hoping inside would be warm but nope, they did not turn on the heater. My little family came in hungry and with the outrageous slow service and how slow the food came out ruined our appetite. Service sucks! Food came out super slow even though this place wasn't even busy. would not recommend to family and friends and most definitely never coming here ever again. $22.95 is definitely not worth it at this place with horrible service and majority of the rolls have cream cheese in it YUCK!!! save your money and go elsewhere.
name: Umi Sushi

text: We were excited to try this place since it is so close to our home. First off, the customer service was the worst I have ever had. The waitress was incredibly unfriendly. anytime she removed plates from our table they were removed forcefully and throw angrily behind us in the dish area. It made us incredibly uncomfortable. We asked for more wasabi, and  another sheet for more sushi and she didn't even acknowledge our request- she would just walk away and finally come back 10 minutes later with the item. The sushi was "okay"- but when you are treated terribly nothing is going to taste that great in my opinion. Customer goes a loooong way!

text: I'd recommend this place for cocktails but not for a meal. We all got the provincial clown which was perfectly made. We love a good gun cocktail! I did hear that it might be getting removed from their menu though. All of their food items are listed as shareables instead of entrees. My friends and I all got our own food item. I ordered the Tachos. The other pictures on Yelp are pretty accurate for them. They were tasty and unique, but I'd rather share it than eat an entire order of them myself. They also got soggy kind of quick. When you order a grilled cheese at a restaurant you expect it to be somewhat of a gourmet grilled cheese. My friend said it was pretty basic and she could've made it at home. They were starting bingo just as we were leaving. I think this would be a fun place for games and a cocktail in the future!
name: Wonder Aleworks

text:
I love supporting small, local businesses and well Koko's did not disappoint! The portion size was great and the taste was even better! I got the meat lovers plate with spicy pork bulgogi and teriyaki chicken, and tempura veggies as an appetizer. The spicy pork bulgogi had just enough spice and the teriyaki chicken was really tender! My 11 month old daughter really enjoyed it too! I was really surprised by the amount of banchan they give you! It was more than enough food! 

I also really appreciated the owners coming out to ask if everything tasted okay, I could see that they truly cared for their guests and wanted to ensure we were having a great experience. We will definitely be going back again!
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text:
The space is quite hip and artsy with exposed brick walls, murals, neon, and some mid-century modern seating areas. There is a separate room in back that can be reserved for parties or used as overflow. Located in super hip midtown, this place fits in perfectly. 
We went before noon on a Saturday and had the place to ourselves, just as I like. 
Our server Megan was friendly and attentive. She advised us the fryer was down so when we ordered sliders (that usually come with fries) she was more than happy to find a compromise. The chef made a nice little batch of soft, airy, buttery, garlicky bread goodness for us instead. We could have opted for a side salad but I had a big carb craving at the time!
The sliders w bacon jam hit the spot! Small, flat patties with a little crisp, perfect bacon jam sitting on a Hawaiian roll were delicious! Mmm
I also got a flight of beers, most there beers were on the lighter side, I think they had one stout. The caramel coffee kolsch was definitely a stand out but all were pretty good. I think the Blonde was the only one I didn't care for too much. 
They also have some cocktails on draft as well as hand crafted cocktail menu if you aren't craving beer.
This would definitely be a place I would hit up again.
name: Wonder Aleworks

Came in after 2pm with no problems sitting down. Staff provides great customer service.

We ordered the spicy chicken, teriyaki chicken, and short ribs.  The spicy chicken was my favorite, not covered in sauce with enough heat. The teriyaki chicken was good also, marinated and lightly covered in sauce. Both very tender.  The short ribs were marinated and flavorful but was a little too chewy for me.  Highlight of the dishes was the banchan it came with. Fire!

They don't serve alcohol currently but in the works of obtaining their license. 

Overall, recommended!

text:
They were quick and friendly when I came in to get take out. Disclaimer: I used to live in Orange County and go back often so I know good Korean food. My dad and I ordered the calamari, japchae, pork katsu, and pork bulgogi.  Katsu is a thin, breaded cutlet. The breading is light and crispy. Koko's katsu was a pork chop that was not tenderized and flattened and the breading was hard and Western style (it had more in common with shake n bake than katsu). The sauce tasted like it was store bought. The calamari had a thick breading but was tender. The tempura sauce was too heavy on soy and it overpowered the squid flavor. When I ordered the pork bulgogi I thought it would be dwaeji bulgogi but their bulgogi tasted okay. It lacked spice and that nice char that is part of Korean barbeque. I've never had bad japchae before Koko's and I did not realize that was a dish that could be messed up. The noodles were hard, there was no flavor, and I think the entire order had two pieces of black fungus and one bite of red bell pepper. Japchae is supposed to have deliciously almost chewy noodles (think less chewy than boba but more so than pasta). Japchae noodles are made with sweet potato starch. The banchan included fishy fish cakes (sub-par at best), potato salad (less sweet than normal Asian potato salad but not terrible), kimchi (mehh), cucumber kimchi (not crunchy and just sad), and bean sprouts (no flavor).
The second star is because the restaurant is new and the people were nice but I would not come back. The prices are pretty high for the food, too.
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text:
I must preface this review with a statement: I am not a connoisseur of Korean food. Please take my feedback with a grain of salt (which you'll be pleased to know is not an ingredient they overuse here).

I'll begin by stating that it's Yelp that brought us here. I hadn't heard any word of this place previously. The location is unassuming, and you're more likely to end up at Dominoes than here if you aren't paying attention.

The interior is cute and intimate, but not romantic. This is an ideal lunch spot. It's on the slower side now, but I expect that to change over time. There aren't even enough Korean restaurants in Reno from which to gauge the cuisine, in my opinion.

The menu is very accessible, which is a description that comes with a few noticeable caveats -- don't order anything spicy with the expectation that it will be spicy. I'd really like to see the term "spicy" live up to its definition in this city. You can't go to any Asian restaurant and have actual spicy food served. The spicy chicken here is sweeter than the kimchi. That's why I'm not prepared to raise my stars. There was also a significant amount of gristle in one bit of my beef bulgogi, as well as in one bite of the chicken. I understand that can sometimes be part of the rustic experience, but having to awkwardly spit a bit of food into a napkin because I can't chew it bugs me.

The tea was actually one of the highlights for me. Their jasmine tea is a bargain at $5 for two, and it's loose leaf! The fragrance alone transported me to another continent.

Service was efficient enough, but the waiter did incorrectly describe the spicy chicken as breaded (we couldn't tell from the tiny menu picture), and it is most certainly not.

The soup served was daikon and soybean in a black pepper broth. It was a perfect start to things! We started with their tempura shrimp appetizer. I'd definitely order it again. It was fairly priced at $6.50 for six pieces, and the dipping sauce was good.

The temperature contrast of all the food was the most interesting part of the experience. The northern hemisphere of my box were the hot items, and the southern hemisphere were all the cold items.

We'll be back to support this local restaurant as they make small adjustments to refine and standardize their menu.
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text:
4.5 STARS--
One of my new top AYCE sushi places in Reno!
Easy parking, high ceilings, friendly staff, and no wait at lunch time! ($22.95 for lunch, $27.95 for dinner) 

Skip the apps and go straight to the sushi! 
They give you 2 menus (appetizers and sushi)
We ordered the calamari and egg roll and they were just okay, nothing special (hence the - .5 stars). We will definitely skip them next time and order only sushi. 
SUSHI--
Very fresh and I don't think it's my imagination, but they are smaller bites than all the places I've been to, but the fish to rice ratio is AMAZING! A little teaspoon of rice, and a nice sized slice of sashimi over it. YUM! 

The rolls were also smaller than usual, but again, with the great filling to rice ratio. I appreciate the smaller size because that way we were able to try a more rolls without getting too full off of any single one, and there's less chance of waste! 

Everything we had was delicious, so you can't go wrong. It just depends on your preference.
Some of our favorite maki rolls:
MT
King Cobra
Baked Rolls:
High Roller
Cotton Candy
Fried Roll:
Black Manba (isn't it supposed to be Mamba? Or maybe there's a copyright issue there, Idk lol)

I usually don't go for fried rolls, but I tried a piece and it was SO GOOD. Not overly fried like how most places do it, so you're not sickly full after consuming that entire roll of mostly carbs and oil. 

We finished off with the chocolate mochi like we do at every other AYCE sushi place, and it was great as usual. 

The servers were very attentive and patient, especially after I accidentally spilled my entire cup of ice water all over the table... OOPS!-- tipped extra for that xD

Overall, it was a great lunch and will definitely be on our regular rotation of sushi!
name: Umi Sushi

text:
This place just opened. This place looks really clean and very spacious. The bar is currently closed, and I'm not sure if it's Covid-19 protocol. 

Now for the food. We had an order of the Donald Duck. The salmon was very fresh, and the quality of the fish was really good. We had an order of Unagi. The Unagi was perfect. Each slice had a little fat and it made it extra tasty. That's what we had for the Nigiri. Best of all, the chefs put a little portion of rice. This made it nice, so you're able to enjoy the food. Time for the long rolls. We ordered the Umi long roll. This is their special roll and it was really good. The cream cheese, cilantro, crab, and fresh fish went well together! There were two other rolls we ordered, but I forgot the names of them. The other rolls were also very delicious. Once I remember the names of the rolls, I'll edit my review. For now, check out the pictures. 

The service was great! The staff is really friendly and very attentive! You need to check this place out!
name: Umi Sushi

text:
First impression of Koko's was that everyone was so nice! The staff was upbeat and attentive. We were quickly seated and ordered a couple appetizers: gyoza and japchae. The gyoza wasn't super special but I thought the sauce complimented the flavors well. The japchae had good texture and the mushrooms in it were delicious. 

Next we ordered 2 meat dishes. FYI if you choose the Meat Lover's (2 choices) one of the choices CANNOT be short ribs. Because of this we chose one plate of spicy pork and one of short ribs so we could try both.

Each dish came out in a bento box style tray with rice, the meat, and several different banchan including kimchi, pickled radish, spinach, fish cakes, potato salad, and an orange. We also got a bowl of the soup of the day: a broth with tofu and peppery flavor.

Overall I was quite impressed! The meats were tender and very flavorful. Get the perfect bite with  rice, meat, and kimchi all on your spoon and have a sip of soup in between. I felt full and satisfied and felt the portion was very reasonably priced. I hope in the future they expand their menu some more because I'd be excited to see what else they can do! Seems like the perfect place to have appetizers like tteokbokki, kimbap, or wings. Would recommend and can't wait to come again!
name: Kokoâs Korean Kitchen

text: Normally in the past, I wouldn't give this place 5 stars but I think I can now. The new owner has cleaned up the place. It's not sparkly clean but it will do. What's cool is now they serve Vietnamese and Chinese food. Not much of a dining area but it's worth it. I feel bad for this place having fresh/frozen fish. Cultured people don't mind especially those that have been to a real fish market. It's supposed to smell like fish. Sure frozen fish filets at an American Supermarket  don't smell like fish because... they are frozen and have been gutted of everything. So yeah, if don't mind it not looking like a Raley's or Whole Foods, I'm sure you'll enjoy the selection and cheap prices and if you don't feel like cooking, their cook to order food is delicious.

text: This place has gone downhill big time. I've been going to Asian markets my whole life and I use to frequent here. My last three visits however have been bad experiences. I understand Asian markets don't typically smell great but this place just plain stinks like spoiled fish now, this coming from a guy who likes the smell of fish sauce. It's much more smelly and dirtier than it use to be. The woman who owned the place, who was knowledgeable and relatively nice, hasn't been there on the last three visits and it shows. I bought the fried fish for lunch and my son has been throwing it up for hours, maybe unrelated but with the cleanliness issues who knows.

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': True, u'street': False, u'lot': True, u'validated': False}

categories: Chinese, Grocery, International Grocery, Imported Food, Specialty Food, Food, Restaurants, Ethnic Food

text:
No joke. That is the name of the store. :)

I'm sure any of us could have come up with something a bit more interesting than that, but I suppose you have to be straight forward with people in northern Nevada. Not too many stores in that area with the things that this one sells or at least I never found one.

For a long time it was hard finding many Asian foods, cooking items, etc in Tahoe and so we had to find other places to get what we needed. Often times we had to wait until a trip to San Francisco to pick up things that we needed. There was a particular store, a Hawaiian store that had a lot of the things we loved to eat, but after moving twice, they ended up closing shop. That forced us to look elsewhere. 

After many searches, I found this place in Sparks and since we made weekly trips to Reno it was no issue going there. I couldn't find anything other than a name. So that meant taking a drive there to find out for ourselves what they had. It turned out being a VERY worthwhile trip. The store was of a decent size. They sold the rice we liked, they had cuttlefish (which I LOVE), haw flakes, various sauces and spices we cooked with, lup cheong, saimin, manapua (and other buns) and they even had Aloha Shoyu!!! Which had become a rare find in those parts. They also had all the other fare of the Pacific Islands and the region.

If you were looking for fresh fish, they had that as well as fresh veggies, but given the fact they were hours away from the Pacific Ocean, I wasn't too sure about the freshness, but it all looked good though.

If you wanted something hot to eat, well then you're in luck. They make a variety of foods for take out. Their sesame chicken was favorite of mine. Add some white rice and mmmmmm... I was set :)


It was a such a great find and we shopped there all the time. I give it 5 stars because it made our lives in Tahoe even that much better. We had gone without those things for a few years and they were all very missed.
name: Asia Market

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': True, u'street': False, u'lot': True, u'validated': False}

categories: Chinese, Grocery, International Grocery, Imported Food, Specialty Food, Food, Restaurants, Ethnic Food

text: We stopped here while visiting Sparks and was very impressed with this store, especially with the selection of fresh fish. Also, we were surprised to see that they also sold hot cooked food as well. The cooked Vietnamese corn was delicious! The store staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return on our next trip to Sparks.
name: Asia Market

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': True, u'street': False, u'lot': True, u'validated': False}

categories: Chinese, Grocery, International Grocery, Imported Food, Specialty Food, Food, Restaurants, Ethnic Food

text: After shopping around town at some other Asian supermarkets, I realized something I take for granted. An Asian Market with Asian Workers that speaks English with no accents but also knows their products. I'm being dead serious. Think about it. Have you ever walked into an Asian supermarket and thought to yourself... where shall I begin? You googled your recipe and you take a gander at your ingredient list and you look like a deer staring into oncoming headlights. Well I'm Chinese and Vietnamese and with some ingredients with only "Asian" names, I find it comforting that I can ask the employees here for help. Not only they know what I'm looking for but I can understand them. No longer do I need to bust out google translate or have to listen to the employee who works in America tell me they don't speak English. I actually find that offensive. I personally enjoy the fact I can go find Asian ingredients and product with someone who speaks English.
name: Asia Market

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': True, u'street': False, u'lot': True, u'validated': False}

text: Close to where I live, has all the herbs I need for spring rolls, and they have a dining area. This is one of the other Asian markets that I'm a regular at.

text:
This is a pretty good little store.  They have some fresh hot food items by the front I've never tried though seems to be Filipino.  They carry a lot the stores not particularly clean ie smells of fish and dust, but that doesn't take away from its 'charm' just adds to it I guess in some sort of sickly 1st world way.  
I think they have a good price on Shrimp Chips.  Some hard to find items.  The vegetables are cheap small selection though.  Also some surprise items in coolers.  I found a very cheap package of already seasoned Unagi and some good priced Calamari pieces.  Spring rolls too of course but way cheaper then anywhere else.  I like this store.  It has a very almost inhabited feel like the owners live there but they don't.  It's a little hard to find.  Don't miss it its pretty small you can park on either side though.
name: Asia Market

text:
I ordered delivery through the hubbub app and they probably have on of the most extensive delivery menus I've ever seen. The delivery was Fast and my order was 100% which doesn't always happy so right off the bat, I had a good feeling about this restaurant. 

First I tried the rice which was delicious, moist, and really flavorful. I got a side order which was really small and I wish I would have gotten a lot more. 

The fish taco had lots of fish, which was crispy and moist and really flavorful but the pico had lots of onions. The crispy tacos I ordered were all a little bland and dry. But the ground beef was my favorite, they sautÃ© veggies in with the beef which made it a little sweet. The shredded beef was flavorful but the tortilla shell was bland and the chicken taco was all around really dry and bland. I wish I would have gotten a soft taco to taste against the crispy shells to see if they were any better. 

Overall, ordering was really convenient and the pricing was really good so I think I would order again. The rice and fish taco were actually really delicious and I'd definitely eat them again.
name: Nevada Taco Grill

text: If you are looking for South East Asian products, this is your place. The store is clean and the produce is super fresh. They also have a great frozen section of items that you will not find in a regular market, such and snails. Not the type you find in French Cuisine, but the snails you would find in many street foods of Thailand, Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam. The older gentlemen at the cash register is a sweetheart and they will help you find what you need.  I called over 4 local Asian markets to find Thai basil and this store had it!  I also was able to find pre-slices Asian papaya, dried shrimp to make salad... and... wait for it, Rau Mung. I don't know the English name for it, but it is a delicious type of Asian spinach you sautÃ© with garlic and oil. Super good for you and hard to find, unless you drive to Sacramento. Please don't expect Sacramento Asian Market prices. The prices are higher here, but at least you don't have to spend the money in gas or time to travel to Sac.  This will be my number one Asian market to go to!  So excited to make a few dishes, will post to show you before and after.
name: Asia Market

text: NOT FOR OLD SILVER PEAK FANS... I saw the local news announcement of the First Thursday event happening which involved the new Huntsman Brewing; also thought this was part of the MidTown Business Bingo, so seemed like the perfect day to try this, before the "Grand Opening" on Sept 3. Well, what a waste of time ! No Bingo cards provided, nothing special happening, neither event even mentioned by staff.  Went in with the intention of ordering multiple beers and some food but our server was so confused by his handheld ordering device that we change our minds (as soon as he delivered the wrong beer after we watched him patiently waiting for the bartender to realize he had place an order and then verbally telling her what it was). Only four Huntsman beers on tap, tried the Cream Ale and it was Just OK. No Masks being worn by staff; even the staff member at the host station. The new owner is definitely serving a different clientele than Silver Peak.
name: Huntsman Brewing

categories: Mexican, Tacos, Restaurants, Fast Food, Food Stands

text: I've been driving by this place for the past month or so and we finally popped in. It definitely is one of those hole in the wall places. They have a pretty extensive menu. We had rolled  tacos with beef we got them smothered in guacamole and cheese. A Chile Riano. And Carne Asada nachos. The rolled tacos were OK. Crisp shell, the meat was not seasoned but had a nice taste. The guacamole was definitely the smoother guacamole and not chunky. All in all it reminded me of taquitos from my childhood. The Chile Riano was really good! It was not greasy at all, just the right amount of crisp on the outside and cheese on the inside. Definitely will get that again. The Carne Asada nachos were really good! The chips were crispy, just the right amount of salt. The whole thing together was delicious. The Carne  Asada with seasoned very well. The nachos were not soggy and drenched with tons of melted cheese and beans. Just very crisp and tasty. I think they had Carne Asada, pico de gallo, shredded cheese and sour cream. Good to the last bite! This is a no-frills place. We decided to eat in as we were the only ones there. Everything was served on Styrofoam, but it just made the experience a little more authentically "divey." We will go back.
name: Nevada Taco Grill

text:
I came here on my lunch break this week, being an idiot thinking it was Yim's... I've never looked long enough at the map to look past anything other than Sparks and around prater/rock area. As soon as you walk in, the smell is pretty potent. They look like they have or had a food area with the hot holding display case etc. Not sure if that is something they do at all or its long gone. Looked like its not currently in use. 

I browsed the store, the frozen section has everything in Chinese (I'm assuming, and not sure which dialect obviously) and was sparsely full. I found imitation crab, but it was a brand I've not seen and small packages. They have a large fridge area of sodas and drinks too. 

Continued on and see they have like a butcher block area that presumabley would hold fish and other meats, again, it was hardly in use. Some fish were frozen, some were thawed and it smelled bad. I didn't even go by the produce area. 

Grabbed a bottle of hoisin sauce for my homemade spring rolls back at the office and left. The cashier was nice though, and is probably from here, didn't detect an accent at all. 

As I was pulling out I was fairly disappointed thinking it was Yim's, came back to the office to write a review and saw I wasn't, in fact, at Yim's. 

My point is, there are far, far, FAR better Asian markets in town, I will not be back to this one.
name: Asia Market

text:
One of my friends posted about Paolo's on Facebook. We decided to try them out and I went to get sandwiches for lunch. We got the Italian Stallion. This sandwich is ridiculously good! Every ingredient is delicious on its own and together they're nothing short of fantastic. Every meat has a separate and distinct flavor. Roasted red peppers add sweetness and pepperoncinis add a kick. Many times provolone is flavorless, but here, the cheese has wonderful flavor. Big slices of tomato and leaf lettuce add crunch.  The whole sandwich is better than any I've had in Reno. 

Aside from the food, the people are all friendly and the place has a bit of Old World ambiance. If you really want to help local businesses and eat a very tasty sandwich, skip Subway and go to Paolo's!
name: Paolo's Deli

text: Located inside a shared space with a gas station.  I went to the drive thru to order so I am unable to comment on the inside.  Extensive menu for those that want a full meal to the lighter side.  My food was made to order with high quality ingredients.  Both the chicken and the carnitas burritos were excellent.  Neither burritos had rice so it was packed with protein.  Other places use rice as a filler so you don't get much protein.  I prefer white meat chicken which was used in the burrito.  I wasn't expecting much from this place but it far exceeded my expectations.  Good value and priced right for an affordable meal.  Looking forward to returning to try Taco Tuesday and other menu items.

text: Paolo's Deli is located in Southwest Reno, fronting Moana Ln. near Lakeside Drive. One of the best local Italian deli's in Reno. Right when you walk into the door you are greeted with a smile from Jason and his family with a real Italian ambience feel. Little Italian music playing in the background. The deli is extremely clean and inviting with various types of sandwiches, spaghetti and meatballs, various types of pasta's and so much more. The prices are well within reason, especially with the high quality of the food. I will continue to keep coming here to support Jason and his family!

text: I'm addicted to their plain California Burrito. Is it the greatest Mexican food ever? No. Is it filled with everything imaginable you can put in a tortilla? No. But in its simplicity there is magic. The beef is seasoned well and ive never found a tough or chewy bit. Onions, cilantro and a bit of Pico  some cheese. along with only rice as a filler. No beans and you can get it with fries but i think of that more a breakfast burrito thing. Throw an egg in it there ya go. The green or red salsa is fine nothing amazing but adds nicely. The tortilla itself is  not overly doughy and holds up great. And they have FRESH lime to squeeze along with a sprinkle of salt on each bite is a MUST.and ive gotten the bags of peppers and carrots too. I pretty much  only have been thru the Drive thru so i cant tell you about the inside. ALSO be aware they CHARGE to use a ATM card. So i just bring cash. Once i realized it and was not wondering why the price kept going up and down it was all good.
name: Nevada Taco Grill

text:
We have been searching throughout Reno and Sparks for a particular brand of ramen noodles: MaMa. In California (Sacramento), you could find them in some Targets, Wal-Marts, and local supermarkets but no such luck here.

We tried everything from Old Northwest Reno to the Cost Plus World Market near Sun Valley to various Targets and Wal-Marts. Finally, we asked the clerk at the Cost Plus for some suggestions and explained that we were looking for a particular brand of Thai ramen and he suggested this store.

We were pleased to find our coveted MaMa Ramen and a variety of supplies (wasabi, sesame and chili oil) as well as Boss Iced Coffee Drinks from Japan. It's an old building but clean and easy to navigate wider aisles, and the owner/cashier was extremely friendly. It was easy for my wife to shop and the only thing stopping us from giving it five stars is they only had nine packages of ramen on the shelf. We will happily come back to see if we can buy them in bulk next time!
name: Asia Market

text:
If this place doesn't scream friendly neighborhood deli, nothing will. 
Walking in you are greeted by the friendly staff (Roxy) that are eager to help.
Sandwich menu has quite a few options but not overwhelming. The ham, turkey and provolone sandwich is one of my favorites. 
The meats and cheeses are great but the bread is also a hit with all of their sandwiches. 
In addition to sandwiches, they have many pastas dishes to go. The spaghetti and meatballs have become one of my favorites. 
While you're waiting, they have a nice selection of Italian products for sale- olives oils, pastas other other treasures to be had. 
Clean, friendly and awesome food.
name: Paolo's Deli

text: We've been a fan of the food at Nevada Taco Grill since discovering it in a mini mart on Kietzke. They moved closer to home on Vista and Baring Blvd inside the Vista gas station mini mart on the corner. Very easy to find. Plenty of parking. They offer the same great food and friendly service and now they have a small seating area. They have combo plates all reasonably priced in the $8.00 range.  They also have the usual burritos, tacos, nachos etc. Today I had the carne asada burrito and my partner had the nevada burrito.  The burritos are large, stuffed full and packed with flavor. We have previously had their breakfast burrito,  carne asada fries and enchiladas. Not once have we been disappointed. I highly recommend trying them if you are in the area and you want a fast, delicious meal. And if you're not in the area and are thinking about trying them you won't be waiting a trip to go out of your way.
name: Nevada Taco Grill
