text:
I thought the menu had a great variety of options.  I enjoyed the fact that the waitress had open communication regarding the food prep wait times (45 minutes for most food).  Being that my friend was pregnant, the transparency was nice.

I had ordered the Tavern Fries to share and they were ridiculously delicious, the perfect balance of sweet and salty. 
I ordered the cider (to my surprise the last one available) and it was the best tasting cider I have had.
For main plate I went with the pesto pizza, which I liked. I'm more used to a crunchy crust but the change was nice.

The portions were generous.  My food came out really quick, whereas my pregnant friend's did not, but hence the appetizer to share.  She ordered some chicken wings for her husband but after waiting a good 30 minutes after we ate, the waitress was upfront about the exceptionally long wait to cook those.

Given the current times we were understanding. I thought she was a wonderful waitress- Summer was her name!  There was also a gentleman that walked my friend around the restaurant as we were trying to find each other.  That was really nice.  

We had tried to sit on the rooftop but there was a bunch of large group reservations.  So next time, if permitted I will call ahead to secure a spot.  
Given the friendly staff, great location, yummy food and awesome drinks I would like to venture back.
name: Huntsman Brewing

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}

categories: Pizza, Chicken Wings, Food, Brewpubs, Nightlife, Beer Gardens, Pubs, Bars, Breweries, Restaurants

text:
Came here for their hard opening tonight. It was crowded and the poor servers were running around making sure everyone was getting what they needed. Since it was a group of us we didn't mind the wait for the food because we were enjoying just hanging out.  
The food came out and everything was delicious. I split the tavern fries, Mac n cheese and, orange ginger wings with a friend. The fries were good. They were hot and crunchy topped with goat cheese, honey and, pork belly. The flavors all went really well together.  The wings were well cooked and sauced in their homemade sauce. They weren't spicy but you could taste the orange and ginger really well. The Mac n cheese was gooey and delicious. Great flavor.  
Our server was super friendly and ended up thanking us for being so patient and understanding of the long wait time for the food it was a fun place to grab some food and hang out with friends. I will definitely go back when I am back in Reno.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
I basically lived in the original Silver Peak on Wonder Street when it was open. (Now, I plan on doing the same after my great experience). 

When I learned they were opening Huntsman Brewery in this ideal location, I was excited. 

When I got to actually enter the location and check it out, I fell back in love with my old memories and the idea of making so many more ones in the oldest location in Reno!!! The history mixed with the new fresh concepts and food was wonderful. 
 
I walked in and I had a great chat with the welcome staff, that had merchandise to snag (I love swag!), Bingo cards and super friendly explanation of how to order etc. 

The bartender Nicki was so great, I would go go back to just hang out with her. She knew all the crazy drinks to make and made even a busy evening look easy and took her time to make conversation and check in with everyone while she worked non stop.

I got one of the beers on tap and also sampled the Huntsman branded brews, now I know why their tagline is "Beer Is Boss" it was so great and such a good summer sample. 

For an appetizer we tried the jalapeno poppers which were good, followed by the gatherer salad (this was awesome!) and our table split a few of the flatbread/pizzas too. 

We hung out for a few hours and had a great time chatting with the brewer and chatting with others about their good memories from ALL the places that made a home out of this location over the decades. 

It was a REALLY great thing for me to see my hometown favorite spot start their new journey on such a great note. 

Expect to see me here to work on my laptop at the bar, happy hour with friends and business lunches. 

Also, the PATIO!!! It needs no explanation the sunsets are stunning, they have heat warmers up there and I am just dying to see live music return to the best view in Midtown. 

Welcome to the history fabric of the biggest little city.  

Kudos team, you made Renoites cheers!!
name: Huntsman Brewing

categories: Pizza, Chicken Wings, Food, Brewpubs, Nightlife, Beer Gardens, Pubs, Bars, Breweries, Restaurants

text:
Meatball sub, tiramisu, eggplant parmesan.

I kind of waffled between 4 and 5 stars.  It's definitely 4.5 in my book.  The tiramisu was tasty: it was light and had a nice coffee flavor: probably my favorite of the three.  It was so deliciously light!  

The meatball sub was also tasty, albeit not blow me away good.  Would I prefer it to the type of sandwich shop I get at a sandwich shop?  Absolutely!  It absolutely blows Subway out of the water.  I'd personally prefer a bit more flavor: maybe an arrabiata, or some more herbs, or maybe have my meatballs a bit more browned or something.  I wanted the seasoning to be more aggressive, in one way or another.

The eggplant parmesan was just okay.  I honestly found it a bit off.  I make eggplant parmesan, and while this was an okay rendition, I feel like I could make better.  (That being said, it would take me 2 hours and I'd have to make 8 servings.)  But again I wanted more seasoning, and while it was certainly good I think it would've been better if the eggplant were just a little bit more cooked (though it was still perfectly fine)

This is very much a neighborhood deli in what maybe isn't quite a neighborhood, and that makes this a bit weird.  If I were in a small town and this was in my local neighborhood, I'd be quite happy.  Considering it's not that far from midtown and downtown, where there are a lot of other food options all over the map, the vibe feels a bit weird.  

It's a deli that almost counts as a restaurant based on its offerings.  If you think of it like a neighborhood deli, it's fantastic, albeit a bit more expensive and maybe mislocated.  If you think of it as a restaurant and compare it to the best Italian restaurants in Reno, it doesn't quite measure up, albeit it's definitely cheaper.  It's good, basic food, but it's not really a culinary experience.
name: Paolo's Deli

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}

categories: Restaurants, Italian, Sandwiches, Delis

text:
Everyone is super friendly and helpful! They really care about customer service and I feel very comfortable asking for help when I need it. 

They have a lot of delicious house-made food. The banh cuon is still my favorite (steamed rice batter filled with ground pork and topped with onions, cilantro and Vietnamese fish sauce). The filling is very flavorful and the rice noodles are nice and thin. The nc chm is sweet with a nice kick of spice. 

There's a good selection of frozen fish and fresh veggies. They have a lot of Filipino food, and the prices are very good! They've moved the cash register since I've last been in, and it's much more open at the entrance. This might be my favorite Asian market in town, because of their excellent service and nice selection.
name: Asia Market

The hot food that I've had here has always been tasty, and they even have a full menu that you can order off of. I recently discovered that they serve my all time favorite Vietnamese dish (bahn cuon) fresh on Thursday's and in the fridge on Fridays. None of the Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to in Reno serve this dish! They also sell crispy pork belly, and it is something that I wish I could always have in my fridge. 

They've got good prices for their noodles, sauces and spices. It is a convenient place for me to grab what I need for dinner!

text:
I had high hopes for this place but unfortunately they were crushed. First off it was 50Â° outside which was warmer than it was inside the restaurant. Our waitress noticed that we were cold and said that she would turn up the heat. It never did get any warmer. 
I ordered the Pork sliders and the Tavern fries, my wife ordered the smokey Chicken wings. Even though it was 1:30pm we were told that they had not smoked any wings yet so my wife would have to get her wings fried. 
After about a 45 minute wait, the appetizer of Tavern fries came out at the same time as the food. The Pork sliders that I ordered were 95% fat which was too much for me so I passed those on to my wife and I settled on eating the Tavern fries. The Tavern fries were ok but nothing to write home about. I also tried the coleslaw. I do not know what kind of coleslaw recipe that was but it was awful. It had a chemical taste to it like someone sprayed cleaner in it. Obviously that went to waste. 
While waiting for our food to come out, there was loud cursing coming from the kitchen. Seemed like someone was having a bad day. 
Cost to portion size was not in-line. For 8 wings, 2 small sliders w/coleslaw, a serving of Tavern Fries and 2 cokes came to $50. 
It pains me to have to leave a review such as this but it was truly a terrible experience. 
On a side not, it is very difficult to get into this building if you are in a wheelchair. 
I sincerely hope for the sake of your business that you are able to do better.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text: First time visiting. I ordered a muffuletta, insalada mista, and small order of meatballs. The salad was wonderful, nice variety and delicious. text: I saw this place after finishing up with a doctor's appointment in the area and decided to try it out. I entered during lunch hour and ordered their Italian sausage and peppers sandwich to eat first and the muffulleta (hope I spelled that right) sandwich lunch at work. I ate the sausage and peppers sandwich upon getting home and it was tasty but not really anything to write home about. It simply did it's job. It was later when I had the muffulleta that I was impressed. I've had good sandwiches but this is up there with some of the best I've had. I realize why this is their most popular dish. I'll definitely go back here for the muffulleta. I would give this place five stars but I wasn't that impressed with their sausage and peppers sandwich.
name: Paolo's Deli

text:
I'm sorry to give this restaurant a 2 star, because the people and owners were really so nice.   Sadly the kitchen was a hot mess.  These guys brew some of the best beer, but it took over an hour and a half to get our food and it was a bit lackluster.  My salad seemed to be missing several of the ingredients, namely the avocados.  My husbands French dip was the tiniest sandwich ever!  And he got about 8 fries with it.  My friends turkey pesto was served on a really large dry bun that was not prepped in any apparent way.  

I did love my "milkshake" creamy beer with hints of orange and vanilla.  It was the bomb.   I also tried the sour, which was great.  If you go, maybe skip the food and just enjoy the beer!  

The ambiance is good, not much has changed over the years since the old Baileywicks.   Maybe these guys should follow Baileywicks lead and just focus on perfecting a burger and fries.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text: Went in for lunch this week, plenty of seating.  Greeted promptly, and given menus, and asked for drink order.  I would say service initially was good, but it was fairly obvious the waitress wasn't very experienced.  Menu is okay - I was expecting more, probably because of my experience with the previous restaurant, Silver Peak.  We ordered fish and chips and the bison burger, along with an apricot beer and a glass of pinot.  The burger was extremely dry, there was nothing on it as far as condiments go.  Too much bread to meat ratio.  The fries - I had high hopes, they looked good, if a bit greasy, but they weren't done.  They weren't crispy, they were raw in the middle.   The final straw if you will, was when we got our bill - I didn't get to see a copy of the bill, she just came with a machine and then asked me to read my card number including the expiration date in the middle of a restaurant with customers at lunchtime.    I found that very unprofessional and sketchy - anyone could have overheard and written it down.  She said she couldn't see the numbers and didn't have her glasses (really?)  Anyway - the beer was good, but that is not enough reason to go back when there are too many other great bars in midtown.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
I wish I could say curiosity drove me to stop into this little market but that's not the case. My wife saw a recipe for vegan BBQ Jackfruit that is supposed to taste so much like meat you wouldn't miss it. She remembered seeing canned jackfruit at this store so.... the request goes straight to the top of the Honey-Do list and off I go! I like to try new things and experience different cultures so this was my cultural adventure for the week.  

When I got to the store I was pleasantly surprised to see the store was clean and well organized. The staff not only spoke very good English, they were friendly and engaging. I didn't feel like a total stranger just because I didn't speak their language. More importantly, the prices are very good compared to other Asian markets that I've been to. 

I love to see the different products that are popular in other cultures and this little market did not disappoint. 
I was completely enthralled by the variety of different drinks that they had in their refrigerated section. I will definitely be back to explore some of those. 

One thing to note, the store was very cold and everyone was wearing a coat so bring one if you come.
name: Asia Market

text:
Decided to check this place out after stopping for gas and noticed the new sign up. It's in the back corner of the Vista Mart and used to be a Dominoes Pizza. Unusual location but I'm always up for a Taco. Workers are extremely friendly. They were fast, friendly and attentive. Great customer service!The street Tacos were just ok and lacked some flavor. Also got a side order of A Chile Relleno and was good and only cost a little over $3. Totally worth it. Not the best Street Tacos & Chile relleno I've had but for the value, it was decent. The pickled veggies here were so delicious and they had fresh cut cucumbers, which was a nice fresh treat alongside my tacos. 
This is not the greatest tacqueria our there but nice to have something in that area that gets the job done. They are really new and maybe are still fine tuning everything. We would definitely try them out again.

text:
I have been missing our trips to Italy and the local shops and delis on every street offering quick high quality meals.  What has Reno truly been missing?  A great Italian deli with quick high quality meals.  Don't breathe on anyone for a few days after eating at this amazing authentic Italian deli.  We recently had the Misto Salad, Meatballs, Lasagna, Eggplant Parmigiana.  

My wife and I both ordered the Misto Salad.  The Misto salad had, like the name denotes, a mix of tantalizing roasted vegetables, fresh light angel hair pasta salad, simply satisfying white bean salad, and a small green salad full of little surprises like olives, red onions and a light house Italian dressing.  

A few days before tonight's visit I ordered the eggplant parmigiana piled high with flavorful homemade marinara and high quality mozzarella and parmigiana.  The eggplant is roasted to perfection not fried like so many others.  

Back to tonight, my daughter ordered a huge slice, of "like momma made" lasagna.  The highest quality tomato sauce, mozzarella, bÃ©chamel rather than ricotta, just the right amount of meat.  She ate everything on her plate and gave it a thumbs up to take one home from the case for our son. I had a bite and.  I make a great lasagna and this was worth the trip.  

Both of my visits I ordered meatballs on the side and can't wait to come back and eat more.  Light, let the meatballs do all the speaking for themselves, smothered in homemade sauce and a sprinkle of parmigiana.  They are tender, juicy, not overly seasoned or overly filled with breadcrumbs.  The prefect balance of love and experience go into all of the dishes.  

I am coming back soon to try the Porchetta sandwich ASAP!  

Thank you for opening a quick high quality Italian deli here in Reno.  

If you want to bring the family for an early dinner get there before 6.  It is worth rushing over with the family, or just drive by on your way home and take it with you.  It is quick and ready to go as soon as you get up to the deli case.  

The owner brought out a small Caprese salad with our Misto salad I forgot to mention.  Lightly drizzled with olive oil, fresh basil.  He also brought out a thick balsamic vinegar strait from Modena, with salt and pepper.  

I feel extremely welcome every time I visit.  I know everyone who visits will recognize many of the faces serving you in this fine establishment.  

Go find it and check it out!!!
name: Paolo's Deli

text:
We found the Huntsman by happenstance yesterday, what a great surprise! Greeted at the entrance by friendly staff, we learned they've only been officially open since Sept. 3rd. The downstairs had a cool mountain lodge vibe going on, but the patio upstairs was very much the place to be.

Highlights were: great beers and fantastic wings! 

We tried their Red Roaster 'Revival' red ale, the hazy Fog Cloud IPA, Huntsman IPA and the very delicious Misty Mountains Milkshake IPA. Will be great if/when they start doing tasting flights, but our server was happy to let us sample a couple of the beers. 

The wings were some of the best I've had in town, highly recommend the sweet bbq bourbon flavor. 

We'll definitely be back to try more!
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
I truly love finding random, unexpected eateries. While running family errands, we stopped at a gas station/convenience store in Sparks. Tucked in the back corner is a small kitchen, complete with a flat-top grill and deep fryer. I've heard the place previously served pizza; before that, burgers with a drive-thru window. It's now home to Nevada Taco Grill, a no frills taqueria serving up the goods in a tiny space with seating for perhaps 10, assuming they're well-acquainted. My trio ordered a few items, and found a spot to sit and dine amongst folks waiting on take-out.

The two person operation was cranking out food in short order, and we soon settled into our unplanned feast. Somewhat ironically, the tacos were actually the least successful items. Curious about the difference between the "street" vs "regular" tacos, we tried a couple of each ($1.99 and $2.99, respectively). Choice of meats included shredded chicken or beef, grilled chicken, carne asada, carnitas, and adobada, and they also have specials during the week that include hard-shell, house-fried tortillas.

The street variety were the typical pair of 3" corn tortillas--topped with meat, diced onion, and fresh cilantro--while the regulars were 6" single tortillas with the same ingredients, plus fresh pico de gallo. The pork carnitas and adobada were a bit on the crunchy side from being tossed on the grill, but they still tasted good. Beef asada was better, though a tad chewy. They were also a little light on the meat, compared to other tacos around town.

A combo plate of three shredded beef, rolled tacos were served with melted cheese on top, guacamole, and sides of rice and beans ($7.25). The taquitos were crunchy with good masa flavor--filled with plenty of seasoned meat--and much better than their unfried cousins. The rice was fair, frijoles refritos quite good, but the guacamole was a blended, runny sauce. Not bad, just not the chunky stuff I prefer.

Given a choice between shredded or grilled chicken on my mother's torta ($5.75), we went grilled. The small chunks of meat were actually tender and reasonably moist, accompanied by bell pepper, onion, tomato, and lettuce on a soft, perfectly lovely Mexican roll. The kind of soft that almost falls apart when you bite in. We all agreed it was a damn fine sandwich.

Always on the hunt for a decent chile relleno--yet always with low expectations--I went ahead and got the relleno and cheese enchilada combo plate ($8.75). The enchilada was average, but the stuffed pepper was easily my favorite item of the meal. The large poblano was meaty--not overcooked--with a nice bit of kick. Stuffed with a ton of melty cheese and topped with a fresh and flavorful, just-shy-of-chunky red enchilada sauce, every bite made me sad to see it disappear. Surprisingly, this gas station chile relleno is among my top 5 from the past few years.

My wife just can't not order nachos ($9.50), and I'm glad she did. Topped with a ton of carne asada, refried beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, guacamole, and both melted and shredded cheese sprinkles, the thin, crispy chips did a respectable job with their burden. The chips themselves were excellent, and the bounty of well-seasoned meat and beans more-or-less made the cheese irrelevant. It was even good as leftovers the next day.
name: Nevada Taco Grill

text:
So Paolos Deli is owned by the former owner of La Familia Italian Restaurant in Down Town Reno.  He has since sold La Familia .. think it's owned by another family member.

Apparently Paolo opened an Italian Deli in Reno many, many years ago ... across the street from their current location.  He went on to open Portofino and later La Familia and then he retired.   But decided he would start all over again and opened Paolos Deli in it's current location.  As told to us by his nephew (or was it his brother in law).

It's a walk in and order kind of place.  Food to go or to eat there.  They will bring you order to you.  I had Capresse Sandwich, which was excellent.  And it was big enough that I took half home and had it two days later .. still excellent.  My sister had Canneloni, and my friend had an Eggplant Sandwich .. which she also took home half.  The olive oil they used was really, really good.  Put a little extra on the 1/2 sandwiches we took home.

I order Eggplant Parm to go & my friend order Lasagne to go.  Both were very good.  Personally I would have preferred a little more sauce, so next time I order to go I'll ask for extra .. my personal choice.

They also have some cheeses and limited cold cuts for sale, along with a limited amount of dry goods.

The have limited wine & beer selections.  Soft drinks and some Italian soda.  The Italian Lemonade was really good.

All reasonably priced and I'm looking forward to going again.
name: Paolo's Deli

text:
I've been looking forward to trying Huntsman Brewing ever since I heard they were taking over the Silver Peak wonder location. I was always so-so on silver peak's beer and food, but the wonder street location was such a neat spot I was really hoping something good would go in there. I'm glad to see Huntsman brought new life into the space! 

For the beer: I got a flight of ales, IPA's, etc. and I loved everything I tried. The pumpkin one was way better than I expected it to be, as was the milkshake one. I wish I could remember the names but I really did like all of them. 

For food: we got the pork belly jalapeÃ±os for an appetizer and wings for the entrÃ©e. I felt like the pork belly was perfect but the jalapeÃ±os themselves were lack luster--they were still crunchy/raw and not very warm so maybe a few more minutes in the oven would have helped. I ended up getting the orange ginger wings and the regular wings, which both were good. I was confused however because they have smoked wings and regular wings but they're not in the same place on the menu (one under entrees, the rest under wings section) but that's minor. The orange ginger had such a great flavor and just the right amount of spice. I've heard that some people have been underwhelmed by their food. 

All in all, I'll definitely come back to try some more stuff.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
My wife and I decided to stop in about 11:30am on a Saturday.

As you walk in there are several small tables on the outside under the covered area. The inside has about 10 tables and orders are placed at the counter. We looked at the menu and everything sounded delicious! Â My wife chose the chicken Caesar sandwich and she had to try the pasta salad which everyone raves about! I decided on the meatball sandwich. As we paid for our order several more people arrived and it quickly got busy.

The pasta salad arrived first and my wife LOVED it. It was simple but tasted delicious! When ourÂ sandwiches arrived they also looked very tasty.

We both really enjoyed our food and commented we will be back again very soon! We remembered this location used to be something else but the logo on the door says established in 1990. My wife asked and they told us that they used to have a deli across the street years ago and sold it. The deli continued to operate with several different owners. She then told us that her nephew Jason decided to reopen about 5 weeks ago.

Support this small business and check them out!

categories: Pizza, Chicken Wings, Food, Brewpubs, Nightlife, Beer Gardens, Pubs, Bars, Breweries, Restaurants

text:
As residents of the West of Wells neighborhood for the last seven years, my wife and I were excited to check out the new business that moved into the building that had previously been occupied by Silver Peak. Until it's closure in early 2020, we visited Silver Peak on Wonder street 2-4 times a month and we haven't found an adequate replacement since. 

It is important to note that at the time of this review, Washoe county is under a mandatory mask mandate for all indoor spaces. As we enter the familiar building we are greeted by a very friendly, but maskless host/server named Alexa. Alexa proved to be the only bright spot during our visit. After being seated inside, we realized that the entire staff was maskless, and there was obviously no enforcement of a mask policy of any kind. We are both vaccinated and decided we could overcome the businesses lack of responsibility because we really, really wanted to like it there. We were excited to see that most of the old Silver Peak menu was still in place and we ordered our absolute favorite, the black bean nachos with chicken. We also order a couple of Huntsman beers, the IPA and the sour, both of which I would recommend. After placing our order I used the restroom and found it to be completely without hand soap. I informed Alexa and she assured me she would pass along the message to someone who could address it. When I returned to the table a couple of plates were set out for our nachos. Both of these plates had old food stuck on them. We were able to get these plates exchanged for clean ones without a problem. The restaurant was not necessarily busy but the nachos still took about 30 minutes to come out. When the nachos did arrive, we found them to be a smaller and somehow burnt version of the Silver Peak nachos we were accustomed to. At this point we had come across so many strikes against the place that we didn't even consider having a second beer.  Just before we left, I returned to the restroom to wash my hands and found that the hand soap had still not been refilled. I would have been content using hand sanitizer, but there was none of that to be found either. 

I am always understanding of the bumps that come along with a new business, like slow food service and recipes that aren't quite dialed in. In this case however, I can't look past the maskless employees, lack of a mask policy, and lack of either hand soap or hand sanitizer in a business that has just opened in the middle of a public health crisis. There's a certain common culture that can be found among midtown businesses that Huntsman completely lacks. I'd say there is no chance of us returning, which really sucks because we wanted Huntsman to be our new go to neighborhood restaurant.
name: Huntsman Brewing

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}
attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': None, u'upscale': False}

categories: Mexican, Tacos, Restaurants, Fast Food, Food Stands

text:
It does the heart good to see new life come to this spot, where Huntsman Brewing has taken over from the old Silverpeak, one of the first breweries in the Reno area.  A lot of fond memories were had here over the years, and I hope there are many more to come.

Much of what made this location good are still here, while also seriously revamping and updating things to boot. The building is unmistakable, sort of towering over the south end of Midtown with seating spread across multiple levels. There is the front bar room, which has been seriously upgraded and expanded, the adjoining main dining room, and also a private room upstairs which could be rented out for parties and is now decked out with a few pub games.  But most importantly, the roof deck is still here, maybe the best such roof deck in town, with great views of the mountains and downtown. All told, they have done quite the job remodeling the old property and giving it their own feel.

The beers and food have also gotten a serious revamp.  Beer-wise, their flagship Huntsman IPA is very solid and a good easy drinker, definitely what I would recommend the most. Their cream ale, the Teamwork Makes the Cream-Work, is also quite delightful and perfect on a warm, sunny afternoon. Their SOURon Pink Guava is very nice, and for sure worth a try.  They do brew a good Irish Stout, and the Old Ale was a very interesting find for any local beer nut to try. And surprisingly, in one of the holdovers from the old Silverpeak menu, they have not only revived the Red Roadster, but I think improved upon it. There are also plenty of guest taps on offer, as well as a full bar.

The menu still has a lot of familiar sorts of higher-end pub fare; pizzas, sandwiches, appetizers, salads, etc. But reading the selections, you notice several tweaks, such as the option on many items to add pork belly. I wound up getting an order of Fish n Chips along with their Gouda Mac n Cheese appetizer. (Always go with stuff with 'n' in the name.) The fish was perfectly fried and very tasty. Though I found the king-cut fries to be a bit under-fried and under-seasoned. The Mac n Cheese, however, was excellent. A good portion for one person, with melted gouda, and with the addition of pork belly mixed in, the deliciousness was ratcheted up another notch.

Prices here for everything seemed very reasonable for the quality you get. Anywhere from under $10 for appetizers, to the $15-$20 range for a lot of entrees. Service was adequate, though a bit lacking in parts, with our party sort of being forgotten by the hostess for a good 15 minutes, and a few things like condiments and cutlery not being delivered until we had asked repeatedly. How much of this is due to staffing shortages, I am not sure, but hopefully that gets ironed out. Parking is relatively easy, with spaces in front and behind the building and lots of nearby street spaces, and of course is easy enough to walk over if you are already cruising around Midtown.

All in all, I am very happy to see a brewery back here again, and I think Huntsman is off to a good start. Looking forward to seeing how things shape up in the times ahead, and will look forward to coming back for another round.

Cheers, guys!
name: Huntsman Brewing

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': False, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': False}

categories: Pizza, Chicken Wings, Food, Brewpubs, Nightlife, Beer Gardens, Pubs, Bars, Breweries, Restaurants

text:
My wife and I, along with a couple of friends went to Huntsman a couple weeks into opening. We tried to order a couple items and they were already sold out for the night. 

Luckily, we managed to pick a few items that were still available as a group of four people. We were told to expect about a 30-45 minute delay on our food. 
Two people in our party were given there meals about 45 minutes after ordering which were burgers and fries.  The burger was good, the fries were pretty limited in quantity and nothing too dynamic. The appetizer we ordered came about an hour after ordering and after two people had already finished their meals.  The final two meals came about two hours after ordering and only after a member of our group complained about it.  The last two items were a pulled pork sandwich and a pizza.  The pulled pork sandwich was fine but had very little pork on it.  The pizza was wonderful but that might have been due to how hungry the member of our group was by then.

The service was disappointing overall and while the server was doing all she could to speed things along she was getting very little support. The manager, I believe, was also sitting at a table drinking the entire time while our order was floundering and showed zero reaction until finally speeding things along when we complained. 

The professionalism of sitting with people and drinking at 7:30/8:00pm while the restaurant is brand new is pretty disappointing since staff should be working hard to impress customers after a new opening when delays may happen.

Sadly, after this experience, we won't be returning. There are so many other good options in town for a beer and bar food and the professionalism was lacking so much that I don't feel the need to go back.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
Best Brewmaster I've ever drank. 

Buy flights when you go, try everything. 

I used to work at a beer bar, tried all sorts of fancy limited released beers. Never was impressed, I  usually could find maybe 2 beers I enjoyed to drink at almost every brewery I've been to with long beer menus. Usually was a lager or pils guy because everything else was too hoppy for me. If your a hop head, this isn't the place for you. Even their IPA's are delicate and moderate on the hops. 

If you like great beer and like to taste different subtle flavors and not just hops, this is the place for you. Absolutely outstanding beer. Buy flights and try all the beers, trust me.

P.S. MAC N CHEESE is some of the best I've ever had. Didn't love the Turkey and Pesto but I ordered the wrong thing, happens.

text:
Dog friendly patio... check!

Great beer... check!

Friendly employees... check!

I could not be happier that the neighborhood brewery's vacancy has been filled by Huntsman Brewing. We live a few blocks away and and have been a couple times now and we just love it. They have managed to keep several menu items from Silver Peak, along with some of their better known beers - so all of you OG Silver Peak fans, rejoice! While enjoying the black bean nachos and a couple of beers, we were approached by the one the enthusiastic co-owners (Sean) who insisted that we taste the milkshake IPA. Guys, it was a delight! I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this beer, we even decided to buy one of their awesome growlers and get a fill of it to take home. Unfortunately, a week after bringing the growler home, we lost the lid seal, which makes the growler unusable... we mentioned this to the owners and they didn't hesitate to replace it. Honestly, these guys are so nice, we were super appreciative of their service.
I already mentioned that they are dog friendly. They have an excellent rooftop patio and furry friends are welcome up there. If you're anything like me, you want to bring your pup(s) everywhere, so this is an awesome option. 
All of the owners we have met are so friendly, and are super excited about this endeavor and clearly have a passion for what they're doing. 
If it isn't already obviously, I'm a huge fan and plan to frequent this place often.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text:
I read a review from a friend and saw they had Muffeltta sandwiches and always wanted to try one. I made a point to stop by this cute little deli in lakeside crossing, used to be a yogurt shop I believe. I entered and it was a cute set up with tables and chairs (basic deli) one couple inside. I ordered the Muffeletta sandwich (normally from Louisiana and served round) I'm an olive lover, it was 10 bucks for a good sized regular type sandwich on a roll. It was very tasty, it had Mortadelo,, provolone, and a different type of salami with a olive tapenade. It was very homemade you could tell just by eating it! I also ordered they Caprese Salad that was only store bought tomatoes and not the real ricotta! 
I'm sorry to give them only 3 stars but the prices are too high for what you get, the sandwich I paid 10 bucks but you'll see the pics I post for an 8 buck caprese salad! 
I wish them well but honestly it's not the proper atmosphere for that place!
My issue were the items such as tomatoes were not heirloom so why are you charging me 8 bucks for the Capresse salad I posted?

categories: Restaurants, Italian, Sandwiches, Delis

text:
Next to finding the closest super market, when people are new to an area one of the first things they do is look for places to eat. But finding a place that checks all the boxes without any referrals can feel like rolling the dice at the Nugget!

Having driven by the Nevada Taco Grill almost on a daily basis, got me thinking that some of the best under rated businesses are those "hidden gems". From the outside, there are very little in way of fancy graphics or marketing - this restaurant does share its space with the Vista Mart gas station. So basically, if you eat with your eyes, you will not consider Nevada Taco Grill but I for one - eat with my mouth so could care less about the looks. 

My first give it a try experience was with my wife. As we were driving up Baring, I mentioned that I would like to try Nevada Taco Grill out. Since it was near lunch and we didn't have plans - it was game on!

Going through the drive through, the first thing you notice, as others have mentioned is the extensive menu. For a relatively small restaurant, they sure have plenty of options! My go to when dining Mexican food is carnitas burritos. My wife, chicken burritos. So we ordered one of each. 

The food is definitely made to order as it took about 4 or 5 minutes from placing our order to receiving our food at the drive thru. This is not your typical fast food joint. It may speed things up if you call ahead but not too far ahead so your food is fresh.

Now onto the food, that's why you are here right? Carnitas is roasted pork, so it shouldn't be mushy or too dry. My burritos was slightly on the wet side (most likely from the pico de gallo and guacamole) and there wasn't any charred meat until I got about half way. Not a deal breaker but with the charred meat you get some of that smoky flavor. There was no rice or beans which was surprising. You are getting your fill of protein here for sure!

My wife's chicken burrito was similar in that there wasn't any rice or bean filler but shredded grilled chicken breast, bell peppers and onions. That's it. Chicken breast can be dry if over done but this was on the money and was packed with quite a bit.

For a mild salsa try their green. If you prefer something with more punch the red will be worthy for your taste buds.

Would we go again? You bet and looking forward to their Taco Tuesdays!
name: Nevada Taco Grill

categories: Mexican, Tacos, Restaurants, Fast Food, Food Stands

text:
The Huntsman was bought out from Silver Peak earlier this year and this was my first time seeing it under the new name/managment. We were there for a big event, the DJ Trivia Finals. Since the playoffs were a month ago, the management had advance warning about the number of teams and the number of players who would be coming to the finals. There were tables reserved for each team with the name of each team and number of team members printed on a laminated sign!

Nevertheless, the management had only one server and one bartender working, for more than 100 people! 

We were there more than 30 minutes before anyone took our orders. The drink orders were all wrong, 2 of the food orders were wrong, and we couldn't talk to the server to get it fixed. I was drinking only water, and had to wait over an hour to get a second glass. My friend's drink was never done correctly. I went to the bartender to get it corrected (and get another glass of water) but was told that I had to "wait for your server".

The staff were overwhelmed (including kitchen staff) and seemed to have been completely unprepared (with a month's notice!). The server was doing her best, but there is no excuse that the management put her in that position. If they can't get the staff for the event, then the management/owners needed to be there to help out!

For what it's worth the food was pretty good. We had seven people and everyone said good things about their food. But it was hard to get past the debacle with the service.

This event brought in a lot of people who probably have not been to your new business before. This would have been a great opportunity to make a good impression and get new regular customers. Sadly, I feel the opposite has happened. I know I won't be in a hurry to go back.
name: Huntsman Brewing

text: This location is far-and-away the best Port of Subs I have ever been to. The staff is genuinely friendly every time I come in. They always greet me as soon as I walk in the door, even when they are very busy, and they are all very personable as you go through the line. Not only is this the friendliest staff you will ever meet, they are incredibly efficient with their process. They don't short you on toppings like other Port of Subs locations I've been to, they are constantly restocking with fresh toppings, and they move you through the line quickly without making you feel rushed. I have seen 3 completely different staffs, including new hires, in the last year that I have been going to this location, and they all provide the same excellent customer service. I would like to own my own business one day, and I am taking notes from this location. They have it figured out!
name: Port of Subs

text: I love my Spanish Springs Save-Mart. One thing that niggles at me...every weekend there's some kind of fundraiser going on. Car wash, Boy Scouts selling popcorn, Girl Scouts selling cookies, Juvenile Diabetes Society selling  keychains for $5.00. God, how I wish I could give to them all, but I can't. I resent the fact that I shop here once a week and lay down $200.00 for a week's worth of groceries and then I have to not make eye contact with the little kids out front because I flat-out can't spare another dime to contribute to their cause. My own guilt, I know, but I just can't do it all. Get rid of the constant fundraising outside the door, please! I beg you!
name: Save Mart

text: Me and my boyfriend went to the coffee bar and ordered a scorpion Scorcher and a lavender lemonade. When we asked for the scorpion drink she said "oh my god" so annoyed and just walked off and started making the drinks. She then proceeded to yell at the customers behind us and say well this is gonna take along time and I am going to have to run to the bathroom after I get done making these so you are all going to have to wait. The lady had bright red hair and half of it was shaved it looked like. When we got the drinks it looked NOTHING like the picture, and tasted like nothing except blended ice and I paid around $6 for the large and my boyfriend paid like $4-5 for his lemonaid. I have never been treated so rude and when she was finished she said "HERE!" And gave us the rudest look I've ever seen. You guys need to really evaluate the people you hire because me and my boyfriend come here all the time and spend over $10 each time we come. I literally started laughing because I thought it had to be a joke because of the way she was treating us but no she really was THAT RUDE. It was comical!
name: Gold Ranch Coffee Bar

text:
Living in Spanish Springs, Savemart is a very convenient store to go to. The store always has good parking and the spaces aren't super small. The store is very clean.

The deli is nicely prices and tastes wonderfully. The bakery makes delicious doughnuts and personalized cakes. They make them there in the store. The produce is pretty good and fresh. They do get a little pricy. 

My favorite part about Savemart is the meat. The meat from the butcher is amazing at they have good prices. They have peppered bacon that is to die for. Their hamburger meat is also equally as good and they have low fat options.

I never wait in line very long. They always have 3ish checkers open and they also have the self check outs. This is a good store to get in, get what you want, and get out.

One tip: Go there around 3-4 p.m. and the bakery will have just made fresh warm bread. Yum! 

If the store was less expensive, I would give them 5 stars. Compared to other stores in the area, they are great.
name: Save Mart

text:
Prepare to wait a LONG time and if there is more than one in line, move on.  They only have ONE employee on premise at a time.  She takes your order, goes and makes it, and then comes back to help the next person.  What a silly way to do things!  Last time I was behind a group of 6 Cal Trans workers and it was about a 40-45 min wait.  Person has no sense of urgency either.  I thought okay it was a late evening but today Saturday morning, still one person.  I get that you want to save on payroll but there is a more efficient way.  You need to take all your orders who are standing in line first up to 3 or 4 and THEN make your drinks simultaneously.  This back and forth business is a time waster and more likely that you will get customers to walk out.  
I finally get my regular coffee and go to the condiment station which is dirty.  I get it, you have ONE person but the boxes shouldn't be filthy on the bottom.  That is from no one ever cleaning them.  
They get a star for actually serving Starbucks brand but that is it.  I think they would shudder at the thought of this location.  Oh and because its an independent, they do not take SB cards or give you stars.  For the avid SB customer, this is clearly not a SB.
name: Gold Ranch Coffee Bar

text:
If you're looking for a 'full meal' then you'll be glad to know its connected to a Baskin Robin's Ice Cream store so after you finish your 'Pilgrim' you can go get yourself some Rocky Road.

As far as Port of Subs goes, they do have competition locally in the forms of Jimmy Johns, Subway and the Truckee Bagel factory.

I don't know when sandwhiches got so expensive but a sandwhich here is going to run you at least $5.   If you add in chips and a soda its going to be closer to $8.  The quality of the meat and vegetabales is good here (more so than Subway) and the bread is also fresh.

The staff here have always been nice, caring and outgoing.  They are very helpful and don't rush you if you're being a bit indecisive.    If you're around this area and need a sadwhich, hit this Port Of Subs up.
name: Port of Subs

text:
2 people working in the Meat dept. on Sat. May 16th at 5pm I need a piece of meat tenderized and the young man said ok and took it in the back and then came out and said the meat cutter couldn't do it because they had just cleaned the tenderizer. I have worked 40 yrs. in the food business and never heard of equipment being cleaned that early. I love the produce dept. at this market the people working here do a wonderful job. I had about a small cart full of produce, about 40-50 dollars worth and a gallon of milk and put it all back on the shelves and went to Smiths who was glad to tenderize my steaks. 
I should have went directly to the keyman in charge but I was already in a rush and needed to go. 
I believe the meat dept. needs to know that they have lost all my grocery business to Smiths
name: Save Mart

text:
Ya know, Port of Subs is starting to be a lot like Subway. I'm not sure if that's a good thing.  Basically, they are trying to be everything to everyone.  You want breakfast, they got it.  Hot subs, cold subs, soups, salads, wraps, the list goes on and on.

I recently had a bacon egg and cheese breakfast griller and it was ok.  It did the job, but I wasn't blown away.

I think Port of Subs is a good place to go if you're with a group and not everyone really wants subs.  The atmosphere is super friendly and the service is reasonably paced.
name: Port of Subs

text: I usually love this store, and used to live close by. I'd overall give it 5 stars but my recent visit on 6/2 left me with a terrible impression. While I was check out with a clerk by the name of Charlette she was extremely rude. I went to try to enter my phone number and the option disappeared from the screen, I asked if I could enter it before paying and she just started at me. I assumed since it wasn't appearing on the screen she wanted me to provide my number to her. I started with my area code and she gave me this look like I had stated the obvious because she has already entered it. I asked if I had mentioned if I asked for ice and she simply said no, no offer to add it onto the purchase before I swiped my card. Terrible customer service from this one individual only.

text: I can't compliment these guys any more than I am about to! I just ordered off of Grubhub for some delivery. It's getting around the time that my order should have arrived, and I get a phone call from the restaurant stating that apparently the Grubhub delivery driver already delivered the order when they didn't, and also stated that they never even picked up the food, not only that but they also called Grubhub and had them contact me about a refund. So I went through that whole process and still wanted my order of course, because their food is delicious! So I put the order in and just received my order in a fast manor and not only that they threw in a coke and a very nice note that I'll share! I highly recommend these guys for all of your pizza and more needs! They know what they are doing as a restaurant and they know how to satisfy their customers! Will definitely tell everyone I know about their acts of kindness and great food! Today it's hard to find people that care, let alone go out of their way to throw in a drink and a nice note!
name: Ricco's Pizza

text:
I have to say I'm not usually a fan of POS, that's what my wife calls Port of Subs. I like the freshly sliced meats and cheeses but I joke that you are never truly getting your own sandwich because that slicer is rarely cleaned. 

Today I was proven wrong and I liked it.  That slicer was freshly cleaned as was the entire condiment area. It sparkled like diamonds! Huzzah! I was warmly greeted by Jaci, who instantly felt like my favorite grandma making me a sandwich in her kitchen. She asked how my day was, we talked about the weather, and all the while she was making up my sandwich with the fixings I requested. It was that good ol' southern hospitality that I love so dearly yet, rarely find in Reno. Jaci had it in spades and I ate it up. Then I ate up my yummy sandwich. 

I had the number 5, small, on sourdough with lettuce, tomato, cucumber, mayo, and vinegar. It was made just right and disappeared about 4 seconds after arriving in my hands because I had a movie to get to this evening. Before I left, Jaci reminded me to button up my sweater because it was cold outside. I waved a fond goodbye to her in return. A truly A+ experience at this sandwich shop! I'm surprised but thrilled.
name: Port of Subs

text:
Quality, well-made, and fresh sandwiches. Minus one star for the so-so service.

This place should be treated as less of a link in a chain and more like a local, family-run spot. This particular location of port of subs has a far more special vibe than your average sandwich franchise.

When we entered at 1:00 pm on a Saturday, the line was long! It was moving very slowly though as well. This is partly due to the fact that they're freshly slicing all the meat and cheese, so I'm glad to wait.

The man who took our order greeted us kindly, and my dad ordered the #5 on sourdough, and I ordered a vegetarian on flatbread.

As we went through the assembly station, the girl making our sandwiches seemed rather irritable and annoyed with us, and was just plain unpleasant. She also failed to hear me say I wanted oil and vinegar, even after repeating it twice. I understand that it was the lunch-hour rush, but please engage more with customers.

The cashier who rung us up was extremely nice, and she created friendly, personal conversation with us about our New Year's plans.

Our sandwiches were FANTASTIC. My veggies were fresh and packed a lot of flavor, and my dad said that said the same about the meat on his sub.

They have many genuinely healthy options here as well, which I love.

We'll definitely be back!
name: Port of Subs

text: I ordered a large Meat Lover's pizza through UberEats. Unfortunately what arrived was a large pizza with the ingredients of a medium 1.5 topping. Sliced into 12 pieces, there was an average of 1 pepperoni per slice. On half the slices I would find a nickel sized shrunken piece of meat that might've been salami if it were large enough to taste. Meatballs were miserable dots the size of marbles, maybe 3 per slice. If all of the meat were in the center of the pizza, I could take two bites per slice and the rest would be mediocre free cafeteria cheese pizza. Ingredients are the last thing a pizza joint should be stingy with. Even buffets have better pizza than this. Never ordering from here again.

text:
4.5 stars.

This store has been making significant improvements in the past few months. It was at the bottom level of mediocre when we moved from DC 2 years ago. One could say I was a bit spoiled & jaded, having lived in Hong Kong, NYC & DC for decades, replete with amazing restaurants & grocery stores within a 2-mile radius from home. 

Recently, I've been increasingly satisfied with their produce, often on par with or better than Whole Foods. The meats have improved markedly as well, good quality & well-priced with an ample selection, though the more exotic/unusual cuts are not available. For instance, it would necessitate a trip to Safeway or a butcher shop if I want beef shanks or ox tail. I was overjoyed that they now have a machine that slices meat to the perfect thinness for stir-frying (I ask them to slice it on setting #4), you still have to do some additional slicing, but Save Mart's miraculous slicer cuts (pun intended) the work down by 80%. I cook a lot more stir-fry now.

It is always clean & well-organized, with good service. Give them a second chance if you've previously written them off, you should be pleased. The only reason I noticed the store's uptrend is because we frequently stop in for incidental items because of its proximity to my house.
name: Save Mart

text: Ricco's is a great pizza place. It's one of my favorites. I found it thanks to a friend. When I lived closed by I would go and get a calzone every other week. The staff was very nice and they knew my order after a few visits. Their pizzas come in a lot of sizes and they have great specials. They also have a buffet in the morning that is really good. Like I stated before I always get the calzone and it's the best. The only reason it has 4 stars is because parking can be a nightmare, the little shopping center where it's located is too small and it can be hard to find a place to park when it's busy.
name: Ricco's Pizza

text: Wow this place is great! I went a few times when it was Roundabout and that was good too, but I'm glad to see the quality hasn't changed since Whitney Peak took over the restaurant. I had some friends in town so when they asked where we should get brunch, I suggested Cafe Whitney because the atmosphere is so cute. The restaurant was empty when we got there at 10am but I kinda appreciated the quiet. I was surprised they didn't have a drink menu, since I know they do Drag brunch sometimes so I knew they do breakfast cocktails. Their menu is pretty small but it all sounded so good--I ended up going with a breakfast burrito but could have been happy with any of the choices. The burrito was GIGANTIC but super good. My friends got the chilaquiles and the breakfast sandwich. Everyone said their food and cocktails were great! I will definitely be going back to try their dinner menu, but I'm stoked to have another brunch spot :)
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
Visited this elegant bar during Covid. What caught my attention was the sign outside saying something about a 'Breath of Fresh Air' which is something I desperately wanted after trying to be safe from others in the crowded street of people looking at the display of hydraulic cars and hot rods outside that night. Peeking through the window I seen the calm and elegant atmosphere and knew that is where I wanted my night cap! 

You have to enter through the main entrance/Hotel Lobby to get to the bar, which was very pretty. The restaurant feels exclusive and has a couple tables in little nooks as well as generously laid out so no one is close.  There are only a few spaces at the bar, with more than 6 feet between sets. The bartender was courteous and let us enjoy our cocktail hour, offering another round when our drinks were low. 

The restaurant closes at 10 so make sure you plan ahead if you want to try it out.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
I visited during Covid and they have social distancing measures in place, although dining is inside-only. I ordered the black bean/quinoa burger and a bowl of soup was a nice compliment (extra $5 with meal). The menu includes appetizers, salads, pizzas, entrees and burgers - basically new American. 
The portions are very large and the meal was flavorful. Service was good, but not exceptional. The vibe is steampunk meets barn, modern and clean. This is a good restaurant to visit if you're staying at the beautiful/centrally located Whitney Peak Hotel in Reno.

text:

We went in, not at all packed, it smelt amazing.

text:
Cafe Whitney is the intersection of casual and elegant, hip and classic, downtown and midtown. Simply put - Cafe Whitney is a must-try spot in Reno!

We recently treated ourselves to a much-needed staycation at Whitney Peak Hotel (hot tip: skip the casinos and STAY HERE!) Part of the appeal was Cafe Whitney downstairs, which we have heard great things about. We were lucky enough to snag same-day reservations for dinner - woo hoo!

Upon entering from the hotel side, we found the decor to be fun and fancy - beaded curtains, high ceilings, open kitchen... it was simultaneously rustic and modern and we loved it!

We both started with the Pom-Grenade, an amped up cocktail that definitely started off the meal with a bang. It was delicious! We also tried a cup of their soup de jour, a loaded baked potato soup that was SO yummy! Definitely a step above your classic potato+bacon+cheese+sour cream mashup. The housemade croutons on top put it over the edge!

For dinner, we went with their Diner Burger with fries and a fish special that came with orzo. The fish was good, nothing special - but the orzo was SO GOOD! Lemony and bright, every little bite was like a pillow that was just the right amount of toothsome. This dish totally changed orzo for me, it's like my new favorite thing now! The Burger was solid - delicious, big, and juicy. The shoestring fries were also a tasty addition!

Somehow, unbelievably, we saved room for dessert! The Raspberry Zinfandel Sorbet was a fruity refreshing end to a charmed meal.

I love the unpretentious vibe of this place, even though the food is definitely fine-dining quality! We can't wait to return for breakfast, happy hour, lunch... this place is good for it all!
name: Cafe Whitney

text: This was our first visit since Roundabout became Cafe Whitney. The modern decor appears to be exactly the same. Our server Natasha was so sweet and likeable, plus we received great service even there were two large parties (like 20 ppl and 30 ppl) in other areas of the restaurant. Our table of 4 ordered a New York, Pork Chop, Salmon, and I had the spaghetti. All meals were thoroughly enjoyed. The spaghetti sauce was on point, I elected for the house made vegan lentil meatballs instead of beef. Natasha said that there are regular omnivore customers who come in specifically for the lentil meatballs, and I can see why! They were, indeed, delicious. I had carrot cake for dessert, which was also very good. We will return!

text:
I went to Cafe Whitney for dinner and live music on a Thursday evening. They have valet, but we parked in the garage. It's a little 3 minute walk from the restaurant, but only $5. 

I was immediately impressed when I saw the beautiful hotel lobby and equally as impressed by the decor in the restaurant. I especially love the feature walls!

The menu is small, but I love not having too many choices. We ordered the debutante cocktail that was so fresh and delicious made with Tahoe blue vodka and fresh berry coulis. We also got the orchard martini made with Frey ranch rye and apple juice. Loved them both! They have great drink choices. For appetizers we order the large cheese platter. It was stocked with all kinds of deliciousness like pate, mustard, marinated apricots, cheeses and more! It's so worth $22! Most other places this would cost more. We also got the grilled octopus. It was so good! Perfectly tender and the sauce made me want to lick the plate.

For dinner I got the steak salad. It's huge! The grilled vegetables were a little large for my taste, but veggie lovers would be in heaven! I loved the dressing and the steak was cooked perfectly. We also got the pappardelle pasta. It was handmade pasta and tasted really fresh!

The service was also super nice. I'll be back for sure.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
Ricco's is a family-oriented pizzeria where one can get a great deal on great pizza, huge calzones, scrumptious potato skins, chicken wings etc.

The ingredients are fresh, the pizzas are Napolitan style pies that are served piping hot out of the oven.  

The Pizza is good and they are always open to custom orders, this speaks volumes as to how they value their customers. The staff is very friendly and make you feel at home.

We ordered two extra large pizzas with 3-4 toppings each, drinks and appetizers all for a fraction of what the large chains charge!

Ambiance = 3 stars
Service = 4 stars
Food = 4 stars
Price = 5 stars

Recommended!!
name: Ricco's Pizza

text:
This was the one time I ventured to a "dine in"
Experience what a great one to have chosen. One can make reservations to secure a spot through Yelp. The large restaurant had plenty of seating and enough to feel comfortable in ones space . There were about two or three other tables being occupied and a few others at the bar area.
There's a QR code on the table to scan in fir the menu.
We were handed ours.
First cocktail I had the Pom-grenade sparkling wine, pomegranate, rose, as I'm writing this I'm wishing I had one on hand. It had a good balance of the right amount of fruity and sparking. Amazing!
I ordered the pepperoni pizza and added sausage. It was divine. Everything crisp and fresh and the portions were enough for 2-3 people.
Our waiter was very attentive to our table which was appreciated.
If I'm thinking to go out fir a clean and safe sit down dinner I will definitely come back to cafe Whitney.

text: I went here to check out the new menu after a guy who worked there recommened it to me, while we were hanging out at a nearby bar the night before and talking about favorite places. He told me about the daily happy hour specials that sounded good, but this time I came for dinner. The space looks about the same as before, but menu is quite different. It's simple, and not too expensive. I started with the Frito Misto, which was nice and crispy and quite large. The fried crispy broccolini was a tasty special addition. Next I had the Steak Salad. It was also large and came with a lot of fried zucchini, that was tasty, but I could not finish it all. I liked the vinaigrette dressing. The steak was grilled and nicely done. They have wine by the glass and by the bottle. I found something that I liked. I think it's worth a visit if you are in the area.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
I was excited to try this place because I deliver food for Uber, and I had picked up a pizza from here and it was nice and heavy, not skimpy like some places!
So I finally got the chance to order a small combo. It was $14.00!!! And it was so disappointing. No ingredients on  the first third of pizza, not even sauce, it was supposed to have linguisa, not even one piece was on it... a few little pieces of sausage
A few pieces of onions. Two or three mushrooms. Very sad.... I called to complain and the young guy that was supposedly the manager, acted like he could care less that he was going to lose a customer.
name: Ricco's Pizza

text: Benji, our server this past Saturday night was AMAZING! He said it was his first night serving and I couldn't believe it. He was super attentive, friendly, and just oozed positivity. I requested an absurd amount of ranch for my salad and he gladly fulfilled my request. The salad was probably the best salad I've ever had (yes- even without factoring in all the ranch lol). I loved my penne carbonara and my bf loved his burger. We were here to celebrate my bf's birthday and requested to sit in the same location as we had 6 years ago for his birthday (restaurant was under a different name/ownership then). Benji was more than accommodating to seat us there despite everyone else being located in the front of the restaurant. We were very appreciative of this. Thank you Benji! If Benji's manager sees this, he deserves a raise and a fast track to manager.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
I enjoy the opportunity to try a new place. Since I also go to events with the local music scene, Cafe Whitney was bound to be an option soon! And the time finally came! Some musician friends were going to be performing for their last day before moving to the East Coast. I was looking forward to finally seeing live music again, and trying a new eatery.

With their live music on Thursday nights, they also have 50% off a bottle of wine. 

I am not much of a wine drinker, but I did order The Ranch Hand. Made with Frey Ranch! Its basically an old fashioned, and it tastes wonderful!!

For an appetizer, I got the small meat & cheese board. It feeds 2-3 people, I would say. For my guest and I, it was a perfect amount! 
I ordered a ceasar salad with chicken, as an entree. It was a big salad and very well made.
For dessert, I had the flourless chocolate cake. Not too rich, but decadent enough to satisfy!

I plan to return! The food, staff, and atmosphere is very good at Cafe Whitney!
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
I never got a chance to eat at the Roundabout Grill before it's transformation into the Cafe Whitney. But I can say, that I was thoroughly  impressed by the food in the new restaurant. The menu selection isn't huge, which is okay, because the few items that they do have are good quality. The space is really beautiful and elegant while still maintains a casualty and they have a full bar with a great staff to get you taken care of. Their drinks were good, and not very booze heavy so they felt really light. 

We got the falafel and the KFC to start, the chicken sauce was a little too salty, but the quinoa falafel was super flavorful and much larger than we anticipated. I got the steak salad and it was super flavorful and really generous on the steak and veggies. But the real star of the show for me was the carrot cake. It was perfectly moist, had all the right chunks of carrot and walnut, and really surprised me with the caramel and berry sauces on top. 

Overall this was a pretty nice meal, although a little pricey as hotel restaurants can be. I do think I'd return in the future if I was in the area of just to enjoy that carrot cake once again,
name: Cafe Whitney

text: We stayed at the Whitney hotel for one night to be able to make it to our flight due to a storm in Tahoe...the hotel was clean and modern.  We had been eating bar food and whatever we could during our trip due to the vid.  We ate dinner at the cafe Whitney and it was delicious!  The house salad was so good with the apples and granola.  The white vinaigrette was amazing.  I had the chicken with mashed potatoes and carrots.  My husband had the carbonara and he is a Connoisseur of carbonara and he said it was top notch.  Super clean food.  We had breakfast as well the next day and it was equally delicious.  Highly recommended this restaurant and hotel.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
We ventured out of our usual brunch rotation spots for Easter and found this hidden gem.

The Food:
We came for the bottomless mimosas and three course brunch which didn't disappoint. I had the breakfeast burrito with chorizo and my boyfriend had a really juicy looking burger. The three course option included a basket with 2 pastries and a yummy parfait.

The Space:  
The tables are spaced out enough to not feel stuffy and there is also bar seating. The decor is modern and upscale. I prefer a brunch spot with outdoor seating, but the natural light was perfect for those that like the sunlight but don't want to be to hot or too cold outside.

The Staff:
Everyone we interacted with was friendly and we received our food very quickly. But we had a little trouble getting timely refills on our mimosas. That's the only reason I took off one star.

The Bonus:
Free valet! This made it so much less stressful because we didn't have to look for parking. 

Overall we had a great experience at Cafe Whitney. It definitely made a spot in our brunch rotation.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
We came here about 4:30pm on a Sunday when we could not decide where to get something to eat. 

We had been to one of the Mexican restaurants in the same small strip mall before so we were somewhat familiar with the general location. 

We entered and discovered the interior was pretty small and the tables and benches were setup cafeteria style. The exterior windows have some form of bars/protection on both the inside and out. The menu selections were displayed on menu boards both on the wall to the left of the counter with pictures and as a list on the wall behind the order counter. We were amazed they had 7 different sizes of pizzas and had never seen anything like that before. 

My wife ordered a small Hawaiian pizza and I ordered a small meat lovers pizza along with a soda and water. We did notice they had a few bottled beers (Modelo, Corona and Blue Moon) as well as Budweiser on tap. 

My wife went up to the soda machine and the woman who had taken our order let us know that she had to turn the machine on in order for it to dispense. We thought that was strange and we wondered if that is to prevent stealing? 

There was only one other customer seated but there were several people who came in to pick up take out orders. 

While we were waiting for our pizzas, a man came in with a bag and went up to the counter and pulled out pieces of clothing and asked the employee and my wife if they liked brand new stuff and proceeded to try and get either of them to show interest. They both declined and he left. 

Our pizzas arrived a short time later and looked pretty good. They tasted pretty good too. Mind blowing good....no.  Decent.....yes. 

The prices seem comparable with other pizza places in town but the atmosphere and ability to relax and enjoy a meal as a couple or family is definitely lacking. There are many other options in town that provide that so we likely won't be back. We do feel it would be a good option for pickup. 

Oh I forgot to mention the TV in the corner of dining area was blaring a Mexican soccer match in Spanish which we could not understand. Not really what I would have preferred.
name: Ricco's Pizza

text:
I am giving them an extra star for the fantastic job they are doing with Covid-19 regulations and because they are a local spot that I feel needs community support.

I have reviewed numerous former restaurants in this space from when it was still Com Row (a total hot mess) The space is still the same from when it debuted as Heritage - a Mark Estee cutting edge eatery. It like it was designed  in anticipation of social distancing requirements - large and open and airy.

Service is OK, they are friendly and attentive, but nothing outstanding. Sometimes they have forgotten to bring out napkins and utensils with the meal (tables are not pre-set) or forgetting that second glass of wine that was ordered. 

In my opinion, and during normal times, the food is what would give it a 3-star rating for me. It is just OK. Nothing special, nothing terrible, just OK. It is  solid hotel restaurant fare with enough variety that would interest most patrons staying at the hotel. It is not a "destination" restaurant. The first time there, I ordered a steak salad. The salad was fine and the greens were fresh, but the steak was very gristly and inedible. Not a good start. The second time was much better - my husband and I shared the Karrage Chicken, bites of  japanese-style fried chicken with a dipping sauce. They were good - the sauce really makes this special. I also had a cup of the tomato bisque that is also very good. Our third visit was for hamburgers. They were very generous portions and cooked to order, but were nothing special. The fries were meh. 

We will probably return as we live downtown and like having a place to drop in that is nothing fancy, and reasonably priced. Their cocktails and wine are good, the food is OK, and the setting very spacious.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
I am very bummed to have to write this review, as I have really liked Port of Subs in the past. 
I ordered the dessert catering package for a surprise for my sister in law. When I arrived in the store for pick up, I was very disappointed to see what they provided me with. The cookies were burnt to a crisp. I mean really burned. When I mentioned it to the young lady she said, "well we had to bake them earlier so that's why they are burned". I'm not sure why the time of day effects the state of the cookie, but okay. She was very sweet, but definitely did not offer to redo the order. 
Additionally, each cookie was supposed to be individually wrapped per the website. These cookies were not wrapped, so I asked about it. The woman said "I didn't know you wanted that". When I said that the website provided that detail she said "yeah don't ever use the website, it can be wrong a lot".... this really did not make me feel better about my order. By the way, I didn't order online, I called the store. 
In the end, they gave me 50% off, but I feel I need to share because the excuses were ridiculous, and there wasn't an offer to remake the order. The young lady was nice, and I'm sure she was doing her best, but saying that the cookies are burned because they were made earlier in the day was absurd. Now I am rushing to find another place to get cookies from because these are not edible.
name: Port of Subs

text:
Annie C, you must be in such a sad place in your life to write such hateful untrue things about an amazing person in our community.

After knowing Nonda for 30+ years as an exceptional employee of Albertsons and Savemart, and having watched how she engages and cares for all of the customers who specifically wait to go through her line, no one will believe that she ever said anything so nasty to you.

If life is a reflection then it begs us to ask how did I treat that person to get that response back.

So this begs the question how did you and how are we all treating those people of our community who are serving us everyday, through these scary and difficult times?

Although Savemart has done a good job trying to provide essential services and protection for their customers,  they can only do it with the employees who come back day after day.

NO employees No company

Also, as for the eggs Annie, that really is none of your or our business as none of us really know each other's circumstances.

Your kind of post always makes me curious, here is my question. 

How many times have you shopped at Savemart where you were served kindly and did you post about that?

All of the Savemart team members are a part of our community. Treat them with kindness and respect and that is what you will get back. 

Thank goodness for witnesses that know the truth so no harm comes from posts like yours.
name: Save Mart

text: Minimal produce, standard items, meat department is adequate and good quality meat. Bakery is short on selections, groceries are in some areas, lacking in current trendy food items. Save Mart is a small supermarket which will meet most of your needs. Stocking common items has been problematic as they run out and they can't tell you when they will have the item(s) back on the shelves. It is the closest Supermarket for me, but we also shop at other supermarkets within 8 miles. Pharmacy is outstanding. Friendly, courteous staff throughout the store. I applaud the store for its diverse employee work force.
name: Save Mart

text:
Let me just shout out to some of the great workers here that are amazing ANNE, WENDY, VANESSA and ELIZABETH in deli !! They are the reason I keep coming back to this store. The Kudo's are long over due. I don't shop here as often as I used to. 

10/05/17

My husband and I came to get a few items for dinner. We had some produce items but decided to do self check out any way. I always seem to have problems at the self check out here if I have produce. Anyway there was a cashier standing by to help those with issues. He seemed put out and annoyed when he had to help us. There were multiple times the self check machine told us to get a clerk. He seemed to get more and more exasperated as it went off again and again. But rather than say or act as if it was the machine's fault he acted, treated and spoke to us as if we were stupid. I must say this is poor customer service. Even if he felt that way he should have in no way allowed the customer to feel that way.

I was so disenchanted with his treatment that I turned around and saw Anne. I asked her if I could speak to a supervisor. I didn't know she was a supervisor. So I spoke with her about our ordeal. She dealt with it in such friendly and professional way that I am giving 4 stars because of Anne.

I sure hope that Corporate see's this review and gives all the above mentioned women KUDO'S

Thank you ANNE, WENDY, VANESSA AND ELIZABETH in deli!!
name: Save Mart

This place! There's a reason I spend a little more to shop Raleys. I went in just to get a few pumpkins. Went up to the self check out and a female employee was leaning against one of the machines and I asked her if I could pay for the pumpkins there. She didn't even look at me, simply nodded her expressionless face. The scan wasn't working and the machine beeped at me a couple times. She never moved a muscle to offer assistance. So I walked away and used a checker. The store is dark and dirty and I'll never ever set foot in there again. 

The gal at self checkout (oct 1 at around 11:30) should not be in a service related position. It's obvious she doesn't like her job and doesn't seem to like people all that much either.
