text:
I don't usually review large chains but this experience warranted a review as the franchise owner and lovely employees deserve recognition. 
After a LONG day of hiking with a 4 year old and 10 month old we were sweaty, dirty and HUNGRY so we headed to the closest port of subs. I've never been impressed by my port of subs experiences so I wasn't super excited but when we walked in it was so clean (don't worry we got takeout as to not taint their spotlessness with our sweat haha) it looked like no one had ever even eaten there I mean every area was SO clean. They were training a new employee and treating him very kindly (which is important as a customer to see all employees being respected). Every employee we spoke with was incredibly kind and happy to be at work. To top it all off the food was generous whereas the other port of subs I've been to in the past are stingy with their portions. Loved this experience!
name: Port of Subs

text:
Shoot, who would've thought there would be a charming cute cafe like Gold Ranch Coffee Bar behind all the casino hustle and convenient pee stops.

GRCB is a Starbucks partner but MORE. Their menu expands from the standard Carmel Macchiato and Frappicinos. They have some soft serve ice creams and other creative lattes for the more adventurous caffiene loving individual. I ordered the soy lavender mocha, and it was a TREAT. I got the strong chocolate vibes from your standard Starbucks mocha with a hint of lavender. It definitely woke me up for the rest of the drive to Reno, but it also was a pleasure to sip.

Lastly, I have to give a shout out to this one nice barista with super cool pink hair. Unfortunately I did not get her name, but she made the GRCB experience a pleasant one when she offered some suggestions with an overwhelmingly expansive latte menu.
name: Gold Ranch Coffee Bar

text:
This store is close to where I live and the only grocery store in my immediate area so I shop here pretty frequently. The shopping experience is usually OK. Their produce selection is usually pretty nice and fairly priced. I love the selection in their bakery department with their muffins, chocolate dipped cookies, and cakes being my favorites. Their deli is nice, but the selection rarely changes so if you shop there frequently it does get boring. They do make a delicious roast beef sandwich with a horseradish sauce called Kickin' Roast Beef though. There is a small problem with items being stocked on the shelves at times. I also feel some items in this store are overpriced especially toiletry/beauty items. The store has recently gone through some upgrades. They added a soup bar, a place to sit and eat deli purchases, and instead of the traditional meat and seafood department they offer a grill where you can get grilled chicken, ribs, tri-tip, steaks, etc. This area also has daily specials. The hamburgers are good, but the tri-tip tacos and sandwiches are my favorites. They have a nice liquor department with a huge selection of wine. The pet supplies aisle is small, but in a pinch I can always find dog or cat food and other supplies for my pets. The cashiers are nice even though I will say some can be pretty unprofessional. Only ever had one issue that made me want to stop shopping here. I was sick and stopped in for medicine, Gatorade, soup, etc. The young man bagging my groceries was talking to the customer in front of me and put my bags in his cart. I did not realize this until I asked for my things. He ran after the prior customer to retrieve my things twice as he did not get them all the first time. He seemed to find it funny. I not feeling well did not see the humor in the situation. The store manager cared enough to call me when I complained so I let it drop there.
The number one reason for my low rating is the pharmacy. I recently gave them another try after many frustrating experiences with them in years past. Nothing has changed. The staff is rude and apathetic. Their lack of communication is my main complaint. Prescriptions are not ready when expected with no communication from them. They blame the doctor. As of this review I am still waiting on a medication I originally requested weeks ago. I found out they faxed the refill request to the wrong doctor, but even after the correction I still don't have the medication. At 7pm on a Friday night, I went to pick up my insulin (Type 1 diabetic) refill that was requested a week in advance. I spoke to my doctor's office that assured me they had sent them a new prescription. It was not ready, and they said the doctor had sent them nothing. I normally have no issues with my doctor approving my medication refills. I was out of insulin. They suggested urgent care of which most locations are closed at 7pm. Again, no communication from the pharmacy. My prior pharmacy (which no longer takes my insurance) helped me out by selling me enough from an existing prescription they still had on file to get me by until I could reach my doctor. At $126 for one insulin pen versus $25 per box of five pens it was not a pleasant experience. I will be switching pharmacies for sure.
name: Save Mart

text:
I stopped by this spot for a break from traffic when the 80 was stopped up on a road trip. It's a great spot with pleasant staff with good coffee but the smell of smoke is so strong it gave me a headache.  I don't know if it came in from the neighboring casino (doors wide open into the Casino) or if people actually smoke inside (Nevada so it might be legal...not sure as I'm a CA girl and we don't allow that here). 

When I first walked up no one greeted me. The manager was busy training someone new and I was getting a bit irritated and finally they took my order, the gal who did take my order and made the coffee was wonderful, it would have been nice if the other two would have helped her instead of hyper-focusing on their training tasks and leaving her to fend for herself. 

Good quick stop but plan on drinking your coffee outside if your are averse to cigarette smoke where you drink/eat.
name: Gold Ranch Coffee Bar

text:
Ok, I have to be honest.... port of subs is a staple in my family!! I've eaten at almost every port of subs in the Reno area. And I can honestly say this one is the BEST! 

What makes it the best?? The staff!!! They are always attentive, incredibly friendly, and quick!! Seriously they are the reason I will drive out of my way to go to this one!! 

There is usually a line, and it goes quick!  You can order on their app, and just run in and pick it up if you are in a hurry!  (Quick app tip, when you order on their app, it always says your order will be ready in 20 minutes. So make sure you build that time into ordering!) 

The food is always fresh! The staff is amazing!   This port of subs rocks!! Go check them out!!
name: Port of Subs

text:
Can't wait to go back!

The servers were attentive, personable, quick and informed on the menu. 

I happened to be staying at The Whitney Peak and wandered in to check it out. It's super interesting inside and though there's a lot of metal, wood and concrete, it still manages to possess warmth. 

Ordered a Manhattan and the server chose Benji to make it for me -- mind blown -- I'm a Manhattan snob and it was the best I'd had. Hands down. 

Ordered the spicy mussels appetizer and the salmon entree. Everything was perfectly seasoned, expertly cooked and beautifully plated. There is soul in the chef's preparation. 

Had breakfast here the next day (gargantuan breakfast burrito) that blew my mind and again the next day (chilaquiles) and both times I couldn't believe how beautifully flavored everything was. And how huge! Next time I need a +1 to enjoy it with.  I didn't think to take a photo of the day 2 breakfast. Both times were around 6:00am; the fact that anyone can make food this good and this beautiful so early in the morning is impressive!

When I left breakfast on day two I hollered thank you to the crew in the kitchen. The chef said, "Did you like it?" with a big smile and I said it was incredible and she's a rock star. She looked so pleased. So much heart in what she does! And all of the rest of the staff seem genuinely happy to do what they do and where. Lovely. Can't wait to go back!
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
If you are thinking about coming here for breakfast, I have three words for you. Stop, no and don't! 
I saw pictures of the food here posted online with the caption of "the best breakfast in reno!" So naturally my husband and I decided to try it out. I made reservations online for the following morning. This restaurant is located inside the whitney peak hotel. The ambience of the restaurant is gorgeous, hence the two stars. You almost forget there are meth addicts sitting right outside!
When we arrived, there were only 3 other tables in the entire restaurant, and I joked with the lady who was seating us, I am so glad I made a reservation! 

Our server came and brought drinks and took our order. They have a very limited menu here for breakfast but we don't typically mind, since it makes it easier to decide. I settled on a breakfast sandwich on brioche bun, my husband ordered a basic egg breakfast. Both of our plates were served with potatoes. 

Okay so the food... was not good. The breakfast potatoes were some of the worst potatoes I've ever had (aside from gray potatoes in oregon but that's another story). They were clearly old and had been sitting and I am pretty sure I saw them get those potatoes from the breakfast buffet for the hotel customers. You are literally paying for buffet food that's been sitting out for hours. 
I couldn't eat my sandwich with the bun, there was entirely too much bread to egg ratio and they covered my sandwich in American cheese... it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich than a breakfast one at this point. So gross. My husband didn't enjoy his meal either since everything tasted old. 

The worst part about shitty food is when the server disappears and leaves you sitting for 40 minutes. We almost walked out on our bill (which we shouldn't have even paid for because the food was trash). Finally after being frustrated we went to the bar, demanded our check and left. There was only 2 other tables in this place! Where did our server go? Do they serve the food then hide because they know it's awful? I feel like that's exactly what happened to us, so now I'm warning you to stay away.
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
Hands down the best port of subs in town! The 6ft trays are great for parties and you can choose from a variety of tasty sandwiches. We love the #8, turkey and provolone on white or wheat bread. The meats and cheeses are sliced fresh right before your eyes and the veggies (tomatoes, lettuce, peppers, olives, etc.) are all fresh and crisp. The bread is also made fresh daily and is so delicious. If you don't do gluten, they can make any sandwich into a salad or a sandwich wrapped in lettuce leaves.  My family enjoys the meatball sub and chicken teriyaki as well, which they can put of your choice of grilled bread. 
This is my kids favorite place to eat in town - we eat here several times a month. We also order trays of sandwiches several times a year for parties or gatherings. 
The staff is very friendly also and does their best to get your order completed as quickly as possible.
name: Port of Subs

text:
I came here for their very first Drag Dinner in celebration of Halloween and it was such a fun event! 

They had great finger food to munch on while watching the performances and their cocktails were amazing! I ordered the burger and the chicken tenders that night to have something to snack on the portion was perfect. This night their menu was completely different from their original menu however, I have dined here on a regular night and their food was still amazing! 

The Drag performance was definitely new to me since this was my first time attending a Drag show, but it had me blown away! I had such a great time watching all the performances and I know that these Drag queens spend countless hours perfecting their skit and you can see it through their act. I love how interacting they are with the crowd and overall, it was a fun experience. 

They often do Drag brunches which I haven't been to yet, but if it's as good as this then I definitely need to go one day. I highly recommend getting a group of friends together to sip on some mimosas and enjoy a good show!
name: Cafe Whitney

text:
Found this place on GrubHub and I really wish I hadn't. Where do we start... let's start with advertising in terms of menu...

4lb bucket of wings... HAHAHAHAHAHA NO!!!  25 wings was the count. Far from filling a bucket and CERTAINLY NOT 4lbs worth. Maybe they were before they were overcooked, dry, and practically brittle and inedible. Drown them in their bbq based hot or nitro sauces, which were also a joke, and you might choke them down. 

End result... into the vertical file!!!  

Cheese bread?  Hmm... prefab, previously frozen dough was the base, throw on some rubbery mozzarella and PRESTO!!  My granddaughter could have made this in an Easy Bake Oven!  At least brush some olive oil and garlic on there - try to impress someone... JUST TRY!

And celery sticks... try fresh celery... I BEG YOU!!!  You know how celery has that hard texture when it's not fresh?  You guessed it!  #FAILURRIFIC

Needless to say, dinner was ruined and neither the restaurant or GrubHub can fix it since they cannot be reached when GrubHub calls them to get my refund!

Stay away from this place. FAR AWAY!!
name: Ricco's Pizza

text:
I want some breakfast.  It's now 9:20AM and I'm hungry for some eggs.  So off to the Iron Skillet I go.  Ewww (in a good way) buffet.  Real slabs of bacon (not thin slice, but slabs) with biscuits, gravy, eggs, breakfast burritos, french toast, salad bar, etc.  And then I'm back for seconds.  

Love the ever flowing coffee.  

It's always good to hear laughter, the service folks having a good time and the greeting of people by their first names.  Makes for a much friendly experience and overall, it's a very positive atmosphere.

The waitress, Carmen, was great.  She stopped by to check how things were going and always came by happy.

As I eavesdrop, I hear the staff checking on everyone, making sure it's okay.  This is what service is about, being mindful of the needs of your customers.

PS.  And balloons for the kids at the booth across from me, lol.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
As a regular patron of Petro truck stops across the country I have to say this is one of the best Petros there is and of course as truck stops go, anyone who travels knows that Petro travel centers are the best.
 Now, this Petro does have its failings like alway running out of different items at the bar or off the menu but one that I found odd is that when you order a beer and an appetizer at the bar you have to pay two separate bills and then the poor girl manning the bar has to run to the restaurant to pay for your appetizer, back to the bar to have you sign the charge slip and then back to the restaurant to return the signed slip, odd.
 I think that if the bartender can order a food item from the bar, she should be able to cash it out there too! I also think it's time for management  to do the fix, it would save a lot of time and running you'd think.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text: I came to this establishment because my nephew remembered a cookie sundae that he had last year when we were traveling thru. I admit it was amazing. He was so sad they were out of it. And many others on the dessert menus.  What a bummer.   Our  waitresses greeted  us  promptly and brought menus and offered drinks to serve us She and the other server on the floor did a great job, but after watching them run their butts off  and serve all the customers i noticed they had no help at all.  Dirty tables  ect. I felt so bad for our little server named autumn   Who was amazing i must add.  I then asked her if she has a manager or supervisor on duty and low and behold she finally emerged from her cave!!!  I asked her to come here. I went on to tell her she was failing her team. Not one table was clean. No support system at all. Customers waiting to get a clean table. Servers still just trying to give great customer service.  But cant do it all.   I told her she needs to b a team player and set her crew up for success. Her first response was sorry i was on phone.  10 more minutes after speaking to night manager she still didnt lift a hand to bus a table or seat the customers. She flat threw her team to the wolves. More less sink or swim.  And didnt seem to care at all. The food was incredible. The salad bar was stocked and delicious  everything was amazing besides that manager on duty that didnt seem to help her team at all. At one point i even felt like i should get up and help them clear table.  AUTUMN YOU ROCK!!!!  Thanks for your great service  and for keeping a smile on your face even though im sure it was prob a night from hell!!!  Will definitely  b back. Iron Skillet Wells NV.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
We started out with the intention of going to Ernie's All American Burgers but they were closed for cleaning or maintenance. We had never been to Iron Skillet before and without an alternate plan of attack we decided to give it a try. 
At first glance, I was impressed with the cleanliness and bright, homey appearance of the dining room. It's a seat-yourself truck stop diner but they had a lot of sections closed so the seat selection was sparse. Once we were seated i tried to take of my scarf but soon realized that the restaurant was FREEZING! So I had to sit there bundled up while we ate (annoyance, but no biggie).
Our waitress, Susan, seemed friendly enough when taking our order. I had ordered the captain's seafood platter (deep fried fish, clam strips and shrimp) and asked for Cole slaw as I figured a whole plate full of fried seafood was enough grease for one meal. Susan kindly informed me that coleslaw was on the included salad bar (which has REAL bacon for bacon bits) and encouraged me to try something else, so I ordered mashed potatoes with brown gravy. He ordered the double bacon cheeseburger and fries. 
Our food arrived promptly and hot (here's where they start losing stars) but accompanied by our check. Although the check had a cute smiley face and a thank you, it was still a little rude in my book. About halfway through our meal our drinks started running low and I tried to catch our waitress' eye and she saw me, smiled, and promptly ignored me. I wasn't about to shout across the restaurant for more Dr Pepper. 
Now the food...I was a little concerned that my meal was overcooked at how dark the breading was but it turned out to be nice and crispy on the outside and hot and tender on the inside. I was most impressed by the shrimp as they were large and flavorful. I don't typically order fried food but the clam strips sounded so appealing! I was surprised the mashed potatoes were house made and although chunky and laced with bits of potato skin they were delicious and the gravy was not overly salty.  I had a bite of his burger and after imagining a tasty Texas toast burger from Ernie's I was disappointed in that the meat was lacking flavor and it was just an ordinary run of the mill greasy burger. The fries were pretty gross...tasted like the oil hadn't been changed in a while.
All in all it wasn't half bad for a truck-stop diner. My expectations shouldn't be so high for this type of establishment, but in my eyes there's no excuse for poor service. I'll probably be back to try their breakfast or to get a change from Denny's in the middle of the night. Not worth a drive across town but decent vittles if you're in that neck of the woods and aren't creeped out by some of the creep-o truck drivers dining there.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
I was lost in Sparks, which explains why at 8:30 am I found myself in a truck stop surrounded by more men congregated in one place than I have ever seen anywhere else in my life.  I needed to grab something to eat really quick, so I made the decision to go for the $10 breakfast buffet instead of ordering a la carte.  

The buffet was small, but adequate - bacon, biscuits with gravy, scrambled eggs, breakfast burritos, French toast, etc.  Had I been hungrier or the food better, I probably would've gone for seconds.  It was fine, but nothing that you wouldn't find at a high school cafeteria.  Or at Denny's.  

But it served its purpose and the staff were nice,
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
When I was in the army (years ago), I remember one of our marching songs: "the coffee looks like muddy water, and tastes like turpentine!"  That's what I think of when I drink the coffee at Iron Skillet; but you know what...I don't go there for the coffee.

The Iron Skillet does the best that can be expected of any place that is open 24 hours of the day and offers what they do - a hearty meal that is a lot better than fast food, and gives you plenty of energy, and the service is usually good.

If you're a trucker, or a crack-of-dawn rising chuckar hunter - and you're leaving Sparks and heading east - stop here to fuel yourself up. As a bonus, you can fuel your truck at the Alamo gas station right outside the door.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
Yes they let you eat here if you drive a Prius! This is a longtime truckers restaurant...part of the Alamo Truck Stop/Casino/Super 8 hotel on Greg St. But since this total restaurant overhaul, its the most upscale truck driver eatery I've ever seen...definitely the classiest 24 hour restaurant in town.

Great decor, an awesome salad bar (my reason for coming in) that is crunchy fresh at 3 in the afternoon. $8.95 for soup (2 kinds) and all you can eat salad including picnic concoctions like macaroni & potato, pea salad (favorite)...and have you ever seen a salad bar with....jerky? Yep, its here.
There's also a full menu lunch buffet for 10.95. Return? That's a big 10-4!
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
Crimony! People have really laid into this place lately! For cheap Chinese lunch, it hits the spot. There no need to complain so much when the prices are bargain basement low. I found the lunch special green pepper beef to be perfectly fine, and it was $8.00... what's the problem?

The service (I sat down and dined in) was very good, and I was offered WAY too many different sauces to choose from to dip my single egg roll in.

My only... beef... (sorry not sorry) is that the fried rice was dry. I think I'll survive though, as so will you.

Ease up, everyone. Sometimes "a cigar is just a cigar."
name: OA Chinese Food

text:
Sorta got stuck here over the weekend 
Not such a bad place to do a restart. 

Nice facility, clean, bar, decent food and friendly people for the most part 

If it weren't for the above mentioned pluses then it would have been a 1 Star rating based on the restaurant server

Omg!! 

Had dinner here Saturday and Sunday and the older (60 ish ) lady was obnoxious to say the least
I have no issue with someone having a good time. Or making the best out of their day but this lady was constantly singing to the point it not only irritated me. But also this around me. One other guest even commented. " never thought someone could destroy a Santana song "
Again. I'm normally fine with that sorta stuff but after running all the way across the US I wanted to relax. Not be irritated 

Ok. Ordered the additional meal or helping to go. First she added an entire second meal. This after I actually pointed to the menu. Then the to go order wasn't even correct. 
That was Saturday 
Today. Same dang server!!! Just can't win. Again the dang singing 
Ordered my meal with a beverage. Had one drink and got a to go box, she asked if I wanted a refill. I said sure. But to go
I go to pay. And there's an additional drink charge on my ticket. I ask the ringer if that was correct. She deleted it and away I went

I did leave a 20% tip both days but should have left a 20 cent tip

Dim witted lady needs to go!!
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
When I moved to Incline Village in the 90s, one of the go to spots was Mofo's. So, when I discovered that it added another location in South Reno, my wife and I were stoked. My youngest daughter had never heard of the place since she moved with us to Reno when she was 1 year old. 
Yesterday, we decided that it was time to introduce our daughter to a Mofo's pizza. The whole family is happy we did.
When I first viewed the menu my first thought was Incline prices for a Reno market might not fly. This idea let my mind as soon as we got home and opened the box. We ordered their combination and it was layered on in very generous portions. Each slice felt like a full meal. No skimping on the ingredients. While I like a crustier dough, I have no complaints when presented with fresh tasting toppings like they give you in the combo. 
What also truck me as being a major positive was that it didn't taste like a salt block. A number of the big chain pizza places have way too much salt for my liking. It felt like just the right amount to extract the maximum amount of flavor from each of the ingredients.
Will I go back? Of course, in a heart beat. My next visit though may have to bypass the pizza and try some of their sandwiches (meatball is my favorite). Welcome to Reno Mofo's!!! May you have a long stay here.
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text:
Excellent Food! The Ravioli Uovo is a must have appetizer for 2 - very rich and you must order bread to go with it or you'll leave too much deliciousness on the plate. We also had the riblets - also very rich so I'm looking forward to trying something else next time. The pasta carbonara was pepper forward and delightful. The pasta with sausage had really subtle flavors. The wine list was more than adequate. We did not see a cocktail menu, so not sure if there is one. 
My only complaints: if you charge for bread, make it REALLY good & don't be stingy with it. Last, the space it super small and crammed full. There is no way people aren't brushing against your table as they're seated. Although you'll have your own table, it doesn't feel like it. (The Kitchen Table) I was even handing plates to be bussed as the wait staff even has limited access to each table. That said, the service was super attentive, efficient & friendly.
name: The Kitchen Table

text: GREAT food! Quite possibly the best Kung Pao Chicken I've ever had and really awesome and flavorful Egg Drop Soup with mushrooms in the broth. Sweet and Sour Chicken was practically ALL Chicken and Sauce; if you are not a lover of onions or pineapple making up the bulk of the sauce, not to worry. Decently priced, friendly staff and the new management has really turned the old restaurant around with brand new beautiful renovations. Give them a visit and you will be back again. One thing I must request, though: add Paper Wrapped Chicken to your Menu and you are golden.
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text: I don't do too many reviews but felt it worthwhile to review The Kitchen Table. A group of 6 of us went within a week of them opening. Upon entering, we were greeted by the owners who were very warm and welcoming. They designed the restaurant to feel the same. We were impressed with the food, cocktail a d wine menus. We ordered cocktails, appetizers, entrees and desserts. All six of us loved every fresh bite! The prices are reasonable for the high quality food and experience. We went back a few nights later with a couple who are considered "foodies." They fell in love with TKT as well. Of the four couples who have been, we've now all taken other friends who also fell in love. My husband and I are returning this evening. We can't wait!!!
name: The Kitchen Table

text: An incredible little find in Reno. Heard about the place from a friend. Met a group of friends there to try this new restaurant  out. Very clean and modern decor, we were greeted and sat immediately. We ordered a bunch of appetizers to begin with. The sausage pizza, calamari and olives were great, but the blue crab pizza was awesome. Had a few bottles of Italian wine that were terrific.  I had the  bolognese, excellent, the fresh homemade pasta and the perfectly balanced meat sauce totally reminded me of our trip to Italy. Being that we were in a group of friends we got to try a lot of different dishes. The bavette steak someone ordered was incredible as well as the chicken saltimbocca. I'll be getting one of those next time I go. Finally we got the buttermilk panna cotta/berries for desert,  so good. Alll in all  it was a fantastic night of dinning in what felt like a small neighborhood restaurant. I can't wait to go back.
name: The Kitchen Table

text: MOFO's pizza has been a my go to place since the 80's.  Growing up in Incline I loved going to MOFOs in the Christmas tree village shopping center.  And now MOFO's has come to South Reno, Gelena to be exact.   Less than a mile from my house, know have a new favorite pizza spot.    Good is great, customer service is great, and I can't beat the location.   Other than Truckee Bagel the Raley's shopping center has lacked any sort of good food places to go.

text: Ive never tried this place and its so close to work, i thought it would be a damn shame if i didnt try them. Im glad i did! I ordered the Mongolian beef, with fried rice AND chow mein. I didnt know you could order it that way, their menu doesnt mention that option. I also ordered some fried prawns too. WOW! The fried prawns were delicious! Great breading, crunchy and the shrimp inside was substantial and juicy! Seriously, the fried breading was fried to perfection! Will order this again. The Mongolian beef was delicious too. The sauce was tangy and great, just enough salt and spices to make it a real treat. The beef was perfect too, seriously tender, just about the most tender Mongolian beef i have had in awhile. The chow mein was pretty standard for fast food Chinese, pretty good but nothing out of this world. The most disappointing part was the fried rice. It seemed like it was old, and a bit stale. I ate it, but it didnt strike me as being made fresh. Just dry. All in all, this place was awesome though! Next time i will try the steamed white rice instead.
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Let me start by saying that the atmosphere and people are great! The food and drink need some work.
If your going to make a martini and serve it in a champagne glass and charge 14 bucks you should make sure it' filled to the rim!!! Not half way 
Wasn't worth the money, and I've been in the business for 20 years. 
The chicken saltimbocca was good but definitely not worth the money. They use chicken thighs which is fine but had no veggies or starch along with it. chicken thighs are cheap so charging 24 for a few chicken pieces  is not the way to go. Same with the fried chicken, nothing special but a glorified chicken fingers.
On the other hand, the pizza is great! Expensive but good. 

We will give it another shot, but they have some work to do if there going to compete in this market. There are some amazing Italian places in Reno that have a better menu, pasta and pricing. I wish them luck !
name: The Kitchen Table

text: Alas, the search for good Chinese food in Reno continues. The service was great and the place was really clean and sanitary. I will say that you get a lot of food for your money, especially if you get the OA combo plate (which comes with a meat of your choice, served with egg fried rice and/or chow mein). I got the sweet and sour pork for my plate, expecting some nicely marinated pork strips but instead was met with some fried balls of what tasted like corndog batter with not very much pork in them at all, drowned in sweet and sour. Maybe I just missed the mark with what I ordered, but I don't think I'll go back there.
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text:
Came in with my wife yesterday excited to check it out. We were seated immediately by the young lady hostess. As there were only one other couple in the place we figured there would be next to no wait. We were wrong. 

One of the owners stood 10 feet away from us talking to a couple that had finished their meal. Apparently they knew each other or their families knew each other and they enjoyed their conversations. We were completely ignored for 10 minutes. 

This was extremely disappointing not only because we were hungry we were truly interested in having a new pizza place to frequent. To run a business successfully as an owner you need to be responsive to your customers! Ignoring people when no one else is in your restaurant will not produce positive results and unfortunately, we will not return.
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text:
5 AM is too early... But I really needed to have some food. Decided to go with the cowboy steak and eggs. Described as hand cut Sirloin. 

That sign out front said to seat ourselves. We sat down and waited for about 10 minutes. Finally I sent my daughter to look for someone. I know it's 4:45 AM and they're probably not used to people coming in. Once we found a server, she was personable enough. It took a fairly long time to get our food. It is kind of surprising as we were the only customers for about 15 minutes. The server came by and asked us how things were going, and I told her it would be really nice if we could actually get our food. About five minutes later, the waitress came out with some food and I was quite happy. She passed our table and brought bacon and eggs to the table behind us... he came in at least 15 minutes later than us .  The waitress apologized and said 'look, I can see your food in the window' she walked away and the steak sat in the window for 5 more minutes. We saw her bring another person their breakfast.

I was still optimistic. Unfortunately as you can see in the picture they sort of forgot the eggs! Then also view the steak, we ordered medium rare, and as you can see it is well done. No pink whatsoever. Then finally the pancake was a bit burned. 

The only thing that made this a 2 star instead of 1 star was the head chef came out and gave my daughter a whole pumpkin pie for her birthday. When he saw the steak was well done, he voided the check. 

Since the manager was so attentive, we will definitely try this place again!!
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
This Chinese food restaurant just opened in the Raley's shopping center at McCarran and Mira Loma.

It appears to be a family business. 

They young person behind the counter takes money and then packages food after opening it to see what it was without washing hands.  It was kind of gross to watch. 

Our order took a while because they are disorganized. As I said they had to look inside each take out box on the counter with people coughing and staring at the food to get the orders straight.

I think the same thing happens probably in the back when you pick up take out but at least you hope the people have clean hands and it isn't on a dirty counter.  It is not like the food touches anything but it just seemed weird. 

When I got the food home the beef and broccoli appears to be steamed broccoli and the beef was gray. It was inedible. I also got the vegetables which weren't too bad just kind of bland. The sweet and sour chicken is nothing more than breaded fried chicken with sweet and sour dipping sauce on the side. I was expecting pineapple, onions, peppers. The fried chicken was okay but the sweet and sour sauce was like red food dye and sugar water. 

I gave them two stars because maybe it will get better the longer they are open. I am hoping they get it together because I miss the old Chinese place that was in that spot.
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text: Excellent food and excellent service! When I'm Reno check it out. We shared a few dishes and appetizers and everything was excellent. Great wine selection as well.
name: The Kitchen Table

text: We stopped at Mofo's on the way home from Mt. Rose. We read several good reviews about the new place and we were excited to try it. The food was good, the service was also good. The problem, however, was that we all, four of us, got very sick that night after we got home. We didn't go anywhere else, do anything else, or eat any other food. We all had severe stomach cramps followed by everything we ate coming back out, both ends, quickly. We have been dealing with this for about a day now and it has not been fun. We were all very happy with the food when we ate, but we will not be back again. Beware if you eat there, hopefully they will figure out what the culprit was and get it resolved.
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text:
Let me start off by saying I typically don't enjoy Chinese food. I'll eat it if that's what's being served or what the group wants, but if you asked me where I want to go, I will literally never say "oooh how about Chinese!"
That being said, I actually enjoyed OA Chinese -- specifically the chow mein and the cashew shrimp, and would choose to have those again! 

The chow mein was flavorful without being too greasy, a really good portion size, and it was a nice noodle to veggie ratio, in my preference (I like more noodles!). The cashew shrimp had a really generous serving of actual shrimp, and the zucchini still had texture rather than being a mush blob too.

On the other hand -- the sweet and sour pork has been all over the board for us. Once when my parents ordered it, the pieces were all like dime sized and hard as a rock. Another time they were like ping pong ball sized and a bit mushy.

On the plus side again (compliment sandwich), they really take transit time into account when boxing your food--all the sauces for fried things are served on the side so nothing gets ruined and mushy while you drive home! The staff is also really friendly, and it seems like a family-run business. The menu has a ton of variety, and if I can find something I like, I bet anyone can!
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text: This is a bistro style small plate place. We came here on the recommendation of a friend from a wine bar. He said that they have a good selection of by the glass and by the bottle. We found a couple of glasses that we liked. The place is small but cosy. The outside tables were closed for the winter. The staff was attentive. We never felt forgotten. We started with the friend zucchini. It was nice and crispy on the outside. My friend enjoyed her sausage pizza. I had the brevete steak. It was done right and was tasty. I got a side of fries with truffle oil. It was huge, at least for me. I took some home and put them in the convection oven the next day. Overall it was a good experience.
name: The Kitchen Table

text: I hesitated to post ~ selfish that I want this gem to stay a little gem. This place is wonderful. The ambience is nice, the staff is truly "team" mentality with everyone checking on you. The ravioli uovo appetizer with soft egg yolk, spinach, ricotta, truffle oil, brown butter & Parmesan is a flavor explosion. Roasted beet salad with goat cheese, arugula, pistachios, tomatoes & a vinaigrette is delicious. The chicken saltimboca is filled with fabulous flavor~ prosciutto, mushroom & sage & the chicken is so moist & tender. Mushroom risotto is so tender, creamy & a beautiful sauce. Fettuccine carbonara with Parmesan, egg yolk, shallots, pancetta & black pepper is absolutely delicious & creamy. All pasta is house made. The panna cotta for dessert filled with just the right amount of vanilla & a smooth as silk texture finished our night. Can't wait to go back.
name: The Kitchen Table

text:
I couldn't decide what I wanted for lunch, and since this place was perfectly tasty last time I decided to come back. After experiencing the dry rice last time I decided to try their chow mein that comes with the "pricier" lunch specials (less than $10). There's no soup or egg roll, and since I thought I was hungry I ordered a side of 4 vegetable egg rolls. Way too much food it turns out, but I'm glad I tried it. The Mongolian beef had a little too much ginger and salt in it for my taste, which was a sharp contrast to the green pepper beef I tried last time. I think I'll stick to that one in the future. On the positive side, the rice today was delicious -- not dry at all. The chow mein was probably my favorite part of the meal, and I do enjoy the very simple egg rolls here. They have hot mustard, which I love, and the service was beyond what I ever expect for lunch. Give this place a try!

Edit: I also want to point out this restaurant's CLEANLINESS and attention to detail. I observed the woman taking orders and serving me wash her hands repeatedly after filling orders or taking payments. Customers rarely think about this critical aspect of food service, but you want people washing their hands all the time in this industry. They have a hand wash sink directly behind the register, and they use it! Thank you for protecting my health!
name: OA Chinese Food
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Chinese

text: Probably one of the best Chinese food in Reno. However, it's not as good as what I'm used to. Chowmein is really greasy and fried rice was dry but it wasn't bad. The restaurant is tiny and there are 4 dining tables which 2 of them were taken by the restaurant owners kids each I believe.  One was sleeping, the other was playing on the iPad on each dining table. My family wanted to dine in and ordered drinks thinking we were dining in, but they brought our food to go so I'm guessing dine in wasn't allowed but they did not let us know. With the covid restrictions and limitations to the capacity of restaurant. I just feel that the kids should be seated on one table as there were no room for customers to order and wait. There were 10 people total in the dining area so everyone had to stand around and wait, and no one was 6 ft apart. I might be back if I'm in the mood for Chinese food. Put up a sign saying "No dine in" if customer can't eat there.

The Pot Stickers were good, nice size and full of flavor.  The General Chicken was fresh and tender, the flavor was average, could use a little more spice, the Fried Rice was just warm, not hot like everything else, it was actually disappointing. text:
As I was leaving work a couple of days ago, I noticed the sign for Mofo's. I pulled over and parked and pulled them up on my phone to see if they were open yet. I was pleasantly surprised that they were. I hadn't even noticed anything going in to that space yet! I perused their menu and finally decided on a mini pepperoni and mushroom pizza and an order of hot chicken wings. I called to place the order and was told it would be ready in 10-15 minutes. I was quickly greeted upon my arrival. My food needed a couple more minutes so I chatted with the hostess while I waited. She said they had just opened the day before and that they were hoping to be able to offer delivery in another month or so.

My food came out and I left. Pizza is one of those things that is best when it's hot so I dug in while I was driving home. Oh my goodness! The pizza was absolutely delicious! The toppings were fresh and the sauce was tasty. It was loaded with LOTS of melty cheese. After I got home I opened the chicken wings. Plenty of ranch dressing and the wings had a nice buffalo flavor. I was not disappointed. Unfortunately, I finished everything before I even thought about taking pictures. 

I'm so happy to have a pizza option in the area and am thrilled with the quality of this place. Definitely worth the drive even if you don't happen to live or work nearby.
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text: WOW, I am just shocked at the negative reviews!!! Living in Hidden Valley for over 44 years, I have watched businesses come and go in our East Reno Mira Loma shopping center. SO, when a very good one comes along I try to frequent them as much as possible. That being said, I cook and love to cook, SO a restaurant better be worth my money. OA is that family owned and run restaurant. Place your order, walk next door to Raley's do your shopping, pick up OA Chinese food, BAM what could be easer. I personally have NEVER had a problem or complaint. The food at OA has ALWAYS been GREAT, yes GREAT. The restaurant is SPOTLESS. The staff is friendly, courteous, knowledgeable and professional.

text: PLEASE RAED PEOPLE !! I've been coming here for a bit and honestly all the bad reviews don't do this place justice.   Yes it's a small spot, yes the food takes a bit to come out. I've hade the house chow mein many times as well as sides of the barbecue pork and the fried rice, that's my go to order and for the price the you get a great amount and quality a** food it's a very tasty place to eat. text:
My husband and I have come to the conclusion that yelp reviews are not always reliable since businesses have learned to solicit and reward good reviews so when I write them they are honest and not changed (despite requests) but maybe updated for good service when a mediocre review was posted (I will always leave my honest review up but comment on how the establishment went out of their way to reach out to me).

That was long winded so here is the review after date night
Above average ambiance with gorgeous lighting, cozy table that are close together but not so close as to feel
You cannot have a private conversation 
Very attentive and professional service. Made wine recommendations and allowed us to try several before settling on very unique choices you don't see everywhere
Food is very good.  Uovo appetizer, chicken saltimboca were excellent, bolognese was very good, salad very good, apple dessert very good.  Might pass on the breaded mozzarella next time
We will be back

text: I placed an online order for lunch today @ 11:50pm got a confirmation and pick up time of 12:15pm. Got there a few minutes early explained to the young girl I had an online order for pickup. text:
Had dinner here last night. This is such a great addition to our neighborhood. Started with the Ravioli Uovo. This was amazing! Rich, creamy, decadent! Then had the Fritto Misto. This was unique and delicious. It had not only the usual seafood but also olives and fennel. We filled up on the appetizers but went on to try the spaghetti with clams. Lots of
Clams, fresh made pasta and a delicious, light, fresh tomato sauce. My husband decided to try the Crab Pizza. This was the only dish I wasn't a total fan of as I think I would have been better to go for a more traditional pizza instead of crab. There was nothing wrong with the pizza but I think I'm more of a traditionalist when it comes to pizza. I was very curious about the crust as the website says it is made with wheat, rice and soy flour. Let me say, it did not disappoint. The crust was lovely! After all that we did not have room for dessert but the panna cotta looked amazing and is definitely on my list for next time. Highly recommend this place. Food is fresh, creative, innovative and most importantly.... delicious! It's a small place so be sure to make reservations.
name: The Kitchen Table

text:
We visited The Kitchen Table last Thursday on the 9th day it was open.  I wanted to check it out because my friend works there and I haven't seen her since before COVID. 

She sent me the restaurant info and I liked what I saw online and we decided to come check it out. 

When we arrived the dining room was full, but there were seats at the bar which is what I wanted because my friend was working behind the bar that night.  She went over the menu with us telling us details about each item.

As a starter we chose the Ravioli Uovo as an appetizer. It was delicious and unique. 

My dining partner chose the Chicken Saltimbocca as his entree. It is prepared with thigh meat and he says it was delicious. 

I had the Bavette Steak which is served with an Arugula salad. The steak was prepared perfectly and was very flavorful and delicious as well.

We are looking forward to our next visit as there are several other items on the menu that we want to try. 

Be sure to check it out!
name: The Kitchen Table

text:
This is hands down the best pizza in Reno. So glad they opened a Galena location! My husband and I used to work at the Incline location and have loved their food since we were kids. It is a great local family business that serves delicious pizza and pasta with a friendly family atmosphere. Trust me - give them a try! 

Must have items - garlic cheese bread, garlic chips, Firenze pizza and home made ice cream!

text:
We are loving this new addition to the neighborhood!
My husband is from Incline Village where the 1st location is housed. He was excited to see this one pop up right near our home! The ambiance is nice. I like that you can watch them toss the pizza dough and make the food through the picture winco into the kitchen. The decor is very Tahoe, decorated with warm wood accents. The signature marinara and meatballs is a savory dish that doesn't disappoint. The wings are generous and tasty too. The BBQ chicken pizza with jalapeÃ±os added is delicious! This will definitely be a go to hot spot for us!
The service is friendly and the prices are reasonable. It seems to be busy but they are holding down the fort with ease. We are happy to see a local legendary business thrive!
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text: I'm a self proclaimed pizza snob. I grew up on the east coast so I expect a lot from my pizza... flavorful cheese, light tangy sauce, thin, foldable, chewy, airy crust. Mofo delivered all of that! I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious it was and gobbled up 3 slices all to myself. The wings were decent - plain, crisp, well sauced. The salad left a bit to be desired but that's okay. I came for the pizza and pizza I did enjoy! I opted for takeout but the restaurant itself is adorable and inviting. GREAT addition to south Reno dining scene. I would travel for this pizza! Definitely in my top 3 Reno pizza joints!
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

categories: Italian, Restaurants, Pizza

text:
We came here a little before 4pm on a Friday afternoon and were excited to try this new pizza joint!  I am a HUGE pizza guy and knew I needed to check it out after reading the reviews.

We arrived and were immediately greeted by a young lady and provided menus.  Since we arrived between the typical lunch and dinner we weren't surprised to see we were the only people in the restaurant.  

We looked over the menu and my wife decided on the house salad with blue cheese dressing and three of the Mofo Meatballs.  I chose the small meat lovers pizza  with extra sauce since I find most places do not put enough sauce for my liking.

My wife's food arrived first and looked yummy - she enjoyed it but she mentioned that she felt bad that I was watching her eat and she wished she would have requested that her salad and meatballs come out at the same time as the pizza.  

My pizza arrived a short time later and also looked delicious!  It is New York style with the thin foldable crust and thick outer edge. I really liked the dough and felt the amount of sauce was perfect.  

While we were there a steady stream of to-go orders came in via phone or in person and several tables sat down as well.  It appears they will have a good business in South Reno!  

We will be back!!
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena

text:
This place was forever bookmarked on my places to try. Iron skillet itself was located in a mini casino attached to a motel rest stop for truckers. The layout of the Alamo reminded me of my childhood road trips with my family, except  this place had the fancy showers and laundromat.

Iron skillet itself had such a cozy feel to it and our waitress was super nice, she had such a homey feeling to her. I ordered the country fried steak with a side of pancakes, the BF ordered a hamburger. The food came out on a pretty cool looking skillet and the food was hot. Everything we ordered was good, no complaints. The country fried steak was crispy, well seasoned, and the gravy was not at all plain. The hamburger was cooked as we requested (medium) and it was well put together.

Overall we were happy with this place and will be back for some good, simple, cheap eats.
name: Iron Skillet Restaurant

text:
Great restaurant!  I'd recommend it anyone! I can't wait to come back and try more if the menu! 

The restaurant just opened 4 days ago, so we were expecting a few hiccups.... But boy we were wrong! This place already is running like a well oiled machine! The staff is friendly and efficient! The food was wonderful! The decor was a cool Tahoe vibe!  My daughter was obsessed with watching the guys making the pizzas, they were flipping and spinning each pizza, it was awesome! You don't see that anymore! We ordered mozzarella sticks as an appetizer, and a half cheese half pepperoni pizza. The mozzarella sticks were fresh and flavorful!  The pizza marinara sauce with the mozzarella sticks was wonderful!  The pizza was fantastic! The crust was thin under the sauce and cheese, but think around the edge! A perfect combo!  The pepperoni was a little spicer (not a bad thing) then "typical" which was wonderful to balance out the sweetness of the sweet sauce!  There were quite a few customers in the restaurant, but the staff was still very attentive and fast. 

We are already planning on coming back to try more things on the menu!!  While I can't review the Italian menu... yet, the pizza was wonderful! The place was clean, the staff was fast, and the food was wonderful! 

Check Mofos out! Its worth it!
name: Mofoâs Pizza And Pasta Galena
